loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Yoni nació en la ciudad de Marcapata provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Yoni vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y su hija de un año de nacida. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Yoni es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 23 años, que abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en una habitacion alquilada y está ubicado en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. A Yoni la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo, Yoni que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es abrir más tiendas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yoni was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Yoni currently lives with her husband and one year old daughter in the city where she was born. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Yoni is a humble young woman who is 23 years old. She opened a small grocery store in her rented home. It is located on Libertad street in the city of Ocongate. Yoni can be found in her store seven days a week from eight in the morning until ten at night. With the next loan Yoni hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things that her store does not have. She has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to open more stores. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Chom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chom S. is a 33-year-old woman married to Mr. Phat Sophea, who is 32 years old and works as a construction worker. They have a child, who just a year old. Chom is the leader of a group loan who was selected by its four members located in Trapeang Chak village, Kandal province.

Chom earns a living as a seamstress in a garment factory. With both of their jobs they are able to earn a small income that supports their family. In order to increase their income and improve the family’s standard of living, Chom decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this new business they hope that their family’s life will improve.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Matthew A. is in his mid-forties and is married with two children, aged 12 and 9. Matthew operates a small food shop that he has been running for 10 years. The shop is open daily between 12 am and 11pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Matthew’s 3rd 'Motisha' loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A 'Mothisha' loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term would have ended. He used his previous two loans on increasing shop inventory, and both have been successfully repaid. He aims to use his third loan on buying more land. Matthew’s dream is to one day build a house for himself on this new land.

 

Matthew will share this loan with his loan group, White, which has 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

 

In the picture, Matthew is seen in the first row, on the left, wearing a black suit.

loans.use: To buy land to one day build a house

loans.name: Think Big Group

texts.en:
Stephen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Think Big.  He is 32 years old, single, and has one child who is four years old. He is a junior student at a local university.

For 10 years, he has been selling bags, used towels and t-shirts in Duala Market in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 100,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of bags, used towels and t-shirts. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose dream is to improve his business and  build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of bags, used towels and t-shirts

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina F. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. This will be the second loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product line

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha B. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (four relatives: sisters and brother).

Aisha has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and motorcycle for hire.

The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include transportation and the rainy season, which makes village roads impassable. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to built other rental rooms. Aisha lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Vanancio

texts.en: K. Vanancio is 33 years old and he has been running his agricultural business in Rukungiri for 5 years. The business has been bringing in 240,000 UGX for him. Vanancio is married with 2 children. He says that he will use this loan to pay for the upgrading of his banana plantations. He is also involved in the sale of soya beans, other beans, etc.

loans.use: to upgrade his banana plantations

loans.name: The Nargis Maqsood Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis lives in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in a small housing colony named Arshad in a two-room brick house. Nargis moved there 10 years ago. She is divorced, and her family’s financial responsibilities are on her shoulders, although she has a daughter who supports her financially by working in a factory and earning a monthly wage. Nargis lives with her brother who is a property dealer. 

Nargis operates a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from wholesale markets in Lahore and sells them to different shops in Riwind and also to local customers.  She is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy larger quantities of a wider variety of clothes to improve her sales and income. Nargis is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this is her second application. She has good credit and has never missed a meeting.

Nargis is hopeful that this investment will make her business more profitable and that she will be able to build a dowry for her daughter’s marriage with her profits. In this photo, Nargis is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food vending business for the past five years, selling at the market, from door to door and from home. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During dry hot season the availability of food stuff for sale in the market is inadequate and the demand is high while during cold winter season the supply of food is high in the market and demand is low. She hopes to own a café business in the future. 

With the 15000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Humberto C. M.  tiene 19 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis Humberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Luis Humberto C. M., 19, is single and living with his parents in Monacache Canton, Rios Province.  He has no children.  The members of the V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE Group, located in Santa Sofia enclosure, earn their living in short-season agriculture, especially corn, rice and beans, spending a great deal of time at their work.  Luis Humberto also grows corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his supplies in the Comercial Briones and sells his products in the Comercial Vaca y García.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice, and beans.  This loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities.  They face challenges such as infestations and diseases, and weather variability.  His dream is to buy a house and land.  He enjoys sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Adiba's Group

texts.en:
Adiba is a hardworking lady by nature. She stitches footballs to financially support her family. She receives orders from different football selling shops and fulfills the orders on time to earn income for her family. Her husband is a transport loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to deliver the items from one place to another. He has been operating this business for over 10 years. Through his good services, many customers approach him to deliver their items to their destinations.

Abida has 3 sons and a daughter. Her 2 elder sons are tailors by trade and sew men’s clothes. Her third son studies in 2nd standard while her daughter is only 4 years old. Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has gotten rough and rotten from constant use. He can’t put heavy loads in it and, as a result, his business is suffering. 
 
Abida is hopeful that a new cart will help her husband deliver more loads and to provide better services to his clients and make more income. Abida is a new loan user of Asasah. She is very confident that this step will bring good profits to her husband. She lives with her family in the area named Kalar abadi which is located in a city named Gujranwala. Gujranwala is a mid-sized city in Pakistan and known for its rice industry.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Dolores Eulalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los pagos son cómodos y fáciles de cumplir. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de  edad, su hija vive en su casa y  estudia en universidad. Su marido es chofer.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Su hija le ayuda con las ventas ya que lleva los productos a la Universidad donde ella estudia y les vende a sus compañeras de clase. Nos cuenta que los perfumes y la bisutería es lo que más vende, aunque dice que todo se vende porque es un gran producto.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Sus sueños son tener una boutique y que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo -- the capital de Manabí province, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds" -- the members of the "Risen Christ" Communal Bank hold their meetings. 

Dolores is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments have good terms and are easy to fulfill. She is 43 years old and has a common-law husband. She has two children from this relationship who are already grown. Her daughter lives at home and attends the university. Her husband is a driver. 

She is a housewife, but to obtain her own resources, she works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day of the week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week or every two weeks, according to her customers' desires. Her daughter helps her with the sales, taking the products to the university where she studies and selling them to her classmates. She reports that the perfumes and costume jewelry are most popular, although she says that everything sells, because they are great products. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Her dreams are to have her own boutique and to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: Buying creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Las Damas De La Colosio Group

texts.es: El Nombre de este grupo es Las Damas de la Colosio, en mención a la colonia donde viven  y por ser  todas unas Respetables Damas, El Grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Quintana Roo, México y está conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Francisca Acuña C. es una de las integrantes del grupo, la señora tiene 46 años de edad y estudio hasta la primaria, ella vende frutas y verduras, tiene 3 hijos; dos mujeres de 17 y 14 años y un varón de 11 años. Comenzó su negocio de Frutas y verduras desde hace 3 años, ella solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así satisfacer sus necesidades, ya Q. es la única recatería en la colonia, ella vende las frutas y verduras más frescas y nutritivas. Con este préstamo la Señora Francisca espera ampliar su negocio y poder surtirse, y de las ganancias Q. generen poder apoyar a sus hijos para Q. terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Damas de la Colosio” [The Ladies of the Colosio] in honor of their colony and because they are all well respected ladies. The group is from the Quintana Roo State in Mexico and is made up of 11 members. Mrs. Francisca Acuna C. is one of them. She is 46 years old and attended school until the end of elementary. She has three children, two girls who are 17 and 14 and a boy who is 11 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.

She is requesting the loan to stock and enlarge her business, better serve her costumers and provide a necessary service since her produce retail store is the only one in the colony. She sells the most fresh and nutritious fruits and vegetables. She wants to be able to support her children and provide for their schooling.

loans.use: To stock her business up with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. accesorios para celulares, vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 4 años D. edad, residen en Jucuapa departamento D. Usulután,  este negocio D. María está ubicado en su propia casa, no tiene un horario fijo y para iniciarlo tomo un curso donD. aprendió la reparación D. los móviles. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. accesorios como baterías, estuches, tarjetas entre otros, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, atender más clientes y mejorar su vida cotidiana, las aspiraciones D. ella es tener un negocio fuerte, ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María, who sells mobile phone accessories, lives with her husband and 4-year-old son in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután.  María runs her business out of her own home and does not have fixed working hours.  Before setting up her activity she took a course in mobile phone repair.

She is requesting the loan to buy accessories such as batteries, cases, cards and other items.  This investment will help her improve her business, proviD. better service to customers and improve her family's lifestyle.

She aspires to making her business strong so she can proviD. a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Bich T. N. is 33 years old.  She lives with her 3 children in Kinh No village. She operates a small grocery shop from her house, selling many kinds of products  such as wine, rice, beer, etc.   Her business has developed well since she received a loan from our credit program in 2005.   Bich earns 100,000 VND daily in profit from this shop, which helps her cover family expenditures. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Van T. N. is 35 years old and has 2 children. She raises ducks for eggs. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy feed.

Ha T. B.  is 45 years old and has 2 children. She grows fruits trees and raises chickens for meat. She needs a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy feed and fertilizer.

Thinh T. N. is 47 years old. She raises chickens and ducks for meat. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to  invest in her shop

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Рахимова Зулфия проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж, находится в России на заработках. Сама Зулфия занимается пошивкой женской одежды. То есть она шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Целью кредита является приобретение новой швейной машинки для вышивки.
texts.en: Zulfia R. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Zulfia sews women's clothing. She makes national Tajik dresses. She has been in this business for two years. The purpose of the loan is to buy a new machine for embroidering.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for embroidering

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en:
Eva Marie is 40 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva Marie has a business venture making and selling food in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more ingredients to expand her business.

Eva Marie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Señor De Huarancayo Group

texts.es:
Marisela 49 años D. edad, casada, 2 hijos D. 16 y 14 años respectivamente. Socia D. la alcancìa comunal: "Señor D. Huarancayo", en la provincia D. Jauja - Huancayo.
Marisela tiene como negocio venta D. comida en su casa; adicionalmente tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes al costado D. su casa.
marisela tiene a sus 2 hijos en edad escolar y aùn son dependientes.
El prèstamo solicitado es para comprar al por mayor vivires y productos D. primera necesidad para su restaurante.
(En la fotografìa Marisela esta vestida con casaca color gris y polo color negro, esta al medio y en la parte del fondo D. la foto)
Los socios que no se encuentran en la foto son: 
- Nancy D. Y., no estuvo presente por encontrarse laborando;
- Ediecilda Marinez C., no estuvo presente por estar D. viaje;
- Edgardo C. T., no estuvo presente porque llegò tarD./ estuvo trabajando.
texts.en:
Marisela is 49 years old, married, and has two children aged 16 and 14.  She is a member of the "Señor D. Huarancayo" community bank which is located in Jauja, Huancayo.

Marisela's business is selling food in her home.  She also has a small grocery store next to her home.  Marisela has two school-age children who are still dependent on her.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy food products and essentials (wholesale) for her restaurant.

(In the photograph, Marisela is wearing a gray jacket and a black polo shirt).

The members who are not in the photo are:
- Nancy D. Y. - who couldn't attend because she was working
- Ediecilda Marinez C. - who couldn't attend because she was away
- Edgardo C. T. - who couldn't attend because he arrived late / was working.

loans.use: to buy food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Шерматов Ибодулло проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его дети работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама он имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. В этой области работает 12 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян риса, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Ibodullo S. lives in Shahrituz. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His children work on a small farm. He has a vocational education as a driver.  He has been working as a driver for twelve years.  He also farms. He primarily grows vegetables and grains for sale. He has been farming for more than ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, chicken gizzards, beef, rice, flour, eggs, beans, soft drinks and charcoal.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en la comunidad de Acteopan, tiene 28 años de edad es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo Imanol de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora jarros y cazuelas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar la materia prima como el barro, la leña y la greta,  ella inicio con su negocio hace 10 años sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar el barro desde pequeñas y con un ahorro que tenía guardado en su casa compro el material y comenzó a elaborar los jarros y las cazuelas, para ella es muy importante su negocio porque es el sustento y puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y du su hijo para que siga en sus estudios , ella eta orgullosa con este trabajo porque es herencia de sus papas y le gusta ver que sus jarros y sus cazuelas le quedan muy bonitas, ella sale a vender a las ferias de Tepetlixpa, Ameca meca, ella tiene la esperanza de que su negocio siga creciendo y no falte nada en su casa y que su hijo siga estudiando, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudarnos en nuestro negocio para que siga adelante “. San Marcos es bonito la mayoría se dedica a elaborar la loza o la alfarería, siembra  maíz y sorgo en tiempos de lluvias”.
texts.en:
Margarita, 28, lives in the community of Acteopan.  She is a single mother of a ten-year-old son, Imanol; he is in elementary school.  She is a potter; she makes jugs and pots.  She asked for her loan to buy raw material like clay, firewood and “greta” (chemical mixture based on copper oxide and lead). 

She started her business ten years ago with her parents who taught her how to mold clay when she was still a little girl.  She used a few savings she had at home to buy raw materials and started to make jugs and pots.  For her, the business is very important because it’s the legacy she got from her parents and she likes to see that her jugs and pots turn out to be very beautiful.  She goes out to sell them at the markets in Tepetlixpa and Amecameca.  She has the hope that her business will continue growing and that she’ll not want for anything at home and that her son continues going to school.  

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for helping us so that our business can continue making progress.” San Marcos is pretty; most of its residents are potters and during the rainy season they farm corn and sorghum.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood and "greta" to make jugs and pots.

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is 45 years old and married with six children. All of them are getting their education from a local school. Her two elder sons operate a hosiery business along with their education to be able to afford their education fee. 

Ulfat also makes shirt collars to order and earns a reasonable amount of income from her business. The earned income helps her pay utility bills. Besides her business, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband operates a sanitary supplies business. He also offers his customers sanitary fitting services as well. He makes deals with different people who are looking for sanitary work for their homes. 

Ulfat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her collar-making business. With the loan, she will buy cloth and thread for making collars in larger quantity to be able to fill orders on time and earn more profit. She has been operating her business for the past three years and hopes it will improve further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy cloth & thread for shirt-collar-making business.

loans.name: Campamento Group

texts.en: Jorge, Norma, and Alis, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the “Campamento” solidarity group in June 2011. Jorge has made a living through cultivating vegetables and livestock for the past 50 years. Jorge owns several acres of land where he mainly grows beans and corn. He also raises cattle. Jorge is requesting a loan of LPS. 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide. The other group members, Alis and Norma, make a living though agriculture and selling clothes, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sarah  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years.  She also earns more income from selling frozen foods.  

Margie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to upgrade tools and equipment and buy stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: upgrade equipment and buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Chester Danilo

texts.es: El señor Chester , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su papá , don  Chester desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña que junto a su padre lucha día a día para  llevar el pan a su vivienda , don Chester se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva  ya que con estos financiamiento  inducen el cultivo de piña ,  dando como resultado una buena producción y logro vender el producto en un precio bueno , el cual obtuvo el  beneficio  de comprar una camionetita usada para trasladar su producto al mercado y no  tener que estar pagando para  sacar el producto de las tierras donde las siembran .
texts.en:
Sr. Chester is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to support his father. Don Chester has been growing pineapple for several years. He and his father strive each day to provide for the needs of their household.

Don Chester is very pleased with the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. The loans have helped him with his pineapple crop, resulting in good production and the ability to sell his crop at a good price. With the profits he earned, he was able to buy a small used truck for transporting his product to market. He no longer has to pay someone to transport his crops once they have been harvested.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
This is Emelyn, 30, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rommel, a farmer, and is a mother of two children. Together with her husband, Emelyn manages her own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Emelyn operates a river spinach farm. She grows river spinach, or kang kong in our native language, in their farm located in Cavite.  River spinach is easy to maintain and grows where there's a lot of water. The tender, hollow stems of kang kong are used in cooking as well as its leaves.  It can be stir-fried, steamed, boiled, or lightly fried in oil. Emelyn sells her product to market stalls that she regularly supplies and also to the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales each day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000. She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs for her business, and for the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Emelyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, materials, and maintenance needed in her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 53 and  married with three children all schooling.He lives with his family in Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he  has been farming for 15 years and currently produces potatoes, maize, wheat  and beans which are are sold locally.

Moses has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his children  as well as to construct a modern dairy unit. He plans to expand his farming by buying  more parcels of land.

Moses says poor road networks and  unreliable rainfall are a challenge to farmers

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 63 years old and married with seven children. She is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Editha grows rice and corn crops and vegetables on her land. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Editha hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.en:
Luz Mary is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

Luz Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Luz Mary has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Luz Mary aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto has the drive and attitude to succeed.  He raises and sells hogs and also has a rice farm. He sells hogs to the butchers. 

He wants to maintain his businesses so he can provide for his family and education of his five children.  Edilberto is 50 years old and married. 

Edilberto is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed, vitamins, medicines and vaccines for his hog, to ensure proper growth and nutrition. 

Edilberto would like to see all his children finished school with a degree so they can obtain good jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, medicines and vaccines for his hog to ensure proper growth.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 31, married and has one school-age child. She owns and manages a general store, while her husband works for a private institution. They aim to increase their income to support the education of their children and save for their future. Sometimes she encounters problems due to competitors and calamities, but she is not discouraged; she considers them as challenges in life. 

Rosemarie aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy frozen foods, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, snack foods and beverages to sell in her store. She believes that she will be able to increase her income through her patience and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, snack foods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, solicita nuevamente un préstamo, porque siente el deseo de incrementarlo, comprara pollo, carne, maíz, condimentos, con esta inversión espera dar continuidad al crecimiento del negocio, y ofrecer a los clientes una mejor una atención.
Las condiciones económicas de María y de su familia, han mejorado, así como los clientes están más satisfechos con la prosperidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan because she wants to expand her business.  She will buy chicken, meat, corn and condiments.  With this investment she hopes to be able to continue to grow her business and offer her customers better service.

The economic situation of Mary and her family has improved, and her customers are very satisfied with her more prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, corn, and condiments for her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La socia Luz Marina actualmente sigue con su negocio de envio de encomiendas como pasteles, tortas en empaques especiales para que lleguen en perfectas condiciones, la socia también esvia verduras a Puerto Maldonado y algunos recados que le piden alla y la socia compra y los envia, algunas veces ella msima los lleva y le pagan los envios que han hecho, le hacen todo tipo de pedidos como granos, pasteles, tortas, telas, platiqueria, verduras, maíz entre otros, la socia trabaj con una empresa de buses y ya la conocen, ella en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos que en Puerto Maldonado no hay y los mismos que siempre envia a sus diferentes clientes, la socia invertira el prestamo en la compra d epasteles, tortas, granos, telas, verduras. La socia desea seguir creciendo y reunir un ahorro que le permita pronto hacer un negocio propio y con local establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues with her business filling orders for goods such as pastries and cakes which she sends in special packages so that they arrive in perfect condition.  She also sends vegetables to Puerto Maldonado as well as other goods that they ask her for there.  She buys the goods and sends them.  Sometimes she takes the goods there herself and they pay her the shipping costs involved.  People make all kinds of orders with her for grains, pastries, cakes, fabric, plastic goods, vegetables, corn, etc.  Luz Marina works with a bus company who know her.

On this occasion, Luz Marina would like to invest her loan in buying products which cannot be found in Puerto Maldonado and which she always sends to her different customers.  She will invest her loan in buying pastries, cakes, grains, fabric and vegetables.  She would like to continue growing her business and save some money so that she can soon start her own business in established premises.

loans.use: to buy pastries, cakes, grains, fabric and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, es conviviente con Liborio, fruto de esa unión tienen cuatro hijos de 25, 23 21 y 18 años de edad, habitando todos juntos una casa que es de su propiedad. El negocio de Rosa consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas que realiza en su propia casa, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas frías como les agrada a sus clientes, por el clima caluroso de la zona, iniciándose con un capital propio y además que ya contaba con la refrigeradora, se animo a iniciar su negocio, hace 4 años, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención de los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que con el sueldo de vigilante de su pareja no les alcanzaba, logrando aumentar su capital y reinvirtiendo en su negocio, a logrado crecer el volumen y variedad del stock  de sus productos. Por lo contario, comenta que no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido pues eso hace disminuir sus ventas por esos días, pero eso no la desanima, pues sabe que es algo de la naturaleza, y tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio, queriendo abrir un fuente de soda en su casa.  Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en préstamos anteriores. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, pues considera  a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas en mayor cantidad y a menor precio, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 44, is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is in a common-law relationship with Liborio and they have four children (ages 25, 23, 21, and 18). They all live together in their own home. Rosa’s business involves selling soft drinks from her home. She has a refrigerator where she keeps her products cold for her customers since the weather in the area is warm. Four years ago, Rosa started this business with her own capital and already owned a refrigerator. She was excited about getting this venture off the ground. Her children help with attending to the customers whenever she is not at home. Rosa enjoys this business because she is able to generate an income so that she can help her partner with the household expenses. He does not earn enough money from his salary as a security guard.

Rosa has been able to increase her capital and reinvest in her business, which has grown in volume and in the variety of products available. On the other hand, she dislikes the rain because her sales diminish on those particular days. However, she does not get discouraged because she knows that it is a part of nature. Rosa has plans to grow her business by opening a soda fountain in her house.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Rosa hopes that this small loan will enable her to complete her objectives. In addition, she promises to complete her payments just like she did with her previous loans. Rosa feels comfortable with her Communal Bank because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people. The amount of 1500 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks in bulk so that she can get a lower price. This will enable her to have a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Florida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Florida has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old, married to Thomas and has eight children. She has been a tailor for the last 16 years and earns a monthly income of 10,400 KES. This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET of 20,000 KES. She plans to use the loan to purchase textiles and sewing accessories for use in her tailoring business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children.
In the future Mary hopes to grow her business in various parts of the country.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Antonia has a party shop that provides sound system services for special occasions. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy materials needed for maintenance of the sound system for the service.

Antonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for maintenance of the sound system for the service.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa is a 30 year old married woman. Hafsa is a conservative woman. Due to cultural reasons she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet, so the photo is of her husband.  She is a mother of 3 children. She lives in Baqa'a, Jordan. 

Hafsa is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD in order to buy more melamine items and housewares for trading purposes.

loans.use: to buy melamine items and housewares.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a businesswoman in Sindangan. She is 43 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Ann runs a retail store selling Venetian blinds made of  bamboo, commonly used in Filipino native houses. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for her business. Ann believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a busy lady, caring for her six children and also managing the family farmstead, which includes raising ducks, chickens, and production of various crops. She is also a very active community member and won a grant for female entrepreneurs last year. Two years ago she decided it would be profitable to construct two greenhouses in which to grow produce for sale and for her family’s consumption. With the metal frames erected and covered in heavy-duty plastic, her summer crop of tomatoes and winter crop of radishes both flourished and sold well at the local and regional farmers’ markets. Ana and her family use a tractor and a tank trailer to fetch water from the village fountain to irrigate their crops, just one step in a labor-intensive production system. This year, however, the poly-plastic greenhouse covering reached the end of its life expectancy and began to deteriorate. Ana now needs a loan to buy and install new covering over her greenhouse frames and also to make small repairs to the farm’s tractor.

loans.use: Greenhouse materials, tractor repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
The money will be invested to buy products such as flour, eggs, sugar and yeast necessary to bake the items Mr. Mayorga Alaníz sells (cake, pastries, bread, etc.).

El capital lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como Harina, Huevos, Azúcar, Levadura y otros productos necesarios para elaborar los productos que vende (queques,repostería, pan)

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
Facing the lack of employment in the country and the need to support his family, Jose Antonio decided to start his own business. With his savings he bought 10 sets of tables and chairs, and the fabric to make table cloths. For two years he has been renting these goods in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas where he lives with his wife and two children.

Antonio and her older son work in the business. Together they have managed to pull through and promote their business in special event venues.

Antonio wishes for his business to grow, for which he needs a loan of $275. He will use the loan to buy more chairs and tables and extend his services to a greater clientèle. He is committing to pay back the loan in 5 to 10 months.

With your help you can contribute to the growth of this business and improve the life of this family. Don't think about it twice, make your mind to support him!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Ante la falta de trabajo en el país y la necesidad de mantener a su familia, José Antonio decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con unos ahorros que tenía compró 10 juegos de mesas con sus respectivas sillas y tela para hacer los manteles, ahora se dedica al alquiler de estos bienes desde hace dos años en la ciudad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, donde vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Antonio y su hijo mayor laboran en el negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante y promocionarlos en salones y eventos especiales.

Antonio desea que su negocio pueda creer, para eso requiere de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mobiliario para extender sus servicios a una mayor cantidad de clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlo.

loans.use: Purchasing chairs and tables

loans.name: Jhanina

texts.es:
Jhanina L. Murguía has been married for 12 years and is the mother of four. She hawks used clothing at the "16th of July" Market in El Alto. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for 6 years and currently serves as president of the Villa Adela chapter. A new law will soon prohibit the importation and sale of used clothing which means Jhanina urgently needs to liquidate her inventory. She needs capital to rent a stall in the market and hire people in order to speed up sales. In the meantime, Jhanina will be searching for a new line of business with which to support her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Jhanina L. Murguía, hace 6 años socia de Pro Mujer y presidenta de la asociación Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto, casada hace 12 años y madre de 4 hijos, tiene un puesto ambulante de venta de ropa usada en la Feria 16 de Julio de esta ciudad. Jhanina necesita de capital para comprar un puesto dentro del campo ferial que le permita una mejor venta de su mercadería, tomando en cuenta que por nuevas disposiciones gubernamentales se prohibirá la importación y comercio de la ropa usada. A tal efecto, Jhanina necesita capitalizarse para la compra de un puesto y la contratación de dependientes que agilicen la venta de toda su mercadería mientras ella se capacita para incursionar en nuevos rubros que le permitan obtener el sustento diario para su familia.

loans.use: To rent a market stall and hire salespeople.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah M. is 30 years old. He is married, and has three children aged nine, six and three years. He also takes care of his brother in law who lives together with his family. They reside in Kayole, an informal settlement on the Eastern side of Nairobi. 

Jeremiah started his hardware shop in March 2007. Before this, he was employed in a hardware store since 2004, after which he decided to open his own shop. Jeremy (as his friends call him) was not new to business, since he had tried his hand at running his own business immediately after he had completed his high school, back at home in Kisii, in Gucha District. There, he started a small shop at his home where he sold an assortment of fruits and vegetables. However, he felt that he could do more in order to get a higher income, and that is when he decided to come to Nairobi to build his business. While in Nairobi, he lived with his uncle, and he immediately started off another shop selling potato chips (fries) and bananas. Once this business picked, he left it for his wife to run, and it continues to run today. He often helps his wife in the shop in the evenings before closing for the day. 

Jeremy now runs a hardware shop that he started off early this year, using some savings amounting to Ksh. 200,000 (USD 3075) that he had put aside from his chips business, together with some of the money he got from his previous employment in the hardware shop. As the business grows, Jeremy has found that he needs to have more stock in his shop, since there is an overwhelming demand from his customers who are mainly carpenters, drawn from the environs of Kayole. Since his operational capital is quite low, he finds that he is not able to buy goods in big bulk, hence he misses out on good discounts. At the same time, he is forced to travel often to the centre of Nairobi City in order to provide what his customers require. 

Jeremy is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1175, with which he intends to buy additional stock for his business, including wood, ply wood, paints, veneer, block boards, velvet materials, cushions and nails. He believes that this loan will enable him to have a higher operating capital, and hence enable him to buy more things in bulk.  He will also spend less on transport, and of course will receive better discounts. He intends to repay the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase hardware materials including: wood, ply wood, veneer, paints etc.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Sr. Inocencio A. is 48 years old and lives in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay, with his wife, Jorgina Garay, 54. The couple has three children, two of which live with them while attending school. 
Inocencio sells fruits and vegetables in a unique way. Ever since 1986, bicycle has been his sole means of transportation. Every day early in the morning, Inocencio bikes to the city of V. Hayes, where he meets with merchants and other regular clients. They depend on Inocencio for daily fresh fruits and vegetables. 
Inocencio also supplies the markets of Clorinda, Rca., Argentina, with his produce. He travels there in the afternoon four times a week and returns later, ready to begin his journey again the following day. The sacrifice he makes by making this long journey on a routine basis is worthwile, since fruit and vegetable sales is Inocencio's sole work and source of income. 
Sr. Inocencio has asked for a small credit of US$225 to allow him to buy more and better quality produce to respond to his loyal clients' needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Edah

texts.en:
Edah is 32 years old and the mother of a child aged 15. She sells beverages such as mineral water, soft drinks, etc. She can earn US$ 15 per day. Her husband, B., is a laborer who only earns a small income.

Edah has to work hard to help her husband cover their family's needs. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to buy more goods for her stall and she's willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more beverages for re-sale

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Helena C. is 49 years old. She is widowed with five children, who are between the ages of 16 and 31. In 1999, Helena established a grocery business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store in bulk

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanu Maiya S. is a 30 year old lady who lives in Chappagaun, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dil Krishna S. opened their meat shop 4 years ago. They sell chicken and buff meat in their shop. The demand for meat is increasing rapidly in that area. Therefore Mrs. S. is requesting her second term loan of Rs 15000 to buy chicken and buff meat for her shop.

loans.use: To buy chicken and buff meat

loans.name: Tunuh's Tunajiamini. Group

texts.en:
Tunuh is 26 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 14 years old and 6 months. Tunuh owns a small grocery store that she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling batique selling, food, cloth and soap.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Amina's Muamko Group

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 17,15,12 and 7 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 22 years old. Amina owns a small food store and shop, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Husna and Ziada, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. Rose is a food seller, which she started in 1999. Every day, she works from 12 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Arowosaye

texts.en: T. Arowosaye is business oriented. She is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells building materials. This is a skill that she learned for 2 years and she has been in this business for years since then. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more inventory. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Kayi Suzanne

texts.fr:
Born October 4, 1975 in Lomé, Mrs. Kayi Suzanne F. is married and the mother of three children. She is a dynamic woman who has opened up a store selling sewing notions in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. She buys her inventory at the big open-air market in Lomé so that she can satisfy the needs of seamstresses and tailors in her neighborhood which is 10 kilometers from the big Lomé market.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up by buying a carton of buttons, a carton of zippers, and some poplins.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 04 octobre 1975 à Lomé, Madame F. Kayi Suzanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a crée un magasin de vente des articles de mercerie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle achète ses articles au grand marché de Lomé afin de pouvoir satisfaire les couturières et tailleurs de son quartier distant de 10 Km du grand marché de Lomé.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire le stock par l’achat d’un carton de bouton, d’un carton de fermeture et des popelines.

loans.use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat d'articles de mercerie

loans.name: Regina Bayiyana's Group

texts.en:
Regina Bayiyama is the leader of a group of five women.  She is 55 and widowed with five children.  Her youngest child is in school while the eldest four are married and working.  Regina lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Regina has been sewing and selling charcoal for the last 10 years.  She travels to the village to get her supply of charcoal and then sells it to families in small quantities. The greatest challenges Regina faces are thieves, floods and competition.

Regina plans on using this loan to purchase more charcoal.  Since she began working with MCDT, Regina has been able to purchase lorries of charcoal rather than just sacks.  This increase in stock has allowed Regina to garner more profits.  She has used this increased revenue to pay her children's school fees, to expand into selling roasted chickens and to purchase a house.  

Regina hopes to continue diversifying her businesses by one day expanding into selling dried fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 40 years old, married and has three children. For the past eight years, Toyin has been selling Nigerian soup ingredients like dry pepper, crayfish, local seasonings, and melon seeds. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more soup ingredients to allow her to expand her customer base. Toyin is very happy with her business but would like to see it grow so she can better provide for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more soup ingredients for sale

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit U., 59, and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Khan, 61, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three children have full-time employment. One daughter also studies in a local school.

Mr. Tit has been a wooden house builder for ten years. He does farming as well. His wife grows cucumbers and melons in the farm near the house. Tit is requesting a loan of $500 to build one restroom for use by his family.

loans.use: To build one restroom for use by the family

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Requena Nº 122-A, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo la ayuda en su negocio. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de canchita.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, anticuchos, refrescos y canchita, para ello tiene el apoyo de su hija y esposo. Vende en diferentes eventos como ferias o cuando llega cualquier orquesta musical.   

Con este préstamo de S/3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 kilos de corazones de cerdo, 11 paquetes de chorizo, 5 pollos, 4 kilos de maíz morado, 4 kilos de arroz, etc. 
  
Teresa trabaja con mucho entusiasmo para apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the "Las Mujeres de Éxito" [Successful Women] communal bank located at Jr. Requena Nº 122-A in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 49 years old and has two children whom she still supports. Teresa is married, her husband helps her with the business. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of popcorn.

At present Teresa sells food, skewered meat, soft drinks and popcorn; her husband and daughter help her with this. She offers her goods at various events like holidays or whenever an orchestra arrives.

She will purchase 10 kg of pork heart, 11 packages of sausage, 5 chickens, 4 kg of purple corn, 4 kg of rice, etc. with the present loan of 3000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 5 months.

Teresa works enthusiastically to support her daughters’ studies. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for offering support to her.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork heart, sausage, chicken, purple corn, rice, etc.

loans.name: Chhai Leang

texts.en: Mrs. Chhai Leang T. was born in 1971 and now lives in Trapaing village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her business is doing well and she would like to expand it with a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kray Chan Sovantha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Chhai Leang T. is a mother of three children, one of whom is a duck breeder while the others help their parents. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn C. is a villager in Krodas Khor village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice to earn a living for her family. On this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her crop more productive, thus increasing her rice revenue.

Her husband, Mr. Koeurn Ky, helps her on the plantation. Mrs.Thorn C. is 38-years-old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Agnes sells "gari" which she uses cassava to produce. The raw cassava is milled and the starch extracted from it. The milled cassava is then fried to become "gari". It is popularly eaten in the country around Elmina, and she has been selling it since 1990. Her husband is a cleaner at the university of Cape Coast.

Agnes uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Agnes will use this loan to increase her working capital to buy cassava in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

In the picture, the sacks contain the cassava dough which is used for making "gari".

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy cassava in larger quantities

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 51 years old; she is widowed with ten children. Unfortunately two passed away in an accident; two are in school and the rest are fully independent. Her husband died four years ago after a brief illness.

Akosua has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and has sold foodstuffs such as bananas and plantains for the past eight years to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm fruit. The raw palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil that is sold. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to her palm oil business, Akosua also sells fruit such as bananas and plantains by the roadside in the community where she lives. She says her business has slowed down due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her capacity to produce oil in larger quantities. She wants the loan for the purchase of bananas and bunches of plantains so that she can supply to her customers on a regular basis.

Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mpa Aba’ which means "God never gives up". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more palm nuts and bananas to restock her inventory

loans.name: Latifan Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Latifan baji is a 47 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Latifan baji married a man whose name is A. S., and he is a cobbler by profession. Latifan baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons work in a bakery as salesmen on monthly wages. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school which located near their house. Latifan baji is applying for a loan for her elder son because he wants to become an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and for this he requires an auto-rickshaw. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Hassan baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Aide

texts.es: Aide tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, su nuera y su nieto. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa colocando un pequeño mueble a manera de bar. Este negocio sólo atiende los sábados y domingos porque ella trabaja en una institución como secretaria desde hace 27 años, por lo que su hijo y su nuera se encargan de su negocio durante la semana y ella lo atiende los sábados y domingos. Le es muy rentable porque está ubicado en una buena zona y sus bebidas heladas se venden a diario. Posteriormente quiere complementar su negocio con la venta de comida o de lo contrario distribuir cerveza a otros negocios que se encuentran cerca de su zona. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Trabajando juntos” y si le gusta ser parte de éste porque los miembros demuestran mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más bebidas, y así implementar su negocio con lo necesario para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aide is 55 years old. She's a single mother and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. For two years she's sold drinks in a space she prepared in her house by arranging a small piece of furniture to serve as a counter. She only takes care of this business on Saturdays and Sundays because she's been working as a secretary in an institution for 27 years. Her son and daughter-in-law are in charge of the business during the week, and she runs it on the weekends. It's very profitable because it's in a good location, and her cold drinks are sold every day. In the future she'd like to expand this business by selling food or distributing beer to other businesses nearby. This is her sixth loan with MFP. Her communal bank is called "Trabajando juntos" (Working Together), and she enjoys being part of it because the members are very responsible. She will use the requested loan to purchase more drinks and stock her business in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of drinks

loans.name: Tororo Road Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Rehema is aged 31 years, married with 8 children and 1 step-child. She buys foodstuffs (hotel items like bananas, rice, milk, meat, fruits, sweet potatoes, cassava) and she has been in her business for 7 years. She is active, manages to take care of her family as well as herself, and helps pay the children's school fees. Her dream is to buy some land and construct tenant houses to help her kids in future.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es socio del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Alfredo es soltero y tiene 30 años, Alfredo es técnico dental de profesión, tiene un laboratorio dental en un local alquilado, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Alfredo necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales dentales,
Los sueños de Alfredo son ahorrar para el futuro y estudiar odontología.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a member of the Bienestar communal bank. He is single and 30 years old. Alfredo is a dental technician and has a dental laboratory in a rented location. He adquires his products in the city of Lima. Alfredo needs a loan of 1050 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of dental materials. Alfredo's dreams are to save money for the future and to study odontology.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dental supplies

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C. is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 50 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 6000 Philippine Pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Jose Arístides

texts.es: Jose Arístides B. vive en el municipio de Guazapa departamento de San Salvador, Jose vive con su esposa y su hijo. A sus 61 años Jose sigue trabajando con la ayuda de esposa y  también su hijo han logrado sostener y sacar adelante su negocio;  la familia posee un molino que tiene ya 12 años de dar servicio, ahora Jose ha ampliado su negocio ya tiene un pequeño inventario de paletas y por las tardes la esposa de Jose hace tortillas para vender, mientras los dos hombres de la casa Jose y su hijo se encargan de los clientes que llegan al molino. Jose solicita este crédito para hacer una inversión en su negocio del molino.
texts.en:
Jose Arístides B. live in the Guazapa municipality of the San Salvador department. He lives with his wife and son. At 61 years of age, he keeps working with help from his wife and son. They have managed to maintain and get ahead in the business. The family has a mill. They have been providing services for twelve years. Now, Jose has expanded his business. He has a small inventory of popsicles. In the afternoons his wife makes and sells tortillas while the two men of the house, Jose and his son, take care of the customers who come to the mill. Jose is asking for this loan to make an investment in his milling business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Guazapa, en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.use: Invest in his mill

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is a 48 year old woman from the village of Kiwalan.  She is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children.  Norma makes a living by operating her own food stall in the local community, selling a variety of food products.  She has been doing this for over 26 years.  It is her main source of income and she now earns approximately 3000 PHP per month in sales.

Norma joined HSPFI in 2009 in order to improve her living situation and her business capabilities.  She is requesting  a first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she intends to use for expansion of her food stall.  She plans to use future profits on improvements and the further expansion of her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao by offering them access to financial services.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: María Marcelina Juárez O. tiene 47 años. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Anteriormente se trabajaba en una empresa de conversión ocupacional. Por lo que no fue mucho el tiempo en el que se permaneció en este trabajo con el poco dinero que logro recaudar, decide incursionar en el negocio de ofrecer mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Y ha logrado mantenerla, ya que fue por medio de este negocio que sus hijos estudian. Además María tenía la facilidad de ofrecer sus productos porque ella  tenía muchas amistades y fue por ellos que logro adquirir cada día más clientes. El dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior camisetas, pantalones y faldas. Su deseo es mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She is married and cares for 2 sons. Previously, she worked in an occupational conversion business. She didn’t stay long in this job due to the little money she earned, and she decided to get into the business of selling general merchandise. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. As a result of her success, her sons can continue with their schooling. Maria has been able to sell her products successfully because she has many friends, and through them she adds more customers each day.

Maria is applying for a loan for working capital which she will use for the purchase of footwear, underwear, T-shirts, pants and skirts. Her desire is to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Muok

texts.en: S. is 55-year-old and is the mother caring for five children; all five of whom are attending school. She currently works in a private hospital as a nurse, while her husband is a local barber. Recently, S.’s husband faced the fact that his barbering shop is often cracking and not attractive to the customer, effecting his ability to earn money. Because of this problem, S. is looking for a loan for her husband’s business to repair/decorate the existing barber shop to be more attractive.

loans.use: To repair/decorate her husband's barber shop to be more attractive

loans.name: Sandra Angelica

texts.es:
la sra SANDRA ANGELICA A. QUEZADA tiene un negocio de fotocopiado, trabajos secretariales y venta de utiles escolares.
inicio operaciones hace 14 años y desde entonces ella y su esposo han sacado adelante ese negocio.
Tienen 2 hijos 1 de los cuales cursan la secundaria.
El ser uno de los primeros negocios de este tipo que se establecio en trojes le ha permitido tener muy buena clientela y tambien la excelencia y responsabilidad en los servicios prestados a su apreciable clientela.
entre los clientes que ella tiene son alumnos, maestros de los diferentes centros educativos diseminados en los diferentes lugares aledaños a la zona urbana de este municipio.
La Sra.A. nos solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia, darle un mejor surtido a su negocio.

Nos comento que estaria muy agradecida de contar con el apoyo finannciero solicitado.
texts.en:
