Sandra Angélica A. Quezada has a business making photocopies, doing secretarial work and sellling school supplies. She started operations 14 years ago and since then she and her husband have kept the business going. They have 2 children, 1 who is in secondary school. Being one of the first businesses of this type in Trojes has allowed them to have a very good client base and also the excellence in the service they provide to their valued customers. Among their customers are students and teachers in different schools in the located in various places close to the city limits of this municipality. Mrs. A. is asking for a loan to buy merchandise so that she can better stock her business. She is grateful to be able to count on the financial support requested.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper in a variety of sizes (letter, legal), pencils, notebooks, white-out, toner, ink, etc.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona está casada con el Sr. Porfirio tienen dos hijos  menores que estas cursando el nivel medio en un colegio del estado. 
Ella es costurera tiene un pequeño taller de costura. Petrona estudio corte y confección cuando aún vivía con sus padres.  
Su marido le ayudo con su trabajo a comprar sus maquinas, ella también trabajaba con una amiga y así junto un poco de dinero para ayudar a su marido. 
Hoy día ella es una profesional en su trabajo todo tipo de prendas de vestir. 
El Sr. Porfirio es asalariado trabajando en una empresa privada como vendedor y de esa forma le ayuda a la señora con los gastos del hogar, 
Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus compromisos
texts.en:
Sra. Petrona is married to Sr. Porfirio. They have two dependent children who are starting the next grade level at a state school.

She is a seamstress who owns a small sewing workshop. Petrona studied dressmaking while she was still living her parents. Her husband supported her business by purchasing her machines. She employed a friend of hers who is working to earn a little money to help support her husband.

Today Petrona is a professional at her work and is capable of making all types of clothing. Sr. Porfirio is a salaried worker at a private business. He works as a salesman and is able to help his wife with the household expenses. Sra. Petrona has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her financial commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different types of fabrics

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
N. Purevjav is 59 years old. He lives with his wife, two sons, and his granddaughter in a single ger (a yurt or Mongolian nomadic tent home) in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His sons currently attend university. 

Purevjav operates a mobile food service business in his town, with the help of his wife. The business is very family oriented because Purevjav and his wife make all of their food and drink products at their home and then deliver them to their customers. 

Purevjav started his business in early 2009 with 80,000 tugrugs (~$57 USD) of capital. He has worked very hard and has found success in a short time since starting the business. Currently, his working capital exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~$280 USD) 

This success has allowed Puravjav to provide for his sons' education. He said, "Education is the most important thing that one must possess in order to have decent and happy life." For the future, Purevjav hopes to continue to grow his businss and provide a quality life for his family. His dream is to one day open his own cafe in his town.

He is requesting a loan of 700,000 tugrug (~ $490 USD) to purchase supplies for his mobile food service business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his mobile food service business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 47 year old dairy farmer who lives and runs her business in Gitaru Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last ten years and hopes to increase her stock to ten dairy cows. Ruth is requesting for her fourth loan of Kes. 50,000 after successful repayment of three loans to enable her buy an additional cow. A mother of four, Ruth hopes to be a key supplier of milk in Gitaru area. She describes herself as successful and blessed.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Sanka Yuri Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Sanka Yuri”, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas  de dos años, se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal  Collpani, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Celia es la actual presidenta, afirma que gracias  a Pro-Mujer, hallo  la opción de iniciar un negocio propio, esto le permitió apoyar a su familia con los gastos que tienen en su hogar. Este grupo tiene diferentes negocios, por ejemplo, Petrona vende comida, Albertina tienen una librería, Lucia vende mantas tejidas en lana de vicuña, Reina elabora y vende comida rápida.  Todas afirman que necesitan créditos para la compra mercadería o insumos.
texts.en:
The Sanka Yuri Association has worked together with Pro-Mujer for over two years. They meet every other week in the Collpani focal center, located in the city of El Alto. Celia is the current president, and says that thanks to Pro-Mujer she encountered the opportunity to start her own business which has enabled her to support her family with household expenses. This group has various businesses. For example, Petrona sells food, Albertina has a bookstore, Lucia sells blankets woven from vicuña wool, and Reina makes and sells fast food. All state that they need loans for the purchase of merchandise or supplies.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise or supplies

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 30 years old and a married mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She has a green grocery business selling maize, beans, grains, and vegetables and has had her business for four years. She now has one employee and hopes to be able to expand into a wholesale food supplier. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to increase her inventory.
She describes herself as hardworking, committed, and loyal and says that since joining Faulu she has been able to increase her income enough to pay educational fees for family members.  


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Hatibu

texts.en: Hatibu A. L. is a married Tanzanian small-business man with two children. He runs a business selling music CDs to customers. He purchases the business goods from wholesale suppliers and sells to retail customers. He has been in the business for five years. The income from the business is used to meet his family's daily demands and for business capitalization. His business plan is to open a wholesale shop. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to top up the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Her husband sells bicycle spare parts in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Veronica is a trader. She trades in infants’ layette – a set of clothing and accessories for a newborn baby. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Veronica has been in business for over ten years and would like to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of layette in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy children’s wear.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima owns a chocolate shop where she makes special designs and decorated chocolates to customer request. She has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has become well known in her town and the surrounding area. Rima is asking to borrow $1,200 USD to buy more accessories and products in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and products for her chocolate business

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 2 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Son activité lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is a 30-year-old married mother of 4 children. For 2 and a half years, she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene. She raises cattle and sheep. Her business provides her with an income that allows her to participate in taking financial care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella G. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Shiella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shiella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Shiella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shiella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Shiella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Shiella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase processed products from neighboring villages to resell them in large towns.

loans.name: Khémess

texts.fr: Khémess G. est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis juillet 2007 et a reçu 5 fois de suite du crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de maintenir son activité d'embouche bovine. Elle participe à l'amélioration du cadre et des conditions de vie familiales en soutenant son mari dans les différentes charges.
texts.en:
Khémess G. is a married woman who is 53 years old. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE since July 2007 and has had five consecutive loans. Her new loan will allow her to sustain her beef fattening business. She is contributing to her family's living conditions and environment, by supporting her husband in covering the various expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her beef fattening activity more easily

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is an entrepreneur who does business in rice and pig farming. She manages a 3-hectares rice field and a piggery. She said that her business is going well because of the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She’s been a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner, since 2008. 

She is currently asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to continually support her business. She supports four children in her family. She is determined to do her best in providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane R. is from the village of Research Minante, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Mary Jane is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Jane is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
José was born in the town of Beira, in the Sofala Province, in Central Mozambique. He is 44 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are 14, 12, 9 and 6 years old. All of the children go to school. He only went to school until the 8th grade. He wasn't able to finish school because he was drafted for military service. He lives with his family in his own house and doesn't support anyone else. He left Beira to go to Maputo after completing his military service in 1986. He moved there alone and later established his family. Upon completing his military service he started working for the Ministry of the Interior as a driver. He doesn't have any employees and earns 7.820.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses. He manages to save some money in his savings account (Barclays Bank). He has requested a loan with Millenium Bim Bank and later decided not to continue to request loans. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were already partners of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, is his fourth. The previous loans were for 7.700.00mt, 12.000.00mt and 14.000.00mt, all invested towards the same goal. One of his biggest goals is to finish his house in order to provide better living conditions for his family. He intends to request more loans to invest in finishing his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer
texts.pt:
José A. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique tem 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 14, 12, 09 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Beira para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar em 1986, veio sozinho mais tarde constituiu sua família em Boane. Depois da desmobilização entrou no Ministério do Interior afecto como motorista, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 7.820.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária (Barclays).
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, tijoleiras, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.700.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 14.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.  
Um dos seus maiores projectos é concluir a sua residência para oferecer melhores condições de Habitabilidade a sua família. Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua obra.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (paint, bricks, cement and others)

loans.name: Kae

texts.en:
Mrs. Kae P. is a 49-year-old tailor and widowed mother blessed with four children, two of whom are now employed and helping to provide a little income for the family. Lacking the necessary capital, Kae, who owns a pond, is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer and lotus seed in order to plant crops for extra profit.

Note: Mrs. Kae P. was busy when the photo taken, so her son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and lotus seed

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou S. est est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans.  Elle tient un restaurant chez elle au quartier Grand Thiès et elle est très sollicitée dans ce business. Cette activité qu'elle adore très bien lui permet dit-elle de régler ses besoins et d'aider son mari à la charge de la maison depuis les 2 ans qu'elle s'y'est. Cependant, elle demande un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour achever les travaux de construction d'un bâtiment chez elle
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou S. is a forty year old married woman. She runs a restaurant at her home in the neighborhood of Grand Thie. Her business is quite popular. She enjoys this business and over the past two years, it has allowed her to meet her personal needs and help her husband with the family expenses. At this time, she is requesting a 200,000 FCFA loan to pay for construction work to her house.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for construction work to her house

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen P., 36, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

P. is a farmer and earns an income of USD 1 per day. His wife is employed at a garment factory in the city, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La  socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 43 años de edad;  La socia es conviviente y tiene un pequeño local en el barrio de Arcopata, ella vende ceviche, la socia desea implementar su local ella quiere mejorarlo y poner más decoración, mesas, cuadros, vajillas. Su deseo a futuro inmediato es hacer un restaurante más grande y bonito, con buena atención y rica comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar utensilios, insumos, adornos, mesas, sillas para el local. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qorichuspa Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. The member is Francisca. She is 43 years old, and she is in a common law marriage. She has a small place where she sells “ceviche” (citrus marinated seafood) in the Arcopata neighborhood. The member wants to set up her place and improve it. She wants to have more decorations, tables, pictures, and dishes. Her wish for the immediate future is to make a larger restaurant that is pretty, has good service, and has delicious food. The member is asking for the loan to buy utensils, supplies, decorations, tables, and chairs for her place. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. It allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of live. She commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up and improve her place of business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger O. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 40 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Roger owns and operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Roger is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman V. is from the village of Karnout in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married with four children.  Telman has two daughters (ages 20 and 22) and two sons (ages 25 and 28).  He has been engaged in agricultural production for the past 20 years.  He considers himself a hard worker and has developed a successful business raising cattle and growing vegetables.  He dreams to create a wholesale agricultural production farm to service the big cities someday.  Currently Telman is seeking a loan to grow his small  vegetable business by purchasing fertilizer.  He is expecting his income to increase by 10% with the loan.  He and his family really enjoy life in Karnout and, with continued business success, plan to permanently live here.  With the loan terms he has received he is optimistic his business plan will succeed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia R. is from the village of Tuburan Villaflor Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies, like fruit salad, in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be Virginia's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of Andarayan South, Solana, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Josefina is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from  selling  different vegetables to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ejoheza Group

texts.en: “Ejoheza” (meaning a bright future in the Kinyarwanda language) is a group of 30 clients. They sell different things. Some sell second-hand clothes, food crops, or fruit and others have bars. Olive (raising a hand in the photo) is the group president. She has a shop in which she sells items such as salt, soap, sugar, etc. Olive is 45 years old; she has three children who are between the ages of 17-21 years old.One of her children is in school while the other two stopped their studies after their six primary grades because she couldn’t afford their school fees. Olive sells bicycle spare parts and she is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts and fill her store in order to make more profits.  With the profits she hopes to open up a wholesale shop. She has been in this business for three years and she finds it interesting because it enables her to cover most of her home expenses. Most of the other group members wish to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: spare bicycle parts

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn U. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Mahigugma-on, Barangay Patic, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  wholesale shrimp sales and delivery of salt. Her husband, Roderick, 40 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children, 9 months and 3 years old. Jelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase equipment for her delivery business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her business. Jelyn U. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh T. G. is a 53-year-old farmer with two children who are workers. Her main activities are raising eight pigs and growing rice and beans. Since receiving her first loan in 2006, Minh has invested in expanding her farm. She has been successfully and productively raising pigs that bring good prices. Minh is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 VND to improve her pigsties.

loans.use: to improve pigsties

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Lourdes tiene 2 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en vender artesanía de tipo bisutería. Lourdes también tiene un carro que brinda servicios de transportes.  
     
Lourdes con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para el mantenimiento del carro y desea comprar repuestos como llantas y muchas cosas más que necesita el carro. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Lourdes has 2 children and considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She has a small business selling hand-made jewelry.  Lourdes also has a car with which she provides transport services.

Lourdes will use this loan for $400USD to have maintenance work done on her car.  She would like to buy new parts for it such as tires and many other things that it needs.

Lourdes is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as tires and many other things which her car needs

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children aged 15, 17 and 22 respectively. She lives in Gathangara in Kiambu, a peri-urban town with a lot of agricultural activity. Jane sells cereals to the residents of Gathangara area and is also involved in tea farming. For the past four years, cereal selling has been her primary business. 

Jane got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions.  Jane would like to become a wholesale cereal seller and sustain her business. She has applied for a loan to add more cereals and grains, such as maize, beans, peas and potatoes, to her stock.

loans.use: to buy cereals and grains

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Juana ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Juana es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Juana, 55, is a mother living with her family in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, quite a commercial zone located in Northern Perú.

She has a small general store in her home that a family member tends to.  They offer their neighbors and customers from the area diverse products for daily consumption and groceries.  The business is very well received.  She also is a street vendor of ice cream.  With these activities she is able to help her husband support the family.

The growing demand Juana has been experiencing lately in the store has made her think of enlarging it acquiring more products.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Juana is quite a hard working woman of very good character.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a food stall selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Monica faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future. With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it is a simple process and requires no legal formalities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and  fish for resale.

loans.name: Fausto Absalon

texts.es:
Fausto Absalon G. V. tiene 39 años de edad, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fausto Absalon se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta cuidar a las aves del corral.
texts.en: Fausto Absalon G. V. is 39. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. He has 2 children. The members of the V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, district of San Antonio, San José del Tambo Parish, are located 150 minutes from the community, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour: the sowing of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Fausto Absalon works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He buys his products in the Matilde Esther Market and sells them in Bucay. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his necessities. He has to confront challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a plot of land. He likes to care for barnyard birds.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es: La señora Maribel tiene 31 años y vive en la zona D. Villa Hermosa en Huaycan, esta conviviendo y tiene un hijo, lleva cuatro años trabajando con Edaprospo en el grupo “Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa”, grupo conformado por 10 vecinos y amigos, además el grupo escogió el nombre indican: “Por que viven en la Villa y son hermosas”, La señora Maribel por su parte atienD. en un restaurante y venD. comida desD. hace 5 años, también venD. ropas D. temporada a pedido para así juntar dinero y poder en el futuro comprar su casa y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le siga brindando su ayuda.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribel is 31 years old and lives in the Villa Hermosa ["Beautiful Village"] zone of of Huayacan.  She is in a common-law marriage and has one son.  She has been working with Edaprospo for four years, with the "Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa" ["Little Flowers of Villa Hermosa"] group.  This group is maD. up of ten neighbors and friends.  They chose their group's name "because they live in the Villa and they are beautiful."

For her part, Ms. Maribel tends to a restaurant and has been selling food for five years.  In order to bring in enough money, she also sells seasonal clothing on order.  In the future, she wants to be able to buy her own house, so she needs the continued support that Edaprospo has offered her.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida V. is from the village of Naggasican Santiago City. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she sells vegetables, fruits and fish. Leonida has been in business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASK to purchase additional products to sell. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
                                                        
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folks and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eusebio Ricardo

texts.es:
Eusebio G., un hombre  de 60 años y casado,  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 11 años, procedente del municipio de Cereté, lugar donde vivía; el trabajaba en Cerromatoso, gran productor en Colombia de ferroníquel, o aleación de hierro y níquel, en el departamento de Córdoba, de donde hoy espera su pensión. 
Eusebio  vive en el barrio 7 de Abril y es propietario de la “Tienda los Abuelos”, negocio que inició por recomendación de su hermana y es hoy una fuente de ingreso y empleo para él y su esposa y por eso ambos son conocidos en el sector como “los abuelos”.  Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y esta aplicando a su primer credikiva para comprar víveres productos no perecederos, arroz, aceite, harina y azúcar  en mayor proporción, para ganar descuentos y continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia que es su fortaleza, lo que le augura éxitos en su inversión.
Desde que inició su historia crediticia en la Fundación su negocio ha crecido, porque cada crédito es una adición a su capital de trabajo que le permite expandirse al tener todos los productos  que sus clientes requieren de manera asequible.
texts.en:
Euesbio G., 60 years old and married, moved to the city of Barranquilla, Colombia 11 years ago from the municipality of Cerete where he used to live.  He used to work at Cerromatoso, a large producer of ferronickel - an alloy of iron and nickel - in the department of Cordoba; he is now waiting for his retirement pension from this company. Eusebio lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood in Barranquilla, and he owns the "Tienda los Abuelos" (Grandparents' Store), a business that he began at his sister's suggestion. The store is now a source of income and employment for him and his wife, and because of this, both are known in the area as "the grandparents." 

This is Eusbio's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he is applying for his first Kiva credit to buy non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar, in bulk so that he can buy at a discount and continue offering excellent service, which will help him succeed in his investment.  His business has grown since be began taking out credit with the Foundation, because each loan is an addition to his work capital that allows him to expand to have all the products that his customers need at an affordable price.  Through this growth, the couple has been able to sustain their business well.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K., 29, is married to Mr. Phan Srim, 28, a local farmer. They live in Kompong Cham province. Neang K. is talented at making bamboo baskets for the market. She also helps her husband farm and plant rice. She and her husband go through the village seeking bamboo. They then take the bamboo home, put it in water for almost a week and then dry it in the sunshine for at least three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, which she and her husband use to make baskets.

Neang K. is now asking for a loan to help her breed pigs to provide the family with extra income. The loan money will be used to buy piglets and many sacks of pig feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel R. is from the village of Luyao Luna, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Rachel is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rachel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rachel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Rachel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his sisters and his own family, and his dream is to educate them.

He has a retail shop and has been operating it for three years amid challenges of high rental fees and taxes. 

Amos started as a builder, then saved to start the retail shop. His goal is to become a wholesale trader. 

Amos needs the loan to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Divina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells nipa (woven Nipa palm fronds for a thatched roof) for the local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to add capital to her business. 

Divina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production

loans.name: Yeny Margot

texts.es:
Yeny  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos.  Hace cuatro meses trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo  de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos cosméticos para poder abastecerse para la campaña del día de la madre.
 Su sueño es tener más capital y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yeny is a member of the comunal bank Victor Echave located in the district of Puno, a province and department of Puno.  She is single with 2 children and counts on a secondary education.
She sells perfumery and cosmetic products.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement four months now and her initial loan of 300 nuevo soles was invested in her business of cosmetic products.  With this new loan of 300 nuevo soles she will purchase cosmetic products in order to stock up for the Mother's Day campaign.  Her dream is to have more capital and improve her earnings.  What she likes most about her comunal bank is the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase various cosmetics

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Zaur B. 36 let. 
Zaur seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec dlya prodaji. On takje delayet iz shersti ovec tepliye zimniye jeleti i prodayot ix.
texts.en: Zaur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who know lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has a child.  Zaur B. is 36 years old. Zaur now needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep to expand his flock for resale.  He has been a shepherd for seven years and breeds sheep for resale.  He also makes warm winter vests from wool and sells them.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Jesus Nazareno

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y es conocido por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que goza de muy buenas referencias personales, por parte de sus vecinos. Él vive en una campiña en la zona rural del distrito Razuri perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope.

Jesús se dedica a la compra y venta de espárrago y cuenta con gran experiencia en este negocio. Es conocido en su comunidad  y trabaja con los agricultores de la zona que lo consideran un amigo.

Jesús ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que desea invertir en su negocio. Con este préstamo Jesús quiere comprar espárrago de campos de cultivo para comercializarlo a su distinta clientela.

Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad para su negocio y desarrollo personal así como económico.
texts.en:
Jesús, 28, is single and known for being a responsible, hard working person who has very good personal references from his neighbors.  He lives out in the countryside in the rural part of Razuri District which belongs to Ascope Province.

Jesús is an asparagus merchant.  He has a lot of experience in this business.  He’s known in the community and works with the local farmers who consider him a friend.

Jesús has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to invest in the business.  Jesús plans to use this loan to buy asparagus from the field to sell to his various customers.

He would be very grateful if this loan were granted because it would be very useful for his business as well as his personal and economic development.

loans.use: to buy asparagus to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de 49 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí vive desde hace 12 años en su casa propia, cuidando con mucho esmero de sus cultivos. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura; donde trabaja arduamente en su siembra, con el tiempo logró obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Desde entonces cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Pero en temporada de cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, vende su producción a la cooperativa de la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. “Me gusta sembrar”, concluye. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de Café” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esteban de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos de café que recién sembró. Asimismo en el pago del salario a los peones que le están apoyando en esta campaña de cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Esteban, age 49, resides in the community of Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. He has lived there for 12 years and owns a home. Esteban looks after his crops with great care. His main business activity is farming. He works hard on his farm where he owns four hectares of land. Every morning he wakes up early so that he can water and look after his banana and coffee plants. Esteban sells his produce in the city of La Merced where he is able to get the best prices for his crops. During the coffee harvesting season, which occurs once a year, he sells his coffee beans to a cooperative in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar. What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom of working in the green fields. Esteban has been farming for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to work every day because he is left with little time to devote to other activities. Later on, he hopes to acquire more land so that he can grow citrus fruits because these items currently sell the best. “I enjoy farming,” says Esteban.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Aroma de Café” (Scent of Coffee) and will be receiving his third loan from MFP. Esteban hopes that this support will help him achieve his goals. For this reason, he promises once again to complete his payments on time, just as he did with his previous loans. He is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With the loan he received, Esteban will invest in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on the coffee plants he recently planted. In addition, he will pay the salary of his workers who have helped him during the coffee harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the salary of his workers.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 29 years old, hard working and self motivated. She is married and blessed with three children aged 7, 5 and 4 years old. Everlyne sells spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid for motor vehicles. Prior to this, she had a retail shop.

Through Faulu Kenya, Everlyne has learned how to save and to manage her business. She wants a loan of 20,000 KES to buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid. Everlyne wants to be a well established businesswoman with several outlets in town in the next 5 years. Her dream is to be a major distributor of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid

loans.name: El Firmamento 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Merki is the coordinator of her group, El Firmamento 1 & 2 (The Firmament). This is a group composed of 10 business women. All of them are working to improve their lives and their families' also. They live in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city.

Merki makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a young mother of 26. She is excited to be seeking her third loan with Esperanza. She successfully paid off her previous loan after using it to make a successful investment in her beans sales. She boils them to sell to her neighbors. (This is a way many women in the Dominican Republic buy beans for daily meals, specially for lunch. They finish cooking the beans.) She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying three bags of beans. 

She is saving her profits because she is planning to expand her business with more products. She dreams of having a grocery store. Her most difficult challenge has been studying and take care of her babies. She likes to work and her future plan is to have her own house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beans to boil and sell.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met, 54 years old, sells cakes.  Her income is $4 per day. She is a single mother with 5 children, two of whom are studying.  The other three are workers earning $9 per day.  Every month Met has to spend $66 on food, $7.5 on electricity, $26 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $14 on other expenses.  She sells many kinds of cake to offer her customers and can sell alot of cake because her cakes taste good. She expects to send the rest of her children to study at the university so that they can find good jobs. 

She would like a loan of $800 to buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Chamreun is 37 years old.  They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have two sons and two daughters.  Two are married and live outside the family home.  The other two work in a restaurant.   

Srey is a gardener, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting and she will use part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: Lelis de 47 años de edad se dedica a la actividad comercial en su casa ubicada al suroccidente de la ciudad, donde vive con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 20 a 24 años. Procedente de Aracataca, desde muy niña llegó a la ciudad de BarranquilL., donde formó su familia y desde hace 6 años se separó de su cónyuge y asumió las riendas de su hogar, pues desde hace 21 años ya era trabajadora independiente, vendía mercancías variada y también bebidas. Su negocio de mercancía lo distribuye en los municipios del departamento del Magdalena donde tiene su principal clientele,  a quienes les vende ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y artículos que le solicitan, especialmente cuando se acercan las fiestas patronales y eventos que conglomeran muchos potenciales clientes. Su negocio de venta de bebidas, lo desarrolle todos los días, los fines de semana aumentan sus ventas, pues  usualmente son  épocas de pago de nóminas, quincenas o décadas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará, bebidas en mayor volumen, así como ropa que tiene encargada y accesorios femeninos, con ello ganaría descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y de contado y aquí radica el éxito de su inversión. Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa donde pueda adecuar su negocio en un espacio confortable para ella su familia y que los clientes se sientan muy bien atendidos por la comodidad que este lugar le inspire. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Lelis se esmera en su negocio diariamente por aumentar sus ventas, y por sostener su rentabilidad que no es menor del 17,79%, rotación de inventarios de 17 días en la mercancía y en las bebidas, diaria. Su máximo sueño es ver a sus hijos felices en familia y con mucho bienestar.
texts.en:
Lelis, 47, conducts her commercial activity from home which is located in the southwest part of the city where she lives with her four children whose ages range from 20 to 24 years.  She is from Aracataca having arrived as a little girl in BarranquilL. where she eventually formed her family.  Six years ago she separated from her spouse and took on the reins of her household since she has been an independent merchant for the last 21 years selling assorted merchandise and beverages.

She sells her merchandise in towns in Magdalena Department where her main clientele is located.  She sells them clothes, cosmetics, perfumes and other items they request especially when the patron saint feast days or other events approach that gather together lots of potential customers. The beverage sales take place every day and sales rise on weekends because that’s usually when salaries are paid (biweekly or every ten days).

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy larger amounts of beverages as well as clothes she has on order and women’s accessories.  She will earn discounts buying in volume and paying cash and this is where her investment’s success resides.

Her future dream is to have a house where she can set up her business in a space that’s comfortable for her and her family and where customers will feel well cared for due to the comfort the place inspires.  While all this occurs, Lelis strives daily in her business to increase sales to maintain her profit margin which is no less than 17.79%, a stock turnover rate of 17 days for the merchandise and daily for the beverages.  Her main dream is to see her children happy as family with much wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beverages in larger amounts.

loans.name: Batyi's Group

texts.en: Batyi is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married; her husband went to work in Russia. Batyi has raised two daughters and a son; the daughters are married and the son studies at university. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, Batyi breeds livestock; her son helps her in this activity. With the profits gained from reselling livestock, she was able to build a sauna near the house. With money received from the loan, Batyi wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to see her son get wed. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo, a married man with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business from home. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business, and dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, he wants to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sylvia Montano Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 63 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is married with four children. 

Sylvia has a shop that sells assorted groceries and dry goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries worth PHP 10,000.

Sylvia has been a member of PMPC for two years. Sylvia is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is 33 years old and married, with 2 children. With one child in school, Rapuncel works very hard to provide for them.  Rapuncel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rapuncel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, oil, spices, bread, etc.  In the future, Rapuncel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин житель района Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он таксист, в основном он разводит людей с одного месте на другое. Кроме того два раза в неделю Мухиддин развозит людей по маршруту Дангара - Куляб. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Muhiddin lives in the Dangara district.  He is 26 years old, married and has two children.  He is a taxi driver and primarily transports people from one place to another.  Besides this, Muhiddin transports people along the Dangara  -  Kulob route twice per week.  He has been involved in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Oyumaa

texts.en: Oyumaa is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been renting a small space in a hairdressing salon since 2007. She has a bright vision to open her own hair salon one day. Her equipment is getting old and doesn't operate. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I had a daughter recently. I will work as hard as possible to support my son." She is requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase new equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, gaseosas, pollo, carne, frijoles, condimentos y aceite, para la venta de comida, esta nueva inversión espera que le dé buenos resultados, logrando surtir el negocio.
Ella tiene una buena experiencia en el manejo de créditos, ya que en la actualidad la condición del negocio, la debe a las inversiones de mercadería que realiza a través de los préstamos, con este apoyo ha logrado tener casa propia, y de las ventas paga las cuotas muy responsablemente.
texts.en:
Ana needs a new loan to buy merchandise for her business: soft-drinks, chicken, meat, beans, condiments and oil, for the meal sales.  She hopes to get good results from this new investment managing to stock the business.

She has good experience managing loans since the current condition of the business is due to the investments she makes in merchandise thanks to the loans.  With his support, she’s managed to acquire her house and she makes her installment payments responsibly with profits from sales.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, chicken, meat, beans, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Ines Amanda

texts.es:
Inés Amanda tiene 51 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con la hermana y con los hijos de 31,24 22 años de edad en Guaranda Sector Cuatro Esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
Inés se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales como: pollos, cerdos y también Hilar lana de borrego.
Las compras y las Ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el Crédito para la compra de animales y alimentación.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a producir un poco más de ingresos. El sueño es poder comprar terreno y tener una casa propia.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear, visitar a la familia y disfrutar del carnaval, San José y Navidad.
texts.en:
Inés Amanda is 51 years old.  She is single and has three children.  She lives with her sister and her children, who are 31, 24 and 22 years old, in Cuatro Esquinas, Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

The 'Cuatro Esquinas Centra' community bank has 12 members who live in Cuatro Esquinas.  The bank's members work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising, commerce, etc.

Inés is a farmer and raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She also spins lamb's wool.

Inés makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals and feed.

The support of this loan will help Inés to make a little more income.  Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and own her own home.  She has not faced any kind of problem in her work.

In her free time, Inés enjoys going for walks, visiting her family and enjoying the Carnaval, San José and Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Vima

texts.en:
Vima is 52 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez. She is married with 4 children. 

Vima has a retail business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Vima has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Vima hopes to have her own grocery store in the locality.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 71 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan y rosquillas, tambien vende leche, tiene ganado de ordeño, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus panes y rosquillas, en estos momentos los pedidos de los clientes han aumentado y no logra cubrir con todo, necesita tener una mayor produccion.
  Con la venta de la leche le va bien, tiene una buena cria de ganado.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is a 71-year-old single woman who makes and sells bread and ring-shaped pastry for a living. She also sells milk and has livestock to produce milk.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of materials to make bread and ring-shaped pastry.

Now, her customers' orders have increased and she is not able to meet their demands because she needs to increase production.

The sale of milk is doing well and she has good livestock breeds. She needs profits to pay family expenses.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, butter, sugar, margarine, oil, cheese, yeast, baking powder and firewood.

loans.name: Hermilina

texts.en:
Hermilina is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband works as a farmer.
Hermilina has run a dress shop in Trinidad, Bohol for 23 years. She not only makes dresses but also sews school uniforms. She earns about 8,000 PHP per month from this business. Hermilina plans to use her loan to purchase cloth, thread and other materials. She hopes to make gowns and buy an additional sewing machine soon.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Kheaiv

texts.en:
Kheaiv is the loving mother of four teenage children who are no longer in school. Two of her children are working as garment factory workers, and they each contribute some of their income to help meet the family’s daily expenses. Her husband is a fisherman who works along a local river.

Kheaiv is a local farmer in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province where she has planted her crops for many years. Besides this, she often sells the fish that her husband caught or she buys from other fishermen. She currently earns an average of $1.40 a day.

Because she lacks extra capital to improve her farming capacity during the dry season, Kheaiv is asking for a 700 USD loan from HKL. She will use it to buy a water pump, fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en: Hidaya is a 44 year old married woman who supports 4 family members from Al Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for materials for sewing,such as fabric, beads and thread.In the future she would like to open a shop to sell her products. Also she hopes for her son's to continue their education and would like to buy a home.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing

loans.name: Juan Genaro

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy amable y de un carácter muy jovial. Juan es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal, ya que le gusta mucho esta carrera, y para solventar los gastos de sus estudios Juan trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 8 horas ya que por las noches va a su centro de estudios, el cree que esta saliendo adelante en su trabajo y estudios porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Juan esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como cemento, calamina, clavos, entre otros; para realizar refacciones en su vivienda, ya que en época de verano hay lluvias fuertes y de esta manera podrá mejorar el techo para evitar que se inunde, así su familia tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Juan is a 28-year-old young man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is known for having a hot climate and for being warm and inviting. It is also known for having beautiful landscapes and, above all, for its citizens, who are very friendly and fun people. Juan is a young man with many dreams of succeeding and it is because of this that he is studying hard to become a forestry engineer, and he already loves his work. In order to manage the expense of his studies, Juan works as an employee in a company in the city, for which he works about 8 hours per day since he goes to the study center at night. He believes that he is succeeding in his work and his studies because he is very responsible and has many dreams of becoming successful.

Juan is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the support that they have given him, he will be able to buy materials such as cement, iron, and nails, among other things, in order to make replacement parts for his house. He needs these because, in the summer time, there are very strong rains, and with the loan he will be able to improve his roof so that the house doesn't flood. In this way, his family will have a higher quality of life and he will continue to fight every day in order in order to realize his biggest dream: to finish his career and have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cement and iron, among others, in order to improve his house.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is expert in business selling. She has been in her sari- sari store business for 15 years. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental and is blesses with 2 children. She loaned an amount of Php 35,000.00 in PMPC to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items for her business. 
  Caridad is thankful for PMPC for the help!

loans.use: To restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Alikram Muhammad Ogl

texts.en:
This 54-year old internally displaced person (IDP) is a father of four children. His family\'s living condition is not good enough.The family income is rather limited. Alikram has been engaged in carpentry to improve his family\'s living condition since 1991. He started his business with $400. Having not enough financialy resources, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough in the beginning. He applies for a loan amount of 1000$ for the first time.

Alikram needs $1000 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy new carpentry equipment, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with this additional income, and to obtain some funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy carpentry equipment

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is married and has a son. Her husband's income is small which is hwy she decided to start this business, buying and selling used clothes. She started selling clothes from her home and in the local markets. It is very important for her to earn this income because this way she can invest in her son's education, to grant him a better future.

So that she can continue on with her sales, Alberta needs a loan of $550, that she will use towards the purchase of clothing, to offer her customers a wider variety and expand her business. She plans to repay the loan in a term of 5 months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alberta es casada y tiene un hijo, el ingreso que recibe su esposo es muy poco, por lo que ella decidió iniciar este negocio de compra y venta de ropa usada, empezó vendiendo la ropa en su casa y luego en mercados ambulantes que se ubican cerca de su casa. Para ella es muy importante recibir este ingreso porque así puede contribuir a que su hijo siga estudiando y pueda tener un mejor futuro.

Para poder continuar con sus ventas, Alberta necesita de un préstamo de $550 dólares, que destinará a la compra de ropa para poder ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad y hacer crecer su negocio, planea devolver este préstamo en un lapso de cinco meses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Pabla

texts.en:
Maria Pabla K. de Medina is 47 years old. She is a long-time resident of Pelopincho, the largest of Asuncion's marginal neighborhoods. She appears strong and healthy, but older than her years. She hawks cosmetics and clothing that she buys in Clorinda, Argentina, on the border near Asuncion. At night, she collects cardboard downtown to recycle. Between these two activities she earns about $40 a week with which she supports two of her six children and helps the older ones, who have children of their own.

For the last year, she has been a member of the Tekoyeyoya support committee, along with 14 other women from her neighborhood. She relates with sadness how she is separated from her husband. "He was a drunk and didn't work," she says. "When he drank he got crazy." She left him nine years ago, and it's as if he were dead to her.

Since then she has raised her children alone. She takes pride in never having let her children or grandchildren beg in the street. "I thank God for giving me the strength to keep fighting," she says with tears in her eyes. She wants the best for her family and her community.
