L. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana S. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Taciana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Taciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Taciana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, sugar, bagoong and dried fish for sale. (Bagoong is a fish paste used as a condiment.) This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maamuu

texts.en: Maamuu, 54, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson at the market and his daughter attends college. Maamuu learned carpentry skills in 1986 and worked for a construction company. He began operating his own business in 1992. He works for construction companies in the summertime and makes wooden products and furniture at home in the winter. He supports his family with his business profits. Recently, he has bought a car with his business revenues. In the future, he wants to expand his business and have a workshop. He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I want to increase my profits and help my daughter to start her own life". He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and materials

loans.name: Ablan Novignon

texts.fr: Mère d’un(01) enfant, Madame Ablan  est âgée de 44ans et réside à Hédzranawoé (un quartier du Togo). Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle a démarré en 2000 son activité, s’approvisionne au Nord du Togo et revend devant sa maison.  Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  du charbon de bois pour  réaliser du profit afin d’assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant (vu qu’elle prend en charge ce dernier), s’épanouir, et pourquoi pas construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ablan is a 44-year-old mother of one child. She lives in Hédzranawoé (a district of Togo). She sells charcoal, an activity she started in 2000. She stocks up in northern Togo and conducts her sales from her home. 

She is requesting this loan to buy charcoal. She wants to make a profit that will allow her to provide a better future for her dependent child, to blossom, and maybe even to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P., 58, aims for a completeness in life. Erlinda completed elementary education and is married to Agustin, who is into business just like her. They have been blessed with three children who are now working. Together, they live in Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.
Erlinda has sold dry goods and assorted merchandise for quite some time now. She buys her merchandise in bulk and resells it at piecemeal rates. Among the products she sells are household cleaning materials, electrical and hardware items, batteries, needles and threads, and the like. Serving her local community, she earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP per month.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more merchandise to add to her current product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Not having an entirely complete supply of merchandise as compared to other wholesalers, sometimes Erlinda would like to give up, but she refuses to give in to the pressure. Instead, she works hard for ways to improve her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. for some time now has been making doughnuts for sale in Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She moves from one area to another to sell. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to enable her to make more doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to enable her to make more doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cigarros y champus,ella trabaja en forma independiente distribuyendo los cigarros y champús a diferentes lugares como Ayacucho,Anadahuaylillas,Lima y Juliaca y también distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cigarros y champus. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar champús y cigarros al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca, 42, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with cigarette and shampoo sales.  She works independently selling her cigarettes and shampoo in various places like Ayacucho, Anadahuaylillas, Lima and Juliaca; she also sells to different grocery stores.  This is how she supports her children.  She wants to expand and improve the cigarette and shampoo sale business and is asking for the loan to buy shampoo and cigarettes at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and cigarettes at wholesale.

loans.name: Karina Mariela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5  años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una florería.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 12h00 recorriendo la ciudad pero en su casa cuando llega un cliente lo atiende a cualquier hora. No trabaja hasta más tarde porque a esa hora llega su hijo de la escuela y tiene que en las tardes ayudarlo con sus tareas. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la forma de pago. 

Su sueño es tener un local más grande para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS EXITOSAS" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its pre-colonial culture and handicrafts, and renowned on both national and international levels.  This is the place of the "panama straw hat".

Here we meet Mrs. Karina, 23, who has a common-law partner and 5-year-old son in school.  Her husband works as a florist.

She sells all types of clothing on a door-to-door basis and from her home where she has a small dedicated space.  She works every day from 08:00 a.m. until noon throughout the city.  At home she attends to customers at any time of the day.  She does not work in the afternoons because her son is home from school and she helps him with his homework.  She sells her goods to customers on a credit basis and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys the merchandise she needs in Guayaquil.  For four years now she has been in business and it is going well for her.

She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  This is her third loan cycle in the communal bank, where she enjoys the easy credit terms.

Her dream is to have a larger location to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is a married woman from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has three children. Her eldest child is 19 years old. She is a rice farmer and has had this business for 5 years. Her average income from her business is Php 12,000 per month. Juvy needs support to sustain her livelihood. The loan will help her buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Juvy hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena  tiene 38 años, es separada vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tienen 4 hijos José de22 años y Estefani de 21 años, Mayor de 18 años y angie de 12 años.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol de palo y cacao, Compra sus productos en Agripac y vende sus productos en el comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, frejol, frejol de palo y cacao, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a superarse económicamente y  mejorar su producción. Su sueño es comprar una casa para sus hijos.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 38 years old, separated and living with her children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She has four children: José, 22, Estefani, 21, Mayor, 18 and Angie, 12.  

The members of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) communal bank are located in Voluntad de Dios, Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming chores.

María is a corn, rice, pigeon pea and cocoa bean farmer.  She buys her supplies at Agripac and sells her products at Comercial Peña.

She requests the loan for her corn, rice, broad bean, pigeon pea and cocoa bean crops; she will buy supplies and fertilizer for them.  Support from the loan will help her improve economically and improve her production.  Her dream is to buy a house for her children.

She likes to cook.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children, one of whom is in school. Robinah has a business selling at a food stall. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works seven days out of every week.  Robinah sells her products at the market at retail.  Robinah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish and sweet potatoes.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Robinah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to sell at wholesale only. Robinah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Yvonne works very hard to provide for them.

Yvonne runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Yvonne has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Yvonne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a businessman who sells mobile phone accessories to earn a living. He started the business ten years ago and he has employed two people.  He has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya. This has helped him to improve his business. 
Benson hopes to own permanent business premises in the future to save on rental fees. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a widow who lives in the Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. She has five children. All of her children are married. Four of her children are living in separate houses but one child is living with her. 

She works as a Khmer traditional medicine seller. She earns perhaps US $2 per day. 

To upgrade the family living situation, her son, who lives with her, runs a business as a junk goods collector around village and other communities. From this business, he earns approximately $5 per day. 

Currently, her son wishes to purchase more junk goods, but he lacks equity. Therefore, Chea and her son would like to request some funds through HKL, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase more junk goods. 

She and her son hope that this loan will add to their income and increase their happiness. They are very thankful to all lenders that support her family in this time.

loans.use: to purchase more junk goods.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen Alexandra tiene 39 años y es madre soltera con dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Trabaja duro para ofrecerles una vida mejor. Al darse cuenta de que no había muchas oportunidades comerciales en su sector, ella fundó su propia tienda. Está trabajando sola en su tienda, diariamente de las 8am hasta las 6pm. Además también trabaja en una escuela. 
Ella solicita este crédito para ampliar su negocio y así ayudar a sus dos hijos a que terminen sus estudios. Su sueño es de terminar su casa durante los próximos cinco años.
texts.en:
Carmen Alexandra is 39 years old; she is a single mother with two children, ages six and two. She works hard to offer them a better life. When Carmen realized that there were not many commercial opportunities in her sector, she started her own store. She works alone in the store every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm, also working in a school sometimes. 

Carmen is applying for this loan to expand her business and, in this way, help her two children finish their studies. Her dream is to finish the building of ehr home during the next five years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and sell it in her store.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 48 years-old and married man with three children. The oldest child is 26 years-old.

Ricardo is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ricardo works hard to provide for his family’s needs and to send his children to school.

Ricardo has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. He hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has 2 children. She is 41 years old and one of her children is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 1 year.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and the father of five children.

Fadel has been an owner of a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market and to add more foodstuffs

loans.name: Abduvahhob

texts.ru: Абдуваххоб женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он любит свою семью и всегда старается содержать их в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечит их всему, что они хотят. Абдуваххоб вырос в кишлаке там, где в основном все занимаются фермерством. Он начал свой бизнес 16 лет тому назад и достаточно набрал опыта, чтобы успешно продолжать бизнес. Он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. Абдуваххоб хотел бы расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 8000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en:
Abduvahhob is married and is the responsible father of three children. He loves his family and tries his best to support them as much as possible. Abduvahhob grew up in a village populated mainly by farmers. 
He started his business sixteen years ago and has enough experience to successfully continue it. 
He breeds animals and grows crops. His main cash crops are wheat and barley. Abduvahhob wishes to expand his business and maximize his profits. Therefore, he's asking for a loan of 8000 Somoni. He thanks you ahead of time for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Patys FLC, vive por la parroquia Tarqui en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, sus grandes llanuras le hacen un lugar propicio para la cría de ganado y otros animales, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 6 hijos de 23, 20, 17, 15, 3 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan solo para solventar sus gastos y dos de sus hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora en la ganadería, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la atención de su tienda, lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 9 años, sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo. También cría cerdos, gallinas y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito en el  banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su tienda.
 
Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Paty's FLC” communal bank. She lives in Tarqui parish in Cuenca. It has a cold climate and its great plains make an ideal place to raise cattle and other animals. Its people possess a warm and friendly heart; they maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Maria is 43 years old, married, and their union has conceived 6 children, aged 23, 20, 17, 15, 3 and 1. Their first 2 children work and cover their own expenses, while 2 of their children study in a local school. Her husband works in cattle raising. They own the house they live in.

Maria takes care of household matters and attends to her store. She has done this for some 9 years, without a fixed schedule, from Sunday to Sunday. In addition, she raised pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

This loan will start Maria on her 2nd loan cycle with her communal bank. She will invest it in purchasing products of primary necessity to restock her store.

Her goal is to expand the store.

loans.use: to buy products of primary necessity to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: María Belén

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María Belén, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es electromecánico.

Ella con la finalidad de ganar sus propios recursos tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos para automóviles, allí en su negocio sus clientes pueden conseguir repuestos de todo tipo desde eléctricos hasta neumáticos, aceites, etc. ella realizar sus ventas a través de su esposo ya que el tiene su taller donde realiza trabajos de electromecánica en los automóviles. Trabaja todos los días y lleva con su negocio cinco años.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos para automóviles, los mismos que recibe en su local. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado tanto el banco como sus compañeras.
 
Sus sueños son tener el mejor local de repuestos de la ciudad y un taller más grande para su esposo.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) the communal bank of Dulce Amistad meet twice a month. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the local people and it is also known throughout the country for the warmth of the friendly working people.

In this place we meet María Belén who is 24 years old, married and from this relationship they have 2 children of 7 and 6 years of age who are school students. Her husband is an electrical engineer.

In order to earn her own income she has a business selling auto parts. There at her business customers can get all types of parts from electric parts to tires, oils and other items. She makes her sales through her husband who has a workshop making electromechanical  repairs to cars. She works every day and has been in business for 5 years.

She will use the money from the loan to buy auto parts to be used in her workplace. She has had 6 cycles with the communal bank and she likes the support that has given by both the bank as well as the group members. Her dream is to have the best auto parts store in the city and to have a bigger workshop for her husband.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Saidu. He is married and has two children, aged 13 and 8 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is his relative. 

In 1994, Saidu established his provisions business, selling such items as sugar, milk, mayonnaise, sardines, butter, margarine, coffee, tea, etc. He began his business because he was trained by his parents, who are also petty traders. 

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Saidu requires a loan in order to buy more provisions for his business. In the future, Saidu plans to educate his children and build a dwelling house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, mayonnaise, sardines and margarine for his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years of age, married, and has been blessed with two children.  They lived in the village of Disimuray in Cauayan City.  She works hard to make a living.  Gina is glad because her husband is helping her to improve their living conditions. 

Gina has been engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily for breeding, for one-year.  She patiently runs her business though periodically she has suffered some difficulties.  She endured all those hardships in her hog-raising business because she is aiming to give her family a better future and to improve their living situation.

Gina wants to improve her business which is why she is taking out this loan amounting to P5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines to sustain her hog. This loan will help her grow her hogs and be able to sell them at a higher cost upon distribution.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines to sustain her hog.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos todos mayores de edad, cinco de ellos aún viven en su casa y uno de ellos  estudian en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. 

Ella para ganar sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su familia hace dos años atrás puso un bar en su casa, luego de unos mese también adecuo otro local en el cual puso un bazar. En el bar vende bocadillos, jugos y batidos de frutas y en el bazar vende ropa, zapatos,  peluches y varios productos más, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta un poquito más tarde sobre todo los fines de semana,  ella trabaja con la ayuda de su hija.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su bazar, más que todo comprar ropa de todo tipo ya que en esta época es lo que más se vende.
 
Su sueño es que sus negocios sigan mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this lovely area. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to the work of the sea. 

In this place, we meet María, who is 53 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has seven children, all of them grown. Five of them still live in her home, and one is studying at the university. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from the institution.  

To earn her own resources and thus help her family, two years ago she set up a bar in her home. After a few months, she also set up another shop, in which she opened a bazaar (general store). In the bar, she sells snacks, juices and fruit shakes, and in the general store she sells clothing, shoes, stuffed animals and various other products. She works every day from 8:00 to 6:00, and sometimes a bit later, above all on weekends. Her daughter helps her with her work. 

She will use the loan to stock her general store with more products; above all, she will buy clothing of all kinds, since it is the most popular product in this season. 

Her dream is that her businesses will continue to improve day by day.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is 35 years old and a widow. She has spent her life in great difficulties since the death of her husband, but she never lost hope.

She has been operating a sewing business and lives with her brother and two daughters. Her brother operates a printing business in the market. He has a printer and charges five rupees per printed page.

Shagufta has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy another printer that will help him offer better printing services to his clients and increase his profits. He is an experienced person and has been operating his business for many years. Shagufta hopes that an investment will help him earn more profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy a new printer for a printing business

loans.name: Belook

texts.en:
Belook is a 28-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Belook is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises pigs that she sells in her community. She has been raising pigs for ten years.

Margaret has requested this loan to buy additional piglets, pig feed and a water pump for her business.
She hopes to help cover her family's weekly expenses, pay for her children's school fees and improve her business with the money she earns. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $5700 helps Margaret buy six piglets, pig feed and a water pump for her piggery.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda sells poultry in a local market. She remembers when she was young she used to help her parents sell vegetables in a similar type of market. She moved on to selling lunches and breakfasts at a stand of her own while she was raising her children. She has been selling chicken for the last 6 years at her stand in Guayaquil. Her entrepreneurial ventures have always allowed her to raise and support her kids.

She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in chicken and pork, which sells extremely well in the month of December. She wants to see her business grow because it makes her feel alive. She loves the fact that she, at the age of 72, can still depend on herself for income.

Amanda also helps her family quite a bit. She had 12 children, 3 of which have gone to Spain in search of work and a better life. She helps raise 5 of her grandchildren whose parents are away. Although she says she has not been able to rest despite her 72 years of age, she seems intent on staying busy.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking this loan because she wants to invest in chicken and pork, which sells extremely well in the month of December

loans.name: Christina Manka

texts.en:
Christina is in a monogamous marriage and mother of five children. Memories of how she dropped out of school because her father fell ill and couldn’t pay her fees, as well as the financial difficulties she and her husband are facing to meet the education and health needs of their children, motivate her to want to better her lot.

She has succeeded in repaying her five previous loans, providing her community with firewood, food-crops, meat, and manure. She used the profits principally for school requirements and medication.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to increase her stock by buying sticks, nails, and zinc to enlarge her pig fence, and yams, corn, beans, and vegetable seedlings for planting. Her long experience in this field and the ever-present demand from the urban center of Bamenda bode well for a successful investment.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Cultivating food crops and raising pigs

loans.name: Zakara

texts.en:
Zakara lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated and is a teacher in one of the schools. She wants to help with her son who is a carpet weaver. He has good work experience and wants to make a good business, but he is very young. Therefore his mother wants to take a group loan for her son so that he expand his business and develop close relations with all the carpet sellers in the bazaar and be a good business dealer in the future.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the son of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet . However, the loan is to the female borrower who is responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir C. is 65 years old. He has a sub-professional background as an installer. He is marred and has 6 children. Tahir's profession was very popular. In Tajikistan, there was a wide range of construction, and his position was well-paid. Tahir grew up in a village, and animal breeding skills were familiar to him from childhood. After the civil war when he was without a job, the animal breeding skills helped him. Now Tahir has a part-time farm, and he is increasing his livestock. He is going to buy three bull-calves to fatten and sell for the loan amount of $875. This loan helps to increase his number of cattle and give an opportunity to the village habitants where lives. Tahir buys the calves near his home for a low price. Tahir is going to pay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: To buy three bull-calves for fatting and selling

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 40 year old mother  and has been running a small grocery shop for the past three years. She owns a shop in Kigogo area, a Dar Es Salaam City suburb, where she sells food items such as rice, cooking oil, maize flour, and cosmetics. She wants to expand her shop, increase stock and start rearing poultry for sale. She is also a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business and entrepreneurship skills training. Anna is in need of $550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Salomé

texts.en:
Salomé has a multi-faceted business to which she is very dedicated. She has a shop in Lima where she works from 7am to 9pm seven days a week selling jumpers, wool hats, dresses for girls and other clothing that she makes. She also sells wool, which she buys twice a week. On top of this she now teaches people how to sew and weave and currently has six students.

Salomé’s husband is a farmer and they have four children, ages 25, 21, 18, and 12. Her oldest is a nurse and studying education, her 21-year-old is studying mechanics, her 18-year-old is studying education, and her youngest is still in school. She says her family helps each other out in everything they do; they share the cooking and cleaning and support one another in their studies and jobs. Her husband and children help Salomé out by watching her store twice a week when she goes to purchase more supplies. Her goal with this loan of $200 is to purchase a larger inventory of wool.

loans.use: purchase a larger inventory of wool

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 35 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Rongo, Kenya.

Pamela has successfully repaid two microfinance loans from K-MET. She used the funds from her first loan to open her own beauty salon in 1998, and it has expanded since then. She currently rents the shop seen in this picture. She also sells shoes, purses, ties, and other clothing items.

The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community has earned her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating business.

Pamela is proud of her accomplishments and proud that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. Pamela requests a loan of US $ 1000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Flor Milagro's Group

texts.en:
Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia are members of the community bank “Prosperidad”.  Flor Milagro has been a member for less than one year; Iris Dilalia has been a member for almost five years.  They both joined because their mothers were associates.  Iris Dilalia has four family members who are members of the bank.  They are happy with their experience and say that they have learned to save and that the lessons about healthy relationships, childcare, and self-esteem have been helpful
	Flor Milagro is 25 and has two children.  She has owned a seamstress business for the past six years.  Before that she worked doing the same thing for another person but enjoys having her own business.
	Iris Dilalia is 23 years old and has one seven-year-old child.  She sells cosmetics.  Before, she worked in a factory but decided to go back to school and no longer had time.  She is studying hotel management.  She is saving to be able to travel around the region with her management program.
	Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.
	Flor Milagro dreams of owning a big store and having a happy healthy family.  Iris Dilalia hopes to one day own her own hotel and a house where she can live with her son.

loans.use: Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.

loans.name: Tiira Road G Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mary A.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Mary is 42 years old and married . She has 4 children ranging in age from 10 to 20, and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband pay school fees for the children. Mary previously had a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Mary is joined in her small group by Joyce I. and Teresa Namawero. Joyce I. has a business selling matooke and wants to expand it. Teresa Namawero is also currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to purchase more matooke from the villages.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor R. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 34 years old, not married and has one child. She has secondary education. She is in the retail business and has own vendor space on the Kovron market in Dushanbe. She sells shoes and because she is not married, Gulbahor is the sole provider for the family. She has been in this business for the past four years. She plans to use the loan to increase her commodity turnover by bringing in seasonal merchandise. She buys merchandise from wholesalers and resells in retail. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рашидова Гулбахор жительница города Душанбе. Возраст 34 года, не замужем имеет одного ребенка. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе.Продает обувь.Так как клиентка не замужем она одна является кормильцем семьи. Торгует на рынке клиентка уже 4 года. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот , путем ввоза сезонного товара. Покупает товар у оптовых реализаторов и перепродает в розницу. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Baleba

texts.fr:
Baleba G. is married and has been a member of the village bank of Diaobé. She has always honored her commitments for five and a half years. She buys peanuts and uses them for making peanut butter, which she sells in the Diaobé marketplace. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She wishes to improve and strengthen her business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Baleba G., mariée, est une membre du banc villageois de Diaobé qui a toujours respecté ses engagements depuis cinq ans et demi. Elle achète des graines d’arachide et les transforment en pâte d’arachide qu’elle vend au marché de Diaobé. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle souhaite améliorer et renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: José Maria

texts.es:
Mr. José Maria D., known as “Chemita” in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, works in the agricultural business. He has his own farm in which he grows his crops and raises a small number of cattle.

Dedicated to his spouse and three children, Mr. D. works hard in order to provide them with better living conditions and an education. His dream is therefore to eradicate the problem that they have faced for a long time: the lack of electricity. They live in a distant rural area, which is why he has obtained a solar panel that allows them to install two lamps and access other appliances, such as a television set, an iron, and a radio. Upon having obtained this panel, he must now pay off his debt, which is why he wisely seeks the help of Ceprodel to get a loan so that he can pay the solar panel and see his dream of improving his family’s living conditions come true.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Maria D. conocido comúnmente como chemita en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propia finca donde da lugar a sus cultivos y donde cría su ganado que por cierto son pocos animales que desarrolla.

Comprometido con su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres hijos, el señor José Maria se esfuerza para proporcionar las mejores condiciones de vida para los suyos tanto a su cónyuge en el hogar como a sus hijos en el mantenimiento de sus estudios. Por esto sus sueños son erradicar la problemática que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado como lo es la ausencia de la energía eléctrica por vivir en una zona rural alejada. Por este motivo ha adquirido un panel solar que permite la instalación de dos lámparas y acceso a otro electrodoméstico como televisor, plancha o radio. Al haber adquirido este bien su necesidad es obtener el recurso económico para cancelar esta deuda y es por este motivo que muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita el pago del panel solar para ver cumplido su sueño de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en: O. Yinka lives in the town of Okoko, which is located in Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes a living traveling to farms to buy eggs, which she then sells to her neighbors and the people of her community. She studied this trade for three months before going into business in 1996. She has been a client of LAPO Microfinance for the past five years. O. needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more eggs and other supplies that will allow her to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and other supplies to sell

loans.name: Karina Paola

texts.es:
Karina is a young mother who had to pull herself together after being abandoned by her partner, and thanks to her relatives she was able to do it. She confronted her situation head on and overcame her depression and made headway along with her three-year-old, who was even more affected by her father leaving. So Karina, with the support of her parents and for the well being of herself and her daughter, installed a small convenience store in her home. There she could tend to customers and not neglect her baby. Karina has been doing this for almost a year now and her shop has become the most-frequented in her area, no doubt due to her charisma and her desire to get ahead. Now her goal is to enlarge her business, increase her stock and supply her store with more products to meet her customers' demands. She does not have the capital to achieve these goals, so she turns to you for support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Karina es una joven madre que tuvo que sobreponerse ante el abandono de su pareja, y gracias a sus familiares pudo hacerlo. Enfrentó su situación, sobrellevó su depresión y pudo salir adelante por su pequeña hija de tres años, quien fue la más afectada por el abandono de su padre. Entonces Karina con el apoyo de sus padres, por el bienestar de su hija y por es suyo propio, instaló una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. Ahí atiende a sus clientes sin descuidar a su bebe. Hace ya casi un año que Karina viene trabajando de esta forma, y su tienda se convirtió en la más concurrida de la zona, no cabe duda que el carisma y deseo de salir adelante de Karina, dieron sus frutos. Ahora su deseo es agrandar su negocio, incrementar su mercadería y surtir su bodega con otros productos que solicitan sus clientes. No cuenta con un capital que pueda invertir en ello, y por eso recurre a ustedes.

loans.use: Acquire new products so she can meet her customers demands / Incremento de capital de trabajo, para la adquisición de nuevos productos para su bodega, y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.name: Jorge Saul

texts.es:
Jorge started his business when he got married and needed to support his wife, and now he supports her and his 2 children, who are 4 and 1 years old. He began 3 years ago with money he had saved, starting off buying 4 calves which he raised and sold.

He currently needs a loan for US $800, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy more livestock for resale. With your support, he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge inició el negocio ya que cuando se caso, tuvo la necesidad de mantener a su esposa y ahora a ella y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año. Comenzó hace 3 años que con dinero que tenia ahorrado, inicio comprando 4 becerros, mismos que crio y vendió iniciando así su negocio.

Actualmente el necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas animales para la venta. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 9 and 2 years old. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and juice to increase her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and juice to increase her current stock

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig (her mother is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Kayidish.  He is 30 years old,  is married, and has one child. He has run a sheep breeding business for five years. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy 15 more sheep to assist in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Thi Bich Lien Hoang Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Bích Liên, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10040047 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vn đ để đầu tư cửa hàng tạp hoá. Chồng chị là bộ đội, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Gia đình chị có cửa hàng tạp hoá phục vụ bà con trong làng, cung cấp những mặt hàng như: phân bón, gạo, chè, rượu, bia, bánh, kẹo,….Bên cạnh đó chị còn tăng gia sản xuất, chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 100.000 đến 150.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chính những nguồn thu nhập thường xuyên theo ngày như vậy nên rất phù hợp với cách hoàn trả tuần của tổ  chức tài chính vi mô Bình Minh. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có: 

Nguyễn Thi Hằng, sinh năm 1969 (Ms 10040048 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng cắt tóc.
Hoàng Thị Bích Dịu, sinh năm 1975 (Ms 10040049 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
Đồng Thị Hiệp, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10040050 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt, gà, ngỗng.
Nguyễn Thị Kim Oanh, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 100400 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ rau.
Nguyễn Thị Cầm, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 10040051 ), mức vốn vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng may mặc.

loans.use: buôn bán nhỏ

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng O. is 38 years old, married and resides with her husband in Battambong, Cambodia. The couple have three school aged children.  She works with her husband selling groceries from her home, and is able to earn an income of US$9 a day. Cheng started selling groceries in 2002.

Cheng O. would like to take out a loan of US$1100 to increase her grocery inventory and the remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorbike to transport products from market to home.

loans.use: Increase grocery store inventory and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Penh M., 38, is married and lives with three of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer and makes $2.50 US a day while her husband is a blacksmith earning around $3 US each day as well. Three of their children are students. 

Mrs. Penh M. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to purchase steel and others blacksmith tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase steel and others blacksmith tools for her husband.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Candelaria es casada,  tiene 2 hijos menores de edad estudia educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que aporta con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos crediticios, está solicitando a AFODENIC su 2do crédito  para invertirlo en compra de ternero desarrollo, trabaja en las actividades agricola y atiende la actividad del ganadera, su esposo trabaja en conjunto con doña Candelaria en la finca de 35 Mzs, Candelaria se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta, su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario ganadero y de esta forma mejorar los condiciones del nucleo familiar y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, ademas refiere sentirse muy satisfecha por los logro y ventajas que ha obtenido su familia con los financiamientos que le brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Candelaria is married and has 2 young school-aged children. She has the support of her husband who helps her with household expenses and loan payments. She's applying for her second AFODENIC loan so that she can purchase calves and invest in her farming and livestock business. Her husband works with Candelaria on the farm. Candelaria is responsible and honest. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd of livestock and thereby improve the lives of her family and provide her children with a better future. She also says that she is satisfied with the benefits that her family has gained from the loans extended to her by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves for farming and livestock business.

loans.name: Seangbunq

texts.en:
Mr. Seangbunq N., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sokvet Theab, 28, married in 1998 and have two children: one young son and one daughter attending school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Seangbunq has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for four years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for nine years. Seangbunq’s motorbike is old and breaks down often and he plans to exchange it for a new one. That's why he is requesting his first loan of US$ 300 to add to his own money to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one for driving as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike for his motor taxi business

loans.name: Arafsho

texts.ru: Исоева Арафшо проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается пошивом больших базарных сумок и мешков. Занимается этим уже шесть лет. Кредит планирует получить и использовать его для покупки швейной машинки. Это ускорит  ее работу и она сможет в два раза больше производить свою продукцию. Погашать кредит буде в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Arafsho I. lives in Vakhdat. She is 42 years old and is married with six children. She has a high school diploma and makes a living by making large shopping bags. She's been in this business for six years. Arafsho plans to use the loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine. A new sewing machine would speed up her work and she would be twice as productive as she is now. Arafsho would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a sewing machine

loans.name: Diana Silvia

texts.es: La señora Diana Silvia T. ha pagado dos préstamos con FVP los cuales pago puntualmente. Desea nuevamente el apoyo para la colocación del vitropiso en un cuarto de su vivienda. Tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus papas que son personas ya grandes de edad. Planea pagar este préstamo con los ingresos de su empleo como auxiliar administrativo de una línea de trasportes.
texts.en:
Señora Diana Silvia T. has punctually paid back two loans with FVP. She hopes to receive their support again to put tile in a room of her home. She is responsible for caring for her parents, who are elderly. She plans to pay for this loan with the income from her job as an administrative assistant for a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile a room of her home

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia L. is a 40-year-old mother of seven. Her husband Richard is a fisherman and carpenter. Two of her children are going to enroll in college, four are in elementary school and one is still young and needs to be fed.  The family resides in a beautiful village along the sea, where fishing is the common livelihood of the people. 

 Cecilia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital. She applied for this loan to purchase a motor for their fishing boat. She wants her husband to be able to fish in a deeper part of the sea in order to have a good catch to sell volumes of fish for her savings. She has hopes of sending her children to a university, and of having a beautiful house for them to live in.

loans.use: To buy a motor  for their pump boat

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth U. D. Campos D. 43 años D. edad resiD. en Ilopango junto a su hija y su esposo. Ella tiene cuatro años D. poseer una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos como pan, bebidas, galletas entre otros más. Ruth desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar los productos D. su negocio tales como detergentes, harinas, cereales y más, esto con el fin D. aumentas sus ventas y  poder mejorar su economía familiar, ya que ella desea poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y D. la misma manera ayudar a su hija con sus estudias para que pueda obtener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ruth U. D. Campos is 43 years of age, and lives in Ilopango together with her daughter and her husband. For four years she has owned a store in which she sells perishable items like bread, drinks, and chicken, among other things. Ruth hopes to obtain a loan through which she could add new products to her store, such as detergents, flour, grains and more. This would result in greater sales for her, and would enable her to improve her family's finances. This is important to Ruth, since she hopes to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, and at the same time help her daughter with her studies so that she can obtain a better future for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos perecederos

loans.name: Mpoki

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Mpoki N. from Mbeya. She is married and has a one-year-old child. Mpoki has been running an agricultural business since 1999. Specifically, her business is the purchasing and selling of crops.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week, and she is assisted by one family member. Mpoki currently earns about $90 a month from her business. She is requesting her loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business.

Mpoki thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for sale

loans.name: Juana Salavdora

texts.es: La Señora Juana Salvadora García C. tiene 49 años, es madre soltera. Salvadora tiene un hijo que estudia y trabaja con ella. La actividad económica es la elaboración de arreglos florales. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que su Mama la inscribió en un curso para este tipo de manualidades, con el tiempo Salvadora le puso mucho empeño para sacar adelante a su familia y con el apoyo de su hijo deciden establecer una floristería a pesar de los problemas de salud que Doña Salvadora presentaba como problemas lumbares, esto no la detuvo para seguir adelante porque además tenia que sustentar las necesidades de su hogar. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de velillos, rosas, papel, alicates entre otros. El deseo de Salvadora es que sus arreglos sean de la mejor calidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana Salvadora García C. is a 49 year old single mother. She has a son who attends school and works with her. She had had a business making flower arrangements for over 9 years. She got started after her mother enrolled her in a class for this type of work. Salvadora put in a lot of effort to improve her family’s situation and with her son's support they decided to open a florist’s shop. Salvadora's health problems, such as lower back problems, have not stopped her from making progress because she has to provide for her family's needs. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of cellophane, roses, paper and wire among other things. Salvadora's dream is for her arrangements to be of the highest quality for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino M. is a simple farmer, 42 years old. He plants corn and rice which are the major products in his village. He is now requesting to borrow PHP 28,000 in order to have enough capital for his farming business and to be able to avoid a loan from capitalists with big interest rates. He is hoping that, through this amount, he will probably generate a higher yield.

Catalino is married to Marivic and they are gifted with four children: Marvin - 19 years old, a high school graduate; Michelle - 17 years old, also a high school graduate; Mark Anthony - 15 years old, an elementary graduate; and their youngest, Claire - 12 years old, a high school freshmen student. Catalino prays for the best for his children and for the progress of their daily living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
There are three low-income people who have decided to join this loan group. Its leader, Yean S., is 31. Yean S. currently retails fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing. She also buys fish from other fisherman to continue selling when her customers still need more fish. She normally makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to be responsible for her family’s daily food.

Yean S. has given birth to three children who are now secondary students. Yean S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase more implements for fishing purposes.

The other group members who have joined are:

Srey S. who will use the loan to upgrade the size of her fish shop; and

Yean S. who will use her loan to purchase a bicycle which she will use to transport fish to the market for sale.

loans.use: to  buy fishing implements

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. is a microfinance member of Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a construction worker and has supported her farm business for years already.

Farming is what Arlene enjoys most. That's why she is happy that she became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative because she can obtain a loan and, most especially, she can benefit from savings and insurance for her whole family. She wishes to live comfortably, with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her farm

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfadoras.
Renee es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Renee tiene un puesto en el mercado Chorro en donde vende comida todas las mañanas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Renee necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Renee sueña con salir adelante y brindarle todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the Triunfadoras Community Bank. She cohabits, is 29 years old and has 3 children. Renee has a stand in the Chorro market where she sells food every day, an activity that she is able to accomplish with the help of her husband. She needs a loan of $350 which she will invest in the purchase of firewood. Renee dreams of succeeding and offering all the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of firewood

loans.name: Wanglei A Ouci Teddy Group

texts.en: Teddy O., 26, married and blessed with two children attending school and taking care of one dependent, also in school, has been selling cassava flour and charcoal for the past year. She is applying for a loan to purchase bags of cassava flour and  charcoal to meet customer demand, and her hope is to expand the business and be able to support her family. Teddy's dream is to purchase a bicycle and a goat.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour and charcoal to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Devidika

texts.en:
Devidika is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 38 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 20, 15, 13,  and 8 years old.

Davidika has owned a business selling local beer for 15 years, she works 13 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Davidika`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh  in order to buy more  maize for making local beer.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Davidika hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula T. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Alamutu E. She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Paula owns & operates a business selling fried foods in the local community.  Paula has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Paula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Paula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Paula is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Paula from SPBD.  Paula plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ama Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria González de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora por las noche trabaja en un restaurante en donde lleva tres años en la cocina preparando diferentes platillos, aprovecha el día para vender y ofrecer ropa y cosmético los cuales distribuye a sus compañera de trabajo los da al crédito con facilidad de pago, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo esta desempleado y se le hace mas difícil con todo los gastos del hogar, ya que son tres hijos los que procreo dos trabajan y uno es el que estudia, sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda es por eso que con este préstamo comprara piedras, arena, cemento para hacer un muro y embaldozar el porche y gozar de las mejoras que gracias a la institución le será posible.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria González is 43 years old and is a hard-working woman. She works at a a restaurant at night, where, for 3 years, she has made different dishes. During the day, she sells clothes and make-up, which are distributed by her business partner. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Nicaragua, Managua. Her husband is unemployed and household expenses are difficult. They have 3 children, two who work and one who studies. Her plans are to improve their housing, and, with this loan, she will buy stone, sand and cement to make a wall and tile the porch. She will enjoy the improvements made possible thanks to this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for building a wall and tiling a porch

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive en la comunidad de Caluyo “Batallas” Provincia Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto con sus cinco hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la misma comunidad, su esposo esta en la Republica de Argentina por motivos de trabajo.

La señora se dedica a la extracción de leche y lo vende a PIL (Planta Industrializadora de  leche) aparte realiza trabajo de cestería y el tiempo restante se dedica a la crianza de sus hijos.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de un ganado vacuno así aumentara la producción de leche y a la vez aumentará sus ingresos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the community of Caluyo – Batallas, which is in Los Andes Province of the city of El Alto. Her five children attend school in the same community, while her husband is currently in Argentina for business reasons.

Beatriz extracts milk from her dairy cows and sells it to PIL (an industrial milk plant). She devotes part of her time to basket weaving and spends the remainder looking after her children.

Beatriz will use the funds to buy a cow so that she can increase her milk production as well as her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sukuran

texts.en:
Sukuran S. is currently in the business of selling food in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase items like rice, sugar, beans, etc., to sell. Sukuran is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, beans etc. to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 39-year-old married man with three children. Hasan has 14 years of previous experience in the construction field. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients and to increase his income to help improve his living situation.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Moussouaboua

texts.fr: Marié et père de 05 enfants, ce monsieur pour subvenir aux charges de ses enfants a ouvert en 1998 sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « LA PAIX N°2 », il est  très connu dans son quartier à cause de son dynamisme. Les périodes de fêtes de fin d’année étant proche, il voudrait en profiter au maximun et sollicite par donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de spaghetti et divers. Avec l’expérience qu’il a dans ce commerce il compte rentabiliser le crédit qu’il a obtenu.
texts.en:
Married and a father of five, this gentleman opened his own shop in 1998 to help support his children. He called the shop "PEACE #2". He is renowned in his neighborhood for his dynamism. He would like to make the most of the imminent holiday season; therefore he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 bags of rice, 10 barrels of oil, 10 cases of spaghetti and other assorted goods. He trusts that with his experience in this type of retail he will be able to use the loan to turn a profit.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, cans of oil and spaghetti boxes

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey M. M. is thirty years old, is married, and has two children aged ten years and six years.

Humphrey’s business is situated in a busy market within the town of Kakamega, and is known by the name “Golden Rules Tailoring”. He makes men's wear (i.e suits and trousers), something he has done for the last five years. He serves the local people and his major challenge is too many people doing the same business, hence making him lower his prices.

Humphrey is using his loan to buy sewing machines and materials for making suits. In future, he hopes to open a shop for supplying materials. He also has a dream to educate and bring up his children to become independent people. He really enjoys his work and is a faithful and efficient tailor.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and materials for making suits

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30 year widow with three children between 5 and 10 years of age.  She rents a one room house where she is staying with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets two meals a day. 

Sarah has a poultry farm in Kawempe Bubajjwe.  She incurs transport costs when buying chicken feed from the Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  Sarah works seven days a week .She receives an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are the rainy season which prevents her customers from reaching her because she works in a muddy place. 

Sarah has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for thirteen years, servicing her twenty sixth loan. Sarah joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feed and chicks. Sarah hopes to see her business grow bigger and to eventually own 1000 chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción P. D. F. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su única hija D. 12 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar y a ayudarle a su madre con los quehaceres del hogar. María posee un bazar en el cual comercializa ropa, zapatos, listones, juguetes y muchos otros productos. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. la Colonia Monserrat, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Es D. esta manera en como María se gana la vida desD. hace varios años, logrando mucha experiencia en el oficio y obteniendo clientes muy fieles a ella, los cuales siempre están complacidos con el servicio brindado. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, aumentado su inventario y obteniendo nuevos productos, sobre todo aquellos que están acordes con las temporadas que se van dando, como por ejemplo el día D. la amistad. Tanto para  María como para su hija las ganancias obtenidas son fundamentales para su sobrevivencia, es por ello que depositan su esperanza en el dinero obtenido para mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y así mismo las D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 52 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department. She lives with her 12 year old daughter, who goes to school and helps her with the household chores. Maria sells clothing, shoes, ribbons, toys, and many other items in the “Colonia Monserrat” marketplace, located within the San Salvador Department. This is the way Maria earns a living, and has been doing this for a number of years. She has lots of experience and has established loyal customers who are always satisfied with her service. Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of new products in order to increase her inventory, particularly products appropriate for the upcoming seasons, such as friendship day. Her earnings are essential for her and her daughter’s well being, so she is hoping to get this loan in order to improve her business and her home life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional clothing and sundry items for resale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes, mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Chiola dans la préfecture de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage, de parenté et font le commerce de produits alimentaires.
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de diversifier leurs marchandises à vendre, elles décidèrent d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire après avoir remboursé sans aucune difficulté, les trois précédents.
Ce quatrième prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 sacs de sel iodé, 16 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil et  1/2 sac de riz. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  exclusivement dans les foires de Ségou et de Konodimini. Elles effectuent leur vente à domicile et dans les foires des villages environnants au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are women, the majority of whom are married and living in monogamous families. Their average age is 39 years old and they have an average of four children. They live in the village of Chiola in the "prefecture" of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through their neighbors, their marriages and their relatives, and they sell foodstuffs. With the aim of increasing their working capital and diversifying the range of goods they sell, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and they are on their fourth group loan from this company, having repaid without any difficulty the three previous loans. This fourth loan will be used to buy 20 bags of iodized salt, 16 bags of peanuts, four bags of millet and half a bag of rice. They get their supplies exclusively from the fairs in Ségou and Konodimini. They make their sales at home and at the fairs in surrounding villages, for cash or on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the interest on their loan from Soro Yiriwaso and to meet minor family needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie B. is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for eight years.
