She produces peanut oil, which is an important ingredient of Senegalese cuisine. This loan allows her to buy peanuts to transform into oil. The revenues from this activity help her cover her children's school and medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Fokaben, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Siemana, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de l’argile.
Ces femmes du groupe Fokaben sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs d’argile blanche. Elles s’approvisionnent le plus généralement à  Barouéli et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Barouéli et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes qui restent les seules consommatrices de cette matière.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women in the Fokaben group are all married, average 47 years of age, have an average of three children and live in extended traditional families in the village of Siemana, in the prefecture of Barouéli, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met each other through relatives, and trade in clay. The women of the Fokaben group are on their fifth group loan, having repaid without incident the four previous loans. This new loan will be used to buy bags of white clay. They get most of their supplies in Barouéli and sell on the market in Barouéli and in surrounding fairs, for cash, on a retail basis, and on credit, to a customer base made up exclusively of women, who are the sole consumers of this material. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA each which will be used for daily family expenses, with the balance been reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of white clay

loans.name: Kalira's Group

texts.ru:
Любой бизнесмен, никогда не разбрасывает деньги по ветру, а стремится вложить средства в нужное дело, чтобы эти деньги не лежали, а приносили доход. Порой именно эти деньги и становятся залогом благополучного будущего. Эти качества, а именно умение предугадать будущее, прагматичность и тонкий расчёт, отличают хороших бизнесменов от невежд. Интересно представляла ли себе Калира Ибраималиева, лидер этой группы, двенадцать лет назад, когда, она, накопив деньги со своей заработной платы, купила бычка для откорма, чтобы затем перепродать его, что это занятие в дальнейшем станет её главным источником пропитания. Сейчас Калире пятьдесят один год. Она уже не работает в учреждении, а ведёт своё хозяйство. Она вырастила одного сына, и нескольких дочерей. Сын уже женат и имеет детей. Калира ведёт активный образ жизни. Она помогает мужу и сыну ухаживать за скотом, а также занимается воспитанием внуков, а их у неё трое: две внучки и один внук. Старшие две внучки уже ходят в школу, а младшему внуку всего девять месяцев.  Калира наблюдает, как растут её внуки, и хочет подготовить для них достойное наследство. За счёт разведения скота, она дала детям образование и выдала дочерей замуж. Сейчас её ежемесячный доход составляет четыре тысячи семьсот сомов ($100). Она продолжает помогать детям. Вот и теперь Калира обратилась за кредитом, чтобы оплатить учёбу жены сына. 

Айзаде Шерипбаевой двадцать восемь лет. Айзаду постигло большое испытание на прочность, так как сейчас она одна воспитывает четверых детей, из которых двое – её дочери, а двое других её племянники. Айзада – разведена. Она разводит скот, и продаёт бычков на скотном рынке. Её доход четыре тысячи девятьсот сомов. 

Токтобю Текебаевой пятьдесят один год. Муж Токтобю торгует на рынке автозапчастями, а она сама занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. За счёт скотоводства и продажи она зарабатывает чуть меньше пяти тысяч сомов. Токтобю надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить корову для увеличения поголовья. 

Нурлану Шериппаеву двадцать пять лет. Жена Нурлана – домохозяйка. Нурлан занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Он работал в России. Там накопил деньги, купил машину и занялся перевозкой пассажиров. Сейчас его доход составляет около шести тысяч сомов. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать машину. У Нурлана растут две дочери. И он поставил себе цель – купить квартиру для своей семьи.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Any businessman would never throw money into the wind, but instead strives to invest money into a good deal, so that the money earns an income. Sometimes it is this money that becomes a deposit for a prosperous future. These qualities and especially, the ability to guess the future, pragmatism and keen calculation, differentiate good businessmen from ignorant ones. It is interesting to know whether Kalira I., the leader of this group, imagined twelve years ago, when she, having saved money from her salary, bought a bull for fattening and subsequent resale, that in the future this business would become her primary source of income. Now Kalira is fifty-one years old. She no longer works at her job, but runs her business. She raised one son and several daughters. The son is already married and has children. Kalira leads an active life: she helps her husband and son take care of livestock and also helps raise the grandchildren. She has three children: two granddaughters and one grandson. The oldest two granddaughters are already in school, and the youngest grandson is only nine months old. Kalira watches how her grandchildren grow and wants to prepare a decent inheritance for them. Thanks to her livestock business, she was able to provide her children with an education and to marry off her daughters. Currently, her monthly income is four thousand seven hundred som ($100). She continues to help her children. And now Kalira requested a loan in order to pay for her daughter-in-law’s education. Ayzada S. is twenty-eight years old. She went through a great test of endurance because now she has to raise four children by herself. Two of them are her daughters, and two others are her nephews. Ayzada is divorced. She breeds livestock and sells cows at the livestock market. Her income is four thousand nine hundred som. Toktobu T. is fifty-one years old. Her husband sells auto parts at a market, and she is involved in animal husbandry and sells milk. She earns a little less than five thousand som from the animal husbandry business. Toktobu hopes to get the loan to purchase a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Nurlan S. is twenty-five years old. His wife is a homemaker. Nurlan is involved in passenger transportation. He used to work in Russia. He saved money there, bought a car and started the transportation business. Currently, his income is about six thousand som. He requested the loan in order to repair his car. Nurlan has two daughters. He set a goal to buy an apartment for his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for daughter-in-law's tuition

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie L. sells seafood products, particularly fish and shrimp, in the local community. She also runs a mini-store where she sells canned goods. Argie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities. She is 32 years old and is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She and her husband have three school-aged children. 

In 2009, Argie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Argie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital. Argie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her seafood-selling business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 26 years old and married. He has been working as an electrician for the past eight years. His customers are people from his region. He decided to start his business because of his experience. When he first started his business, he wasn’t very well known, but because of his good, fast and punctual work, he showed that he knew how to please his customers and he therefore enlarged his network.
Mohamad is asking for a loan to purchase more sophisticated tools and electrical wires for his business. His plan for the future is to keep on improving his business. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. This is his first loan and he promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electrical wires for his business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Estrella y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones alegres con sus amigas.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos que están estudiando, Mercedes vende verduras en un triciclo de manera ambulatoria por diferentes calles del Distrito de San Juan Bautista, su día se inicia a las 5 de la mañana para ir a comprar al mercado de abastos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de manzanas, platanos, zanahoria, cebolla.
Mercedes sueña con construir su segundo piso y que su hija se titule.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of "Banco Comunal Estrella" and what she likes the most are the joyful meetings with her friends.

Mercedes is married, 43 years old with 3 children who are studying. Mercedes sells vegetables from a tricycle on different streets in the District of San Juan Bautista. Her day starts at 5 o'clock in the morning when she buys her supplies at the market, assisted by her older daughter. Her loan will be invested in buying apples, bananas, carrots, and onions.

It is Mercedes' dream to add a second floor to her house and that her daughter graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apples, bananas, carrots, onions.

loans.name: Amna Bano's Group

texts.en: Amna bano is the wife of I. A. and lives in the city of Multan, Pakistan, with her husband and children. She runs a boutique in her house to support her family. She displays her stitched and embroidered clothes in her boutique which attracts more customers. Her clientele base is made up of her neighbors and relatives. The earned income helps her to pay for the utilities. Now she wants to expand her business in the market as well. She has applied for a loan from Asasah, to invest in her boutique. With the loan she will buy material in bulk such as clothes, beads, and thread. This material helps her to make more dresses to introduce her work in the market. She hopes that by doing this she can attract more customers which will greatly enhance her income.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her boutique

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y L. enseñanza D. valores.
Andrea es casada y tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con elL. y están estudiando, Andrea tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, leña, también condimentos que elL. misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además los días lunes venD. mazamorras en L. feria D. las Nazarenas.
Andrea necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que invertirá en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y jabones.
Andrea sueña con comprar un carro para viajar a las ferias y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). What she enjoys most about her group is that they encourage her to save and teach her values.

Andrea is married and has eight children, three of whom live with her and are enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, firewood, and condiments that she prepares herself. Her business is open every day. In addition, she sells “mazamorra” (corn porridge) at the Nazarene Fair on Mondays.

Andrea needs a loan of 1800 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and soap. She dreams of making improvements to her home and buying a car so that she can travel to the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and soap

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is thirty-two years old. He is married and has one child, who is four years old. He describes himself as outgoing.

His business is located at Masai Market, a busy market in Kisumu town. He sells curios to the local and international tourists. He has been in this business for the last six years. He says that this business is profitable but the major challenge is that local people are not keen to buy such things as curios; foreigners are mainly the ones who buy more. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials to make artifacts to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy materials to create additional curios to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cartons of various foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Julieta is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products like soap, toothpaste, and noodles in the community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Julieta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling children's products such as toys and games in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nery Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Nery N. tiene 43 años de edad vive en la colonia Monte Cristo de la ciudad de Danli, Nery se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia NERY.
actualmente tiene a sus hijos estudiando y estan cursando la educacion secundaria y primaria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nery N., 43, lives in Danli’s Monte Cristo neighborhood. She sells basic needs items in her grocery store, called NERY, located in her home. Her children are currently in primary and secondary school. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. She uses the profits to help her husband meet household expenses. She says he’s very happy because her business is growing more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, bags, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, lard, oil, salt, matches, soups, pasta, spaghetti, toilet paper, sweets, juices, dairy products, milk, corn flour, wheat flour, tortillas, sanitary napkins.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Jorge; El socio tiene 25 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando brindando servicio de taxi en su propio vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su auto y con más de la mitad comprar un ropero, el socio trabaja mucho y ya termino de pagar sus letras de su auto y ahora comprar sus cosas para la casa el socio es un chico joven y muy responsable, el tiene el sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad y de graduarse y trabajar o poner su propia empresa a futuro. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su auto y para comprar un ropero para él.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Caminemos juntas” (We Walk Together).  It is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, in the Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Jorge.  He is 25, single and he drives his own taxi.  He is requesting the loan to buy sound equipment for his car and also a dresser with more than half of the money.  The member works very hard and he has already finished making the payments for his car.  Now he wants to buy things for his house.  The member is a very responsible young man and he dreams of studying for a professional career at the university.  He would like to graduate and work or start his own business in the future.  

The member appreciates and values the loan granted him and also he promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment for his car and a dresser for himself.

loans.name: Tawop Asorbeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tawop Asorbeh” group from Masorie, a village in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 700,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ramatu K.. Ramatu was born in Masorie village about 37 years ago. She is married to a businessman and has five children who are attending school. Ramatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to add to her business

loans.name: Luzmila Elvira

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 51 años, vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Luzmila se considera una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un negocio que consiste en alquilar departamentos y ella se encarga de la administración del negocio.  

Luzmila con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 500 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para hacer mantenimiento de los departamentos y comprara pintura para hacer pintar las habitaciones.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 51 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Luzmila considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising person.  She has a business renting out apartments and she is in charge of the running of the business.

Luzmila plans to use her loan for $500USD to maintain her apartments.  She will buy paint to paint the rooms.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To paint rooms

loans.name: Lesalaon

texts.en:
Lesalaon Ole K., aged 42 years, is married to Meeli Lesalaon. Together they have three children: Mary, aged 24 in college; Judy, aged 20 in secondary school; and John aged 10 in primary school. Lesalaon trades livestock in Bissil market, which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to butchers in Kajiado and Kitengela for slaughter. He has been running his business for ten years and gets a monthly profit of 25,500 KES. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

Lesalaon was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela’s office. He is borrowing 20,000 KES with which he plans to use 10,000 KES to buy cows, 5,000 KES to buy goats and 5,000 KES to buy sheep for trading. If the loan boosts the business, he will buy a pickup for transporting his livestock to other towns.

Lesalaon’s dream is to become a big supplier of livestock to the Kenya meat commission’s slaughter houses like that in Dagorreti in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Teresiah Nyambura

texts.en: Teresiah has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years.  She is 48 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have one child. She heard about KADET from one of the field officers and this will be her sixth loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to pay for labor. In the future, Teresiah hopes to start a side business of livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to pay for labor

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is security bills.

He has operated a cobbling business for the past one year, selling from door to door to his neighbours especially women. John faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to own a larger retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase beads and leather for making shoes. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relation.

loans.use: To purchase beads and leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Gregorio Mariano

texts.es:
Gregorio Mariano C. S.  tiene 36 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos  en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Gregorio Mariano se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un auto y una  casa.

Le gusta jugar ala villa.
texts.en: Gregorio Mariano C. S. is 36 and married. He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 2 children. The  V.R.C. SAN JACINTO is located in the Campo Alegre area, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Gregorio Mariano works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. Hhe confronts challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase a car and a house. He enjoys playing Villa.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. In the drug shop business for three years, she started her enterprise with capital of one million shillings and eventually expanded to five million. Her main hardship is debtors, and her vision is to have a pharmacy. Enid needs the loan to purchase additional drugs for the business.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her business

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons, ages 2 and 12, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. His oldest son attends primary school. Enkhbayar’s profession is driver, though he proves to be a good entrepreneur. Enkhbayar supports his family by operating two kid’s clothing retail stalls in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with regular help from his wife. Enkhbayar began his business in 2001. During these 10 years, his business revenue supported and improved his family's living conditions. For example, his family bought their own land with 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in 2001 and built their small house with 8,000,000 MNT in 2004. They bought a small truck with 3,500,000 MNT in 2010. Now his working capital is about 4,000,000 MNT, with two inventory turnovers a month. He sells kids’ clothes all year around. Enkhbayar is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase upcoming spring clothes from Ereen City, China. It is best to purchase now, before the price increases and Chinese wholesalers go on vacation for their Lunar New Year for about a half a month. His family's goal is to move out of the ger district and buy their own apartment.

loans.use: To purchase spring clothes

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Santa Cruz De Mechoacan este grupo se llama así porque todas sus integrantes viven en el barrio santa cruz y su localidad es Santa Catarina Mechoacan es por el cual le denominaron así. Todas las integrantes se dedican a una actividad economica el cual le ayuda a sobrevivir economicamente, estas mujeres son de raza indigena y trabajadoras y honradaz. Las personas de este grupo es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo, y lo solicitaron debido a la necsidad que tenian de comprar mas insumos para la elaboracion de sus productos.
La señora Angelica es la que oragnizo este grupo ya que su hermana le comento sobre la fundacion, ya que su hermana pertenence a otro grupo y por ello que les hizo la inviatcion y con ello empezaron a reunir personas hasta que formaron el grupo que esta integrado por 10 personas.
La representante D. este grupo es la señora Angelica Beatriz de 22 años de edad vive en union libre con el señor Ferdi Martinez, ella tan solo tiene un hijo de un año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos y a la elaboracion de totopos (tortillas doradas) es por ello que solicito el prestamo para comprar insumos para la elaboracion de antojitos y totopos, las ganancias que obtiene los utiliza para su hijo y para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. 
En esta ocasion comentare respecto a la señora Ilda de 34 años de edad esat casada con el señor Rufino quien tiene el oficio de policia. La señora Ilda tiene 3 hijos quienes estudian, dos estudian la secundaria y uno la primaria.
La señora Ilda comenta que es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo y esto surgio debido a la necesidad que tenia de comprar mas insumos para la venta de tamales, los tamales que realiza son: mole de pollo, cerdo en salsa verde, mole de camaron, pollo en salsa verde, etc.
Hilda comenta que su esposo la convencio para integrarse al grupo ya que ella tenia miedo de no poder realizar los pagos ya que ahí dias en que ahí ventas y otras que no, pero su esposo le dijo que la ayudaria a pagarlos y pues para que no se le hiciera mucho que solo solicitara poco dinero. Ella dice que su esposo siempre la apoya en todo.
Ella desea engrandecer su negocio ya que es una actividad que le ayuda mucho para sustentar a su familia sobre todo a sus hijos que estan estudiando, ya que ella quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesion.
Las integrantes de este grupo son las siguientes y tienen las respectivas actividades economicas:
Rosalba: de 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Angelica Beatriz: de 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Lucia: de 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Soledad
Estela: de 28 años de edad se de se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Ignacia: de 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tostadas para la venta.
Altagracia: de 40 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tacos para la venta.
Celerina: de 31 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollos para la venta.
Ilda: de 34 años de edad se de se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Cesilia: de 58 años de edad se de se dedica a la venta de compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Santa Cruz de Mechoacan" because its members live in the Santa Cruz neighborhood, located in Santa Catarina, Mechoacan so that's why they named it that.  All of the members do something that helps them manage economically.  These women are indigenous, hard workers, and honorable.  This is the first time the members of this group are taking out loans; they are taking out loans because they need to buy supplies to make their products.  

Mrs. Angelica is the one who organized the group since her sister told her about the foundation.  Her sister belongs to another group, hence the invitation.  With this, she began to gather people to form the group that is maD. up of ten members.

Mrs. Angelica Beatriz, 22, is the group's representative.  She lives with her partner, Mr. Ferdi Martinez and only has one child who is one years  old.  She sells snacks for a living and makes totopos (golden tortillas) which is why she is taking out a loan to buy ingredients to make snacks and totopos.  She uses the income she earns for her son and to help with household expenses.  

Now I will talk about Mrs. Ilda, 34, married to Mr. Rufino who works as a police officer. Mrs. Ilda has three children in school.  Two are in high school and one in grade school.  Mrs.IIda says that this is her first loan and it's because she needs to buy supplies for the sale of tamales.  She makes the following tamales:  chicken mole, pork in green sauce, shrimp mole, chicken in green sauce, etc.  Hilda says her husband convinced her to join the group since she was afraid she wouldn't be able to make the payments since there are days when there are sales and others none.  But her husband told her he would help her with the payments and so he wouldn't have to do much, she is only asking for a little bit of money.  She says her husband has always supported her in everything.  She wishes to grow her business since it's work that really helps to support her family and above all her children who are studying as she wants her kids to have a profession.

The members of this group are the following and have their respective economic activities: Rosalba: 35 years old is dedicated to the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Angelica Beatriz: 22 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Lucia: 30 years of age is engaged in the sale of the purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Estela C. Q. Soledad G. G.: 28 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Ignacia Q. H.: 35 years old is purchases materials for the manufacture of chips for sale. Altagracia: 40 years of age purchases materials for making tacos for sale. Celerina G. O.: 31 years of age purchases chickens for sale. Ilda: 34 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Cesilia: The 58-year-old is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to sell appetizers.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 54, resides with her family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. 

C. is a farmer, earning an income of US $1 per day. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $0.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $60 on food and US $6 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $500 for motorbike spare parts to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to resell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie B. is from the city of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Marjorie is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Marjorie runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Marjorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, bagoong (fish paste) and dried fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marjorie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bagoong and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus 45 ans, Monsieur Almoudou T. est marié et père de 4 filles, il réside avec sa famille à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de trente années à la couture auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atélier se situe au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu la présidence du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) et des tissus d’homme afin de les revendre aux tailleurs de Sikasso. 
Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est en partenariat il y environ trois années. Ce quatrième crédit lui permettra d’acheter 20 machines à coudre et accessoires et 12 complets tissus.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. T. Almoudou is more than 45 years old, he is married and has four daughters. He lives with his family in Medina, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). Not having had the chance to get ahead in school, he started over by sewing with his uncle in Sikasso over thirty years ago. His workshop is located in the large market of Sikasso and most of its clients are mostly male salesmen.

With such strong experience, he has the complete confidence of the tailors' association and this earned him the chairmanship of the Supervisory Committee of the Association of Tailors Sikasso (TTY). In addition to sewing, he purchases sewing machines in Lome (Togo Republic) and fabric for mens' clothes in order to resell them to the other tailors in Sikasso.

In order to better meet his increasingly growing orders, he is requesting his fourth loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He has been partnering with Soro Yiriwaso for about three years. This fourth loan will enable him to purchase 20 sewing machines, accessories and 12 sets of fabric. With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 300 000 FCFA. With these profits, he intends to pay for all essential personal expenses, contribute to family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods (fabric, sewing machines etc.)

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 20 years old and lives with her mother in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Her mother is in her retirement with monthly earning of 123,000 MNT. 

Enhtuya operates a grocery trading business out of a rented stall in a grocery store. She started her business in January 2010 with working capital of 700,000 MNT. Even in that short period of time, she has managed to establish her business. Now her working capital exceeds 1,700,000 MNT.

She is planning to rent one more stall starting in July 2011. She is a diligent and open-minded lady who possesses lots of good personality. She says, "I want to buy an apartment in the future." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a cosmetics business in the Philippines, and has been. in this business for two years.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of perfumes and cosmetics to sell.  In the future, Rose would like to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of perfumes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells cloth and material at Amoanda near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and material to supply her increasing number of customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and material to sell.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar Wilder de 19 años y Gleydi de 13 años de edad. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Nery recalca que todo lo que viene con el nombre de cacao genera negocio, es por ello que trata de darle el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao, y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de su producto agrícola. Sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse todo lo que pueda; pero sabe que esta actividad requiere de un mayor esfuerzo es así que contrata jornaleros para le faciliten en la extracción de sus productos para que rápidamente puedan ser vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio considerable. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como tienda de zapatos. Este es su Q. crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura en que tendrá mucho éxito en su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mas plantas de cacao ya que tiene previsto injertarlos a medida que van desarrollando.
texts.en:
Nery is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two school-age children: 19 year-old Wilder and 13 year-old Gleydi.  They live together in their own home in the town of Santa Rosa which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle.

Nery tells us that everything that comes with the name of cacao generates business.  For this reason, she tries to provide the best care for her cacao plantations and many of her buyers are happy with the quality of her produce.  Nery puts a lot of effort into everything she can but she knows that this business requires more effort and so she hires day laborers to help her in harvesting her crops so that they can be sold quickly to the middlemen in her town at a good price.  Nery's plan for the future is to invest her profits in other types of business such as a shoe store.

This is Nery's fifth loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She also predicts that she will enjoy a lot of success with her community bank.  Nery will use the loan she has requested to buy more cacao plants since she plans to graft them as they develop.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is 37 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products. She has had this business for 5 years. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

Eveline is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. Each month, Eveline earns about Php 3,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Eveline hopes that her business will improve and expand in order to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and six children; five of them are still attending school. He has been working as a fisherman for more than 15 years. He owns a fishing boat. He works hard during the summer season to make a good profit since his sales increase during this season. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required fishing equipment and supplies. He will also perform much needed repairs on his fishing boat. These modifications will facilitate his fishing operation and make it more secure especially in rough weather. In the future, he would like to purchase another boat.

loans.use: to purchase required fishing equipment and supplies and perform much needed repairs on his fishing boat.

loans.name: Ligia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ligia es una mujer de poca palabra pero mucha acción, luchadora y llena de esperanza.
Ella necesita un préstamo de ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para la compra de una computadora portátil, para así brindarle un mejor servicio a las socios de la Empresa.
Ella pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ormubangor S.A.
texts.en: Ligia is a woman of few words but a lot of action, a fighter and full of hope.  She is in need of a loan in the amount of 400,000 CRC to buy a lap-top computer so she can provide better service to the members of the company.  She belongs to the Communal Bank Company, Ormubangor S.A.

loans.use: To buy a lap-top computer.

loans.name: Rysbu's Group

texts.en:
Rysbu is the leader of this group. She is 29 and married to a builder.   She and her husband are raising two daughters and a son, all of whom are preschool age (under seven).  Rysbu works as a teacher at school. Seven years ago, she saved her salary and spent it on purchasing two livestock animals. She breeds livestock and then resells it at the higher price. With the profits gained from this activity she purchased household appliances and improved the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan, Rysbu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kirizo

texts.en:
Kirizo is a 38-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his desire is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity.

He has been hiring tents and decorating for seven years. His hardship is insufficient capital to run the business and his vision is to become the leading decorator in the region.

Kirizo needs the loan to buy tents for hire.

loans.use: To buy tents for hire.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune homme célibataire qui a arrêté ses études après deux échecs à l'examen de fin d'études primaires.Il s'est ainsi engagé comme apprenti dan la boutique de son oncle pour apprendre le commerce.Il s'installe plus tard à son propre compte avec 350 000F reçus d'une tontine.Aujourd'hui, il propose dans sa cantine au marché central des habits, des chaussures et des bijoux.Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que des charges d'alimentation et de paiement de factures d'eau et d'électricité de la famille.Il sollicite un prêt de 400 000F à l'UIMCEC pour l'achat de 200 pièces  d'habits, 100 paires de chaussures et 50 pièces de bijoux.La vente de ces produits l'aidera à mieux participer à l'entretien de sa famille.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young single man who quit his studies at the end of the primary school cycle after failing the exam twice. His uncle hired him as an apprentice to learn the trade of commerce in his shop. He eventually branched out on his own with a capital of 350,000F received from a tontine (a revolving savings fund).

Nowadays, he has a booth at the central market where he sells clothes, shoes and jewelry. His income allows him to support himself and to help his family with the food, water and electricity bills. 

He is seeking a loan of 400,000F with UIMCEC to purchase 200 pieces of clothing, 100 pairs of shoes, and 50 pieces of jewelry. The sale of this merchandise will allow him to contribute even more to his family’s well-being. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 200 pieces of clothing, 100 pairs of shoes, and 50 pieces of jewelry for resale

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 
Marisa has a shop that sells cosmetics  other ready to wear products like shoes, sandals, jeans and shirts from NATASHA , MSE  and AVON Company.. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA, MSE & AVON.
Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь женат. У него трое детей. Он живет в селе Иза, Закарпатская область. Василь закупает товары из лозы, а именно мебель и корзинки, и реализует их на рынках Украины. Его товар – всегда качественный, торговое место у Василя хорошее. Он занимается реализацией этого товара уже 13 лет. 

Василь планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить изделия из лозы и реализовать их на востоке Украины. Так как конкуренция в селе большая, Василь планирует двигаться на восток, где такой тип изделий высоко ценится и есть возможность получить неплохую прибыль. Вложив больше средств в свое дело, Василь надеется получить больше прибыли и внести плату за обучение двух своих детей в высшем учебном заведении. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Vasyl is married. He has three children. He lives in the village of Iza, Zakarpatskaya Region. Vasyl buys wicker products, more specifically furniture and baskets, and sells them at markets across the Ukraine. His goods are always of high quality. He has a good vending location. He has been selling these wares for 13 years.

Vasyl plans to use his loan of 20,000 UAH in order to stock up on wicker products and resell them in Eastern Ukraine. Because the competition in his village is high, Vasyl plans to travel  to the eastern part of the country, where this type of goods is highly sought after and it is possible to earn decent revenues. After making a larger investment in his business, Vasyl hopes to increase his revenues and  pay college tuition for two of his children.

Note: the loan description is in Russian

loans.use: to buy wicker furniture and baskets and resell them in eastern Ukraine

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús, vive en casa propia en la zona oriental del país en zona urbana junto a  su compañero de vida Manuel,  mamá y dos sobrinos menores de edad por quienes ella es quien responde económicamente a falta de sus padres. Mientras Manuel es albañil, Teresa de Jesús ha logrado instalar desde hace muchos años y después de inmenso esfuerzo una tienda en su misma casa de residencia, por medio de la cual provee a sus vecinos productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, alimentos enlatados, carne de pollo, embutidos, pañales desechables, entre otros.  El ingreso generado por Teresa es lo que provee el alimento diario de esta familia además sirve para pagos de los servicios básicos de agua y luz, dado que los ingresos que percibe su esposo son muy bajos para cubrir las necesidades de éste hogar. La actitud positiva, responsable  y emprendedora de Teresa es la que ha permitido que  éste no sea primer crédito que maneje y esa buena experiencia  es la que ha hecho que solicite nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para incrementar la variedad de productos que sus clientes están demandando: detergentes, aceites, leche, medicinas, azúcar refinada,  desodorantes antitranpirantes para hombre y mujeres; espera que con esto pueda incrementar sus ventas y consecuentemente sus ganancias a fin de mejorar el sostenimiento económico de toda su familia.-
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús lives in her own home in the eastern part of the country.  She lives in an urban area with her life companion Manuel, her mom, and two young nephews for whom she is financially responsible as they are orphans.  

While Manuel works in construction, Teresa de Jesús managed many years ago, with much effort, managed to set up a store in her home.  With this store, she provides her neighbors with everyday products such as bulk grains, canned food, chicken, sausages, disposable diapers, and other things.  The income Teresa generates is what covers the daily food expenses for her family as well as paying for the basic utilities (water and electricity), as her husband's income is too low to cover these necessary household expenses.

Teresa's positive attitude and responsible and enterprising nature has allowed her to achieve this.  This is not her first loan that she has managed, and as a result of her good experience, she is requesting her ninth loan through INTEGRAL.  This loan is to increase her variety of products to meet demand from her customers, by buying detergents, oils, milk, medicines, white sugar, antiperspirant deodorants for men and women, among other things.

She hopes that with this she will be able to increase her sales and subsequently her earnings, with the end goal of improving the financial situation for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy detergents, oils, milk, medicines, white sugar, antiperspirant deodorants for men and women, among other things that she doesn't currently have.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran (in the photo) is a diamond cutter in Phnom Penh. His wife, Chinda, is a rice farmer and raises pigs at home. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is young. The family is living in a village across the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saran is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000, to assist in his wife’s pig raising business. The loan will be used to buy additional pigs to raise and pig feed.

loans.use: To assist in his wife’s pig raising business by buying pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. He operates a motorbike transport business to support his family. He also sells clothes to earn extra income. Philip is able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 54-year-old married man, father of four children, and owner of a small grocery store since 2000. 
Ali is a hardworking man, with a good customer care talent.  He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special refrigerator for the poultry he’s planning to display.
His shop is located in a very important spot on the main road and next to the school, which makes his business turn over in a very special way. 
He hopes to stay capable of managing his business, to keep on providing a good living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a special display refrigerator

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn, a 64-year-old married woman living in the Philippines, has been raising pigs to earn a living for the past 15 years. A new member of HSPFI, Marlyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feeds for the pigs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Manuela Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Manuela, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8 y 6 años y un bebé de meses, sus dos hijos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella junto con su marido se dedican  a venta de pescado,  su esposo todos los días en la madrugada se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el mejor pescado directamente a los pescadores, mientras ella se queda en casa arreglando  a sus hijos para que vayan  a la escuela, luego cuando él regresa  los dos se van a recorrer la ciudad en su carro a vender el pescado, también entregan todos los días a comedores y restaurantes de la ciudad con  lo cual aseguran una buena cantidad de ventas, lleva más de 2 años en este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The Virgen Maria ("Virgin Mary") communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisans, whose work is known nationally and internationally. The city's climate is warm and the gastronomy is varied.
Manuela lives in this area. She is 34 and in a common-law marriage. They have an 8-year-old and a 6-year-old, who are in school, and a young baby. Her husband is a merchant.
Manuela and her husband sell fish. Every morning at dawn, her husband travels to the city of Manta to buy the best fish directly from the fishermen. Manuela stays at home and gets the kids ready for school. Later, when he comes home, they drive together through the city in their car, selling the fish. They also deliver to restaurants and eateries every day, which guarantees them high sales. They have had this business for over two years and it is going very well for them.
This loan is for the purchase of fish. Manuela has been part of the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the group is very united.
Her dream is to offer her young children the best.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона жительница Яванского района. Ей 21 года. Она замужем. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Рухшона занимается растениеводством. Она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается год. Кредит берет для посева озимых культур.
texts.en: Rukhshona is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 21 years old. Her husband is in Russia. Rukhshona herself grows crops. In front of her home she has a small piece of land where she sows wheat and grows vegetables. She has been in this line of work for a year. She is requesting a loan to sow the winter crops.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is 51 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region of Sevan as each of her four children is married and lives separately from Dilbar.

Dilbar worked milking cows for several years; but, since 1990, she has been running an agricultural business and a trading business simultaneously. Dilbar has two cows, two calves and 30 chickens and produces dairy products and eggs, which she sells from her farm.  She also sells a variety of food items and household goods from a small stall that is situated in her yard.  The income she generates from this work helps her to support herself, but she said it is not always sufficient to develop her farm and trading business. 

Dilbar is requesting a loan of 350,000 AMD to buy one more calf for her farm and to buy some foodstuffs for her stall.

This is Dilbar’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy a calf for her farm and some foodstuffs for her stall.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Ms Minh is 44 years old with two children who are in high school. She is managing a small grocery shop which was set up 5 years ago. This shop creates stable income for her family. Joining in SEDA's credit program in 2007, she used loans effectively in expanding her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Sabeeha's Group

texts.en:
Sabeeha is 52 years old, married, and has three sons. Her eldest son operates a clothing sales business, while the other remains at home and is currently looking for work. 

Her husband sells fruit. He always provides fresh seasonal fruit to his customers for low rates and earns reasonably good profits from his business. Sabeeha is a housewife; she stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy clothes in bulk quantity and in a greater variety, which will allow him to make more sales and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Sabeeha is confident of his business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Godness

texts.en:
Godness is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in hardware as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses, like farming, where he earns an extra income. 

He started this business to sustain his family. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to add stock in his business. He has a vision of opening up other hardware branches in nearby trading centres.

He is requesting for a loan to buy hardware items to sell.

loans.use: to buy hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 47 years old, married with three children.

Noemi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to pbuy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft-drinks, bread, spices and other personal care products.

Noemi has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from by and sell ready to wear.

Noemi aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pbuy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft-drinks, bread, spices and other personal care produts

loans.name: Juana Lorenza

texts.en:
Juanita has a groceries store, which she began some years ago; she began her business because she had the necessity to help her partner with the home expenses, her husband works as bricklayer and his income does not allow him to cover all the family expenses. With 2 children to care, she looks the way to offer to her children studies and a better quality of life. When she began, she sold sodas and snack products, and then she included video games and some groceries.

At the moment her business continues growing and her clients require another kind of products, these are demanded in great quantity, but Juanita does not have the capacity to increase her merchandise. She needs of $200 USD to purchase these kinds of products and she can increase the products capacity from her business and increase her sales as well.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Doña Juanita tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual inicio algunos años atrás. Lo inició con la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que su pareja trabaja como albañil y su ingreso no le permite cubrir con todos gastos de la familia. Con 2 hijos a su cuidado, ella busco la manera para poder ofrecerles estudios y una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando empezó, vendía refrescos y productos para botana, después incluyo juegos de video y algunos abarrotes.

Actualmente su negocio sigue creciendo hasta el modo que sus clientes requieren de otro tipo de productos, estos demandados son demandados en gran cantidad, pero Doña Juanita no tiene la capacidad de incrementar su mercancía. Ella necesita de $200 USD para comprar estos productos y de esta forma puede aumentar la capacidad de productos en su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu owns a stationery shop in Vingunguti Relini in Dar es Salaam. The shop sells general stationery (files, ball pens, marker pens, counter books, flip charts, office pins, paper clips, paper punches etc.)  She recently realized the high demand for primary and secondary school textbooks. She has also noticed that in the area where she operates there is no shop selling such items. She wants to utilize this opportunity.  To fully utilize the opportunity Zainabu is in need of USD 750 to purchase the required level of stock. This new line of business will enable her to increase her income and get an opportunity to educate her children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly B., 51 years old, is a mother of 7 children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes around $3/day in revenue by growing and cultivating crops on a farm. Her husband is a farmer as well as a construction foreman, and his wage assists in financing his household. B. hopes the loan will help her to purchase some construction tools for her husband's work, and to assist in buying seeds for her farm. Eventually, B. hopes to save money to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for operating a business, and buy seeds for her farm

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S., 34, is married with four children. She runs her small business in a neighbor’s shop in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  She sells children’s clothes and cotton fabrics. She uses the profits for her four children's education and other school requirements while her husband provides food and clothing.  Mariama would like to expand her stock and is requesting a loan of $175.  This will also enable her to extend her sales activity to other close villages during village market days.

loans.use: Expand clothes and fabric stock to extend sales to close villages

loans.name: Laura Lorena

texts.es:
"Due to the lack of money, I have not been able to put a roof on three rooms in my home. I would like to complete that construction so that we can live in those rooms because my house is very small." I request $1,200 to finish the construction on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Debido a la falta de dinero no he podido poner el techo en tres cuartos de mi casa y me gustaria terminar esa construcción para poder habitar esos cuartos ya que mi casa es muy pequeña” Solicito $1, 200.00 dlls para poder terminar la construcción en mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Concrete roof for three rooms.

loans.name: Estela De

texts.es:
Estela is 40 years old and works as a seamstress making all kinds of clothing. Her husband works as a welder and electrician for a small enterprise called SEW and occasionally does work for a large dairy and a cooking-oil refinery. They share a home with their son through an anticrético. [Translators note: an antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is an interesting rental arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read more about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] Estela has a small workshop in their home and has been sewing for at least five years. No one else in her neighborhood does tailoring so Estela has little competion. She also benefits from an excellent location near the Warnes Stadium. She always has work to do. Estela hopes to use this loan to buy ten bolts of cloth at about $40 each. In addition to making clothes on order for the general public, she sews uniforms for two local businesses: Pil Andina, a dairy, and Fino, a vegetable oil refinery. This is her third loan from this institution. She repaid her previous loan punctually. Estela also has a small loan outstanding from Crecer which she is repaying now.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Estela es una señora de 40 años de edad, que se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. actualmente vive en contrat de anticrético en la casa de su garante, su esposo trabaja como soldador y electricista en la Micro empresa SEW, misma que presta servicios a PIL ANDINA y a FINO, sólo tienen un hijo.

Estela tiene su pequeño taller de sastrería tipo artesanal en su misma casa, lleva por lo menos unos cinco años de experiencia en dicha actividad.

La competencia es baja, ya que por su zona es la única que realiza u ofrece sus servicios como modista, más aún que se encuentra excelentemente ubicada, al lado de una plazuela cerca del Stadium de Warnes, por lo que siempre se encuentra con trabajos para realizar.

Con la presente solicitud tiene planificado comprar unos diez rollos de tela más o menos a un precio promedio de $us. 40.- cada uno, pues aparte de hacer prendas para el público común, confecciona uniformes para la PIL ANDINA, FINO y otras empresas.

Este es su tercer préstamo en nuestra Institución, los anteriores créditos los ha pagado de manera puntual, paralelamente también cuenta con un pequeño crédito en Crecer que lo mantiene vigente.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
H. Araz has been engaged in this business for 6 years.  He is from Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of the Azerbaijan Republic.  He is single and lives with his parents.  

He has his own mini shop and is the only breadwinner in his family because his parents are old.  With this business, he was able to earn some money.  However, this money was enough for only some of his family's basic needs, and he had difficulty covering other family consumption needs.  If he does some repair work on his business place, he will be able to earn enough money for his family.
 
Now, he needs to borrow a loan of $400 to expand his business area, make necessary changes and to repair his workplace.  He hopes that this expandsion will improve the living conditions of his family.  He will repay the loan within 6 months.

loans.use: to expand his business area, to make necessary changes and to repair work place

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hai has 2 children who are still in school. Her family has difficulty in making ends meet. Their income comes from selling fruit and breeding animals. To expand their business, her family borrowed $125 from Binh Minh CDC (Kiva's partner in Vietnam). Now she would like to borrow $150 more.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học, đời sống gia đình chị khá vất vả. Thu nhập của gia đình từ việc buôn bán hoa quả và chăn nuôi. Để tăng quy mô kinh doanh, gia đình chị đã vay 2006000 VND từ chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh minh cdc

loans.use: selling fruit

loans.name: Saidi's Pazi Group

texts.en:
Saidi Abdallah, age 43, is married and lives with her husband. Saidi owns a small general store, which she started 3 years ago. Working from 6am-7pm daily, she earns about $140 a month from this business.

In the past, Saidi successfully took out one previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a new loan to purchase more shop inventory. Saidi belongs to the loan group called Pazi and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Fatuma H. and Fatuma J.. These women have businesses dealing in food vending and carpentry.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Hadija's Msanga 1 Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 10 years old. Hadija sells cloth. She started in 1990. Everyday, she works from 10am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

In the past, Hadija has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy a sewing machine. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 2 children. She travels to a town far away to buy iced fish for processing and selling. She doesn't have enough capital to buy more fish to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

Ama B. is requesting a loan for $525 to buy more fish for processing and selling.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and selling

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia has much strength in spite of the accident she suffered when she fell from a second story floor, which left her bed ridden for a month during which time her family’s needs continued to grow. So Olimpia began to return to her daily activities as soon as she was able to do so. She sells coats and clothing items made of polartec. She began her business 2 years ago and she is happy that with daily effort her income has been growing and her family’s well-being ensured. Her wish is to continue growing her business. Recently she has gone in to business with her beloved daughter and they have decided to start their own seamstress shop, and for that reason she is asking for a loan in order to aquire a great quantity and variety of raw material to fulfill this business plan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Olimpia, tiene muchas fuerzas a pesar del accidente que tuvo tras caerse de un segundo piso la cual la mantuvo un mes postrada en cama y como es común las necesidades no se postergan, por esa razón Olimpia empezó a retomar sus actividades luego de tener pocos avances en su recuperación. Ella vende frazadas y prendas de vestir a base de tela polar, emprendió su negocio hace 2 años y está contenta de que con el esfuerzo diario van incrementándose sus ganancias y el bienestar de su familia. Su deseo es continuar e implementar su negocio. Hace poco se ha asociado con su amada hija y han decidido emprender su propio taller de confección, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir gran cantidad y variedad de materia prima para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to being work in her small seamstress shop working together with her beloved daughter.

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en: Hijran M. is a 46-year-old woman who sells milk and dairy products to local people and milk factory. She started her business in 1989. She is married and has three children. They have all lived together in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement since 1993. Their life conditions improved with the first loan that Hijran borrowed form Aqroinvest four years ago. With that loan she purchased her milk cow and earned money. She successfully repaid her first loan. As she and her husband are unemployed, the dairy business is their family's sole source of income. Now Hijran would like to improve her family's life conditions again and for this purpose she has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase one milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Marcos José

texts.es:
Mr. Marcos C. has been in the food sales business for the past 10 years on the outskirts of the El Viejo Town Market in the city of Chinandega. He prepares the food himself and sells them once they are ready.

What Mr. C. currently needs as soon as possible is the purchase of supplies to prepare food in order to offer them to his clients. That is reason why he is looking for Ceprodel’s help in obtaining the credit for the purchase of these supplies and in that way to be able to continue with his high quality food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marcos C. se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de alimentos en las afueras del mercado del municipio de El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Los alimentos los prepara el mismo y una vez que están elaborados los comercializa en su sector.

Actualmente, la necesidad atravesada por el señor C. es que necesita lo más pronto posible la adquisición de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de estos productos y así continuar con su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos de alta calidad.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
