Emelia, a 48-year-old trader, is a widow and mother of seven children who are all currently in school. She trades in yams, millet, shear butter, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other items in the local market. Through this business, she has supported two kids through senior high school.

Emelia is seeking this loan to enable her to buy increased stock of yams, millet, shear butter, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education and give them hope for a brighter future. She belongs to a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel O. is fifty-four years old. He is married with six children and hails from Uromi town, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells  second-hand computers and other electrical items like bulbs, conduit, pipe, etc. He has been in this business since 1980 selling his goods to people in his community. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy more second-hand computers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand computers for sale

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: El señor M. es taxista acompañado con un hijo menor de edad el cual esta en primaria su compañera trrabaja en el mercado la estacion vendiendo ropa ambos se ayudan para salir adelante con su pequeño hijo, el tiene 14 años de trabajar como transportista  lleva trace credito con fundacion leon 2000 los cuales manifiesta le han servido para sacar adelante a su familia y poderles dar a sus hijos mayores una carrera  universitaria y  heredarles su casa a cada uno  uno de sus grandes sueños es poder formar al ultimo de sus hijos y estblecerse con un buen negocio para poder pasar su vejez
texts.en:
M. is a taxi driver and he is accompanied with his young son who is currently going to primary school. His partner works in the market selling clothing and they help each other to raise their son. He has been working as a taxi driver for 14 years and he has been given loans by Fundacion Leon 2000. These loans have given him the opportunity to care of his family and to provide their now adult children with a university career. And he will be able give them their house as an inheritance. One of his great dreams is to send the last of his children to school. He also wishes to have a well established business as he moves into his golden years.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoem D. is a villager in Chan Teab village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Hout, is a motor vehicle driver. They do not earn enough money to meet their  needs. Therefore Mrs. Chhoem D. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to raise and thus add to her business income. 

Mrs. Chhoem D. is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. She hopes to increase the family income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and add to her business income.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: Mr. Seun P. lives in Lvea Sor Kandal Village in Kandal Province. He owns a 2.5-hectares farm where he cultivates rice. The soil on this farm is poor, so Mr. Seun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Pa Koem Yeang, is a Khmer cake seller who can make a small income to support the family. Mr. Seun P. is 47 years old and the father of eight children, three of whom are employed in different businesses and the other five attend the local school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin S. is 35 years old and she now lives in Vield village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her field. In order to solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase them for this purpose. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan.

Mrs. Sophoin S. has five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of three and five years old. Her husband, Mr. Chen Kosal, is a construction worker. Her husband and children are shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila se dedica a la venta de comida, ella no cuenta con un espacio dentro de su casa para poder abrir un pequeño restaurante por lo que debe de repartir cliente por cliente el almuerzo de cada uno.

Hace tres años que dejó su trabajo como servicio doméstico para emprender este nuevo negocio. Ella afirma que se cansó de la limpieza de casas y que ahora le va mucho mejor preparando almuerzos.     

Con el tiempo, a Lusmila le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes y atender en su casa a más clientes. Por ahora, con las ganancias de su trabajo ella logra criar junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil eventualmente, a sus siete hijos y además correr con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Lusmila sells food from a space within her house, where she runs a small restaurant in which she must distribute food to her clients one by one, according to each of their requests. It has been three years since she left her job in domestic services to start this new business. She says that she got tired of cleaning houses, and that no she is much better off preparing lunches. With time, Lusmila would like to have a store of groceries and to attend to more clients in her house. For now, with the earnings from her job, Lusmila’s goal is to raise her seven children and continue maintaining the expenses of the home, with the help of her husband who is a construction worker.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for the roof of her house/business location.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita A. is 38-years-old. She has a store in her hometown where she sells a variety of goods. The money she makes from selling her products pays for her family's daily expenses and her childrens' school fees. She wants to expand her business. She dreams of having a chain of stores in her hometown one day.

Marita is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. She believes that the loan will help increase her store's profits.

CEVI gives Marita the credit assistance that she needs. CEVI also provides her with training and insurance services.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: ирзоев Таварали житель города Вахдат. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Возраст 52 года. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того для того, чтобы увеличить доход , занимается животноводством. Имеет большое хозяйство и несколько голов бычков. В данный момент возникла проблема с комбикормами и поэтому планирует получить кредит для того закупить комбикорма. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tavarali M. lives in Vakhdat. He is 52 years old and is married with five children. Tavarali has a university degree and works as a school teacher. In addition to teaching, in order to increase his earnings Tavarali is involved in livestock breeding. He has a large farm and several bull calves. At the moment he is having problems with fodder and is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase fodder. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fodder

loans.name: Lilliam Mayela

texts.es: Doña Liliam  tiene 42 años de edad con un hijo de 11 años que estudia la primaria, reside en el barrio 380 en ciudad de Managua, su negocio es un cafetín que administra desde hace veinte años, el cual inicio vendiendo ropa, en el cafetín vende comida, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas y variedad de productos que este al alcance de sus clientes. Sus planes es poder dar estudio a su hijo  para que sea un joven de bien. Con este crédito quiere comprar productos variados como granos básicos, comida chatarra, jugos y otros para ofertar siempre a sus clientes. Su anhelo es importar mercadería de ropa y zapatos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Liliam is 42 years old and has an 11 year old son who is in primary school. She lives in district 380 in the city of Managua. For twenty years she has run a café that sells food, refreshments, soda, candy and a variety of other products to her customers.

Her cafe will now start selling clothing as well. She hopes to be able to give her son an education so that he can become a good boy.

With this loan she would like to buy products such as basic grains, snack food, juices, etc. to offer to her customers. Additionally, her goal is to import merchandise like clothes and shoes to secure even better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kerrie Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and food to sell.

loans.name: Solof Group

texts.en: Mrs. M. Zam is 33 years old, married with 7 children and 2 orphans, all going to school. Mrs. M. Zam has been selling clothes that are gomases (traditional wear) for over 8 years now. She will use this loan to buy gomases. The added capital will make her business boom. She is proud that she can take care of her family and pay her kids' school fees. She is determined to construct a residential house and tenant houses for rent.

loans.use: To buy gomases (traditional wear)

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est un résident du quartier de hedrzanawoè à Lomé, il est veuf et a 03 enfants à sa charge, pour subvenir à leurs besoins il a commencé le commerce des articles de friperie dans le marché de Cokétimé, il s’approvisionne au marché de hedzranawoé où le commerce de friperie est très développé. Voulant agrandir son commerce pour réaliser plus de profit et mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 01 balle de vêtements pour enfant, 01 balle de chemise et 02 balles de pantalons.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is a resident of the district of Hedrzanawoè in Lomé. He is a widower raising 3 children, and to support them, he began selling used clothing in the market of Cokétimé. He buys his merchandise in the market of Hedzranawoé where the buying and selling of used clothing is a big business. Wishing to expand his business so as to make more profit and thus support his family better, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy one bale of children's clothing, one bale of shirts, and two bales of pants.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1435050996) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four adult children. N. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for her livestock.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres, su esposo Joel y sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la provincia de Huaral, desde hace más de 14 años, incursionando en este negocio, debido a su madre quien desde muy niña la incentivó para que la ayudara en el negocio. Gracias a ello, hoy en día, Flor posee un espacio al costado del puesto de su madre, donde ofrece variedad de vegetales, los cuales compra al por mayor. A Flor siempre le ha gustado la interacción que tiene con la gente, ya que siempre es muy carismática con todas las personas que le solicitan algún producto, logrando que éstos sean muy fieles a su negocio. Por otro lado, la parte difícil radica, en pasar casi todo el día en su puesto de trabajo soportando los cambios del clima, pero ella sabe que son gajes del oficio que debe sobrellevar. Para un futuro cercano quiere tener un negocio mucho más grande donde pueda vender en mayor cantidad. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela que día a día crece más.
texts.en:
Flor is 27 years old, lives with her parents, her husband Joel and her two small children in their own home. She sells vegetables in one of the most well-known markets in the Huaral province, for more than 14 years, because her mother persuaded her to help with the business since she was very young. Thanks to this, she now has some space next to her mother's stall, where she offers a variety of vegetables that she buys in bulk. Flor has always enjoyed the interaction she has with people, since she is very charismatic with everyone who asks for her products, making them loyal to her business. On the other hand, the hard part is being all day at her stall withstanding the changes in weather, but she knows these things come with the job. In the near future she wants to have a larger business where she can sell more quantities. This is the first loan she has with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she promises to be very punctual with her payments. With this money she will buy a larger quantity of produce to satisfy the necessities of her clientele, which grows more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of produce purchased

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M. lives in the village of Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is twenty-seven years old and married with one school-age child and an infant. To make a living, Roselyn is engaged in selling metal and other junk items from local community members' homes. Roselyn has been engaged in this recycling business for almost four months and generates income from these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be Roselyn's first loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the profits generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Norily

texts.en:
Norily is the 39-year-old mother of a boy, and the proprietor of a variety retail store. Her husband is a security guard but also helps part-time with the growing business operation through lending a hand in the business's logistics. They are partners not only in marriage, but also in business. Their family of three lives in a small urban area in the mountains of Montalban.

Norily's business is a retail variety store, selling basic goods and commodities such as rice, charcoal, and other grocery items to a poor community. "We are very happy to help the people. Sometimes they have no money for the day so we give them their needs anyway and ask them to pay it within the week," says Norily.

The business started in 1999 as a small store with a few packs of noodles and canned goods and now has expanded to even distributing government rice to the community. "The store's best asset, I guess, is its rice distribution. So many families in our area need food on their tables, but some can't afford to buy commercial rice because it is expensive (P30 per kilo). And it is just a great privilege for us to offer help by being a government rice distribution center." The government's social welfare department chose Norily's store as a distribution center to the poor in their community.

Having been a great help to the urban poor community in their town, they now plan to also expand their market by catering to the middle class residents in their area. They are hoping to open a balloon and party-needs business. They need around P50,000 to start the business, and have applied for a medium business loan from Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Their recent loan with CCT, their 11th loan, amounted to P45,000 which put their retail store in a firm financial position. They never missed a loan and savings payment. 


About CCT
CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To invest in a new business: balloons and party needs

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is a rice farmer. She is 46 years old and has three children. Aside from the rice farm, she also ventured into a pig business. She is doing all these things to be able to support the growing needs of her family. 

Elsie would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to purchase two bags of urea fertilizer and farm chemicals. She believes that by doing so, she will be able to improve the size of her harvest, thus increasing the income of her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of urea fertilizer and farm chemicals

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza T. is from the town of Aloran. She is 42 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Flordeliza sells bananas in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Flordeliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Flordeliza's 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Chiku is a member of the Kitanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 19,15,13 years.

Chiku started her own business selling food 12 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Chiku`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Chiku hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil.sugar for food

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano I. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 33 years old. Marciano is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marciano owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marciano has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marciano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciano successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marciano is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marciano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dinorah Maritza

texts.es: Dinorah Maritza M. D. H. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en Cuscatancingo municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Dinorah vive solamente con su hijo D. cuatro años D. edad, la casa donD. actualmente vive la alquila ya que no cuenta con suficiente capacidad económica para compra D. su casa, Dinorah tiene una panadería la cual ha instalado en su domicilio hace cuatro años, crédito que solicita es para insumos que utiliza en la elaboración D. pan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para su panaderia

loans.name: Ysabel Violeta

texts.es:
YSABEL VIOLETA G. D. C.

La familia D. Violeta siempre se dedicó al negocio; es lo que nos cuenta, podría decirse que siguió con esta costumbre a la edad D. 18 años, ahorró un pequeño dinero que le daba su esposo para la comida lo que utilizó para expender ceviche, chicha morada y fruta afuera donD. vivía; estas ventas generaba pequeñas ganancias que fue un apoyo a su esposo, D. esta manera compartía los gastos del hogar. Un año más tarD. su esposo y ella deciden vender abarrotes con el dinero que ahorraron; es así que con los créditos que recibió Violeta hizo crecer su negocio en una tienda surtida; lamentablemente tuvo que dejar D. vender en ese lugar debido a que el dueño del puesto no quiso renovar el contrato; al parecer esto se debió al progreso que tuvo Violeta. Esto no fue impedimento para seguir trabajando, lo primero que hizo fue mejorar una parte D. su casita para vender su mercadería; asimismo aprovecho en dar pensión D. comida a los trabajadores D. una compañía que estuvo en su zona por unos meses. Actualmente sigue vendiendo abarrotes, cerveza y productos D. belleza, es así que D. estos ingresos pudo darles educación superior a sus tres hijas además D. la alimentación. Requiere D. este préstamo para vender helados; pues es temporada donD. hay mayor demanda.
texts.en:
YSABEL VIOLETA G. D. C. Violeta relates that her family has always been involved in commerce and it can be said that she has continued with this family tradition since the age of 18. She saved a little of the money her husband gave her for groceries and used it to prepare and sell ceviche, chicha and fruit from her yard. These sales would generate small profits that she used to supplement her husband's income thereby contributing to household expenses. A year later her husband and herself decided to use their savings to sell groceries so, together with the loans Violeta got, they set up a well-stocked grocery store. Unfortunately, she had to abandon this activity because the owner of the vending stall she used decided not to renew her rental contract, apparently due to the success Violeta was having. This was not a barrier to continue working, however. The first thing she did was improve a small part of her little house to sell her merchandise there. She also managed supply meals to the employees of a firm which was located near her home for a few months. Currently, she continues to sell groceries, beer and beauty supplies using her profits to proviD. her three daughters with higher education in addition to food. She needs this loan so that she can sell frozen treats since this is the season when demand for such items is highest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to produce and sell frozen confections.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora   SONIA ELIZABETH D. T., tiene 36  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios  hasta 5to  de secundaria y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad quienes depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de lencería (ropa interior) para ambos sexos de jóvenes, niños y adultos. Compra su mercadería en Lima o Chiclayo al por mayor para vender a sus vecinos, familiares y amistades. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles y lo invertirá en la compra de lencería.
Sonia sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias para alquilar un stand en el mercado cerca de su casa para así poder vender con mayor frecuencia y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia Elizabeth D. T. is 36 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” (Successful Businesswomen II). Sonia completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has two dependent children.

Sonia buys and sells lingerie and underwear for young people, children, and adults of both sexes. She purchases her products in either Lima or Chiclayo at wholesale and then sells them to her neighbors, relatives, and acquaintances. This is her first loan, which is in the amount of 300 soles and will be used to buy lingerie. Sonia dreams of increasing her sales and profits so that she can rent a stand at the market near her house. This will enable her to make more frequent sales and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 65 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over forty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Jóven Miguel Ángel de 25 años de edad vive con sus padres  en Calle Ica - Subtanjalla.
Es soltero, se dedica a la venta de especerías, condimentos y otros desde hace 3 años.
En su trabajo es bien dedicado, emprendedor y dá muy buena atención a sus clientes por lo que son fieles a él.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder invertir más en su negocio y para ver la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera técnica ya que trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y en la tarde desea estudiar. Tiene muchas ganas de superación y realización personal y no lo ha podido lograr por falta de recursos económicos.
Goza de buenas referencias de parte de sus vecinos y de sus compañeros de trabajo.
texts.en:
The young man Miguel Ángel is 25 years-old, single, and lives with his parents on Ica Street, Subtanjalla. He has been working selling spices, condiments, and other products for three years. He is dedicated to his work, enterprising, and provides very good service to his customers, making them very loyal to his business. He is asking for a loan to invest more in his business, and to create the possibility of studying a technical career, as now he works from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and would like to study in the afternoon. Miguel Ángel strongly desires to overcome his obstacles and realize his personal goals, but has not yet been able to due to his lack of economic resources. He has good personal references from his neighbors and his coworkers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his business with the sale of salads and vegetable stews.

loans.name: Phebean

texts.en:
Mrs Phebean K. is a 42-year-old widow with two children. She lives with them in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is left with the challenge of caring for her children.

Phebean is a member of LAPOSL group where she has been a member for more than a year. With her previous loan she expanded her business by purchasing more clothes, groundnut (peanut) oil, palm oil, rice, flour and sugar. She has concluded that this loan will be invested in the business in the same way.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, groundnut oil, palm oil, rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Blanca está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes les a tocado ganarse el pan de cada día. Ellas son  Mercedes G. quien destaza cerdo, María S. tiene una repostería y Meylin A. vende pan.

Estas señoras tienen fe en que este año nuevo será mejor y que pondrá todo de su parte para que sus negocios prosperen.
texts.en:
The White Rose group is made up of three hard-working women who have had to earn a living since a very young age. They are: Mercedes G., who butchers pigs, María S., who runs a bakery, and Meylin A. who sells bread. These women believe that this new year will be better than the last and they will put all their efforts into assuring that their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old and married with four children aged between 6 and 17 years. She resides in and owns a five-room house where she is staying with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Grace deals in second-hand clothes. She incurs transport costs to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi-urban area which on the outskirts of Kampala. She works six days a week. She receives an average of 15 customers a day and sells to all categories of people in retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent for her business location, and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation of second-hand clothes and theft. Grace has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for five years. This is her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Grace joined MCDT because it was near her home and works with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: Purchase bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is a 50-year-old woman who is married and blessed with two children. She and her family are currently living at Sitio Masikap, Jala-jala, Rizal, Philippines. She is a woman of strong faith to conquer all challenges to achieve her dreams. 

In 2006, Gloria joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap Inc.) a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. As a member of the Institution for almost four years, she has shown an excellent performance in her credit rating (the basis of loans) and therefore she has been trusted by ASHI to obtain several loans.

Gloria has operated a variety store for almost five years but, because of insufficient income from her retailing of small goods and her husband’s earnings, the couple has decided to start a fishing business. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fiberglass, fishing net, materials for the boat, and to pay transportation expenses.

Engaging in this kind of business will help to provide additional proceeds to give the best of life to Gloria’s family and develop their standard of living.

Gloria dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it in their barangay (village).  She also dreams of owning more fish cages to raise more fish to sell. She hopes that both businesses will be the source of stable income to sustain the needs of her family and to send her two children to school until they complete a degree.

Gloria’s greatest dreams are to get out of the spiral of poverty and live happily ever after.

loans.use: To purchase fiberglass, fishing net, materials for the boat, and to pay transportation expenses

loans.name: Orfinor Daru Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the 'Orfinor Daru' group. Their leader is Fatmata K.. They are petty businesswomen in the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. For the first time, they have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses, both in terms of quality and quantity. 

The 40-year-old Fatmata was born in a village called Mile 91 and she is married to a businessman. They have 5 children in primary and secondary school. For many years now, she has been selling peppers, salt, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by adding more of the above mentioned goods to her business stock. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer, Abdul Karim Conteh, handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy peppers, salt, and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Ivan Octavio

texts.es: El señor IVAN vive en la localidad de San José a 25 Km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esta casado y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. EL domicilio donde vive actualmente es donde su hermana, ya que el no cuenta con casa propia, su actividad es de transporte de pasajeros en su taxi, tiene contratos y trabaja todo el dia ya que desea comprarse un casita, su esposa es ama de casa por lo tanto el solo mantiene la casa, es una persona responsable dinamica y trabajadora. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es su fuente de trabajo. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ivan lives in the town of San José, 25 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is married and has two school-age children. The residence where he currently lives is where his sister lives since he does not have his own house. His activity is transporting passengers in his taxi. He has contracts and works all day as he wants to buy his own house. His wife stays at home and he alone supports the family. He is a responsible, dynamic and hard-working person. The loan he requests is for the maintenance of his vehicle which is his source of work. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing their trust by granting him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Otgonhishig

texts.en: Otgonhishig is 46 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Hentii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Adiya, is a government worker earning a salary of 400,000 tugrugs (~ 282 USD) per month. During the day, Otgonhishig operates a baked goods and clothing trading business in her province. She started baking in 2002, and operates her baking business seasonally. Otgonhishig produces and sells special baked goods for the Mongolian Lunar New Year celebration, and pastries. In addition, she has been operating a clothing trading business since 2008, and currently her daily revenue averages 35,000 – 45,000 tugrugs (~ 30 USD). Otgonhishig has gained much experience in previous years and has been planning to expand her clothing trading business and to leave the business to her daughter. She is a very hard working person and has many plans for the future. Otgonhishig says, “Even though big bakery workshops have opened in my home province, I have not lost my loyal customers and I am very happy about that.” She is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase more inventory for her clothing trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith J., 26, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Reynaldo J., a cook, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own food stall while also delivering meat to her neighbors.

Judith has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 19,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying different cuts of meat, like pork, poultry and beef, and vegetables and seasonings for her food stall.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying different cuts of meat, like pork, poultry and beef, and vegetables and seasonings for her food stall

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 55-year-old hardworking lady. She has been selling clothes since the year 2003 to earn a living. She has many customers in her business due to her good customer care skills.  She has joined a group in Faulu Kenya called E. Shinner where she saves her money on a weekly basis. She has benefited a lot from the membership because she can access loans, which the group guarantees. She has also benefited from the discussions and training offered by Faulu Kenya. Joyce hopes to double her turnover and improve her living standards in 10 years time.  She has many customers who have different tastes in fashion and design and she is not able to meet their demands due to her limited capital. She has therefore requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Mannie M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called United Friends. She is single and has 10 children. She also cares for 4 siblings. She is a high school graduate but could not continue her education through college.

For 3 years Mannie has been selling charcoal at the Duport Road market in Paynesville, Liberia. She gives her customers discounts during transactions which keeps them returning. Mannie started selling charcoal by bags at her house but now has a warehouse in the market. Transporting charcoal from the production site to her warehouse is a problem for Mannie.

She plans to use her 9000 LRD portion of this 45000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to expand to a bigger business and to buy a car for transporting her goods.

Mannie describes herself as an easy going mother who loves people and hates dishonesty.

In the photo Mannie is holding the sign and Nyemonh is in the inset because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pea seeds

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel L. is from the village of Poblacion Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 58 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Joel owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,036 PHP from GDMPC. Joel is requesting a new loan of 9959.26 PHP, which will be used to purchase land to raise additional livestock. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Joel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional livestock

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle C., age 33, is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. Richelle is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Richelle owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells ready-to-wear clothing items in the local community. Richelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Richelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Richelle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Richelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Millicent Awuor

texts.en:
Millicent O. is a 39-year-old widow from Katito. She has two children, aged 12 and 16, who are both in school. Millicent has the sole responsibility of taking care of her children since her husband passed away. 

She sells materials and has been in this business for the last 15 years and has built up a huge clientele mainly consisting of tailors and just ordinary people who come to buy from her. She is applying for Kshs 10,000 as her second loan after successfully completing the first one. Millicent wants to use the money to buy bails of materials to add to her stock. She will use the profit to boost her stock and also for the upkeep of her family.

Millicent hopes to have a stable business which will enable her support her family and see her children through school.

loans.use: Buy more materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida vive en la zona de Villa la Merced, de la ciudad de La Paz.
Esta separada de su esposo, tiene dos hijos, de 5 años y otro de 8 meses.
Ella es profesora y también vende productos de belleza hace dos años.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva.
Con este crédito la señora podrá compra mas productos de belleza (cosméticos perfumes, pinturas y tintes) dándole las posibilidades de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Melida lives in the Villa la Merced neighborhood in La Paz. She separated from her husband, and has two children ages 5 and 8 months. She is a teacher and has also been selling beauty products for the past two years. This is the third time she has requested a loan with Impro and the second time with Kiva's help. This loan will allow her to buy more beauty products (perfumes, makeup and hair color) giving her the chance to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to continue her reatail sales business

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena F. D. S. 45 años D. edad, es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien trabaja desD. su casa la cual esta ubicada en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo D. negocios. Carmen vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a sus tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar en la universidad. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que tanto Carmen como su esposo son dos personas muy trabajadoras, las cuales se dedican por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Carmen solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and a very happy and kind woman who works from her home, located in the department of San Salvador. She has a store in which she sells products of primary necessity for the home and for people, including soap, shampoo, bread, milk, sweets, and other products normally found in this type of store. Carmen lives with her husband who also works as a merchant, and their 3 children who study in the university. She can count on very good references from her neighbors and friends, since both Carmen and her husband are very hard-working people who dedicate themselves to the well-being of their home. Carmen requests a loan to restock her store with necessities and increase her inventory. In this manner, she will offer more products to her customers, improve her earnings, and be able to get ahead together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PERISHABLE PRODUCTS TO SELL IN HER STORE

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Justine has a business running a hotel/restaurant, which she has had for 5 years. To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge for drinks for her hotel/restaurant. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her child's school fees. In the future, Justine hopes to own a house. Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has improved her prospects for the future by teaching her how to maintain her business. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for drinks

loans.name: Santurios Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es Santurios, llamados así por que les gusta ese tipo de flor, está conformado por once integrantes, ellos radican en la Comunidad de San Isidro en Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Rosalva O. S. (Venta de Antojitos), Verónica Rosario González P. (Venta de Zapatos), Silvia C. Hernández (Venta de Queso) Eulalia Ester González Q. (Abarrotes), María Dominga González P. (Venta de Zapatos), Lourdes O. Martínez (Papelería), Leonor Raquel C. G. (Venta de Cosméticos), Margarito Antonio Báez J. (Venta de Papaya), Félix C. Martínez (Venta de frutas y Legumbres), Juan A. Y. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres) y Joel Martínez N. (Venta de Papayas).

Rosalva O. S. es integrante de Santurios, tiene 37 años de edad, su familia está integrada por su esposo y sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Anteriormente Rosa trabajaba asiendo limpieza, pero con el tiempo los gastos de su familia fueron incrementado y el sueldo de su esposos en ocasiones no era suficiente así que decidió ayudar y comenzar con una actividad económica que le diera un ingreso mas. Actualmente se dedica la venta de Cosméticos, Antojitos y Venta de Ropa en general, va ofreciendo en las casas y en la escuela donde sus hijos asisten ya que ahí conoce a mucha gente y no pierde la oportunidad de poder vender, le va muy bien en sus ventas  y ahorita en el mes de diciembre es cuando incrementa un poco mas, siempre trata de tener variedad y de dar buenos precios para mantener a la clientela que tiene, se surte cada ocho días ya que aprovecha que la mercancía se la llevan hasta su domicilio así que no gasta en transporte. Con el crédito solicitado comprara mercancía como: blusas, pantalones, playeras, chamarras, etc., para poder incrementar sus ganancias. Sus planes de Rosa son poder brindarles un buen futuro a sus hijos y que no les falte nada para su buen desarrollo.

Agradecen el apoyo de Kiva a través de fundación Realidad y de que apoyen a la gente para que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Santurios because they like this type of flower. It is made up of eleven members. They live in the San Isidro community in Valle de Chalco, Estado de Mexico. The members are: Rosalva O. S. (Luxury Item Sales), Verónica Rosario González P. (Shoe Sales), Silvia C. Hernández (Cheese Sales) Eulalia Ester González Q. (Groceries), María Dominga González P. (Shoe Sales), Lourdes O. Martínez (Stationery Store), Leonor Raquel C. G. (Cosmetics Sales), Margarito Antonio Báez J. (Papaya Sales), Félix C. Martínez (Fruit and Vegetable Sales), Juan A. Y. (Fruit and Vegetable Sales) y Joel Martínez N. (Papaya Sales). Rosalva O. S. is a member of Santurios. She is 37. Her family is made up of her husband and three school-aged children. Rosa previously worked as a cleaner, but with time her family's costs kept increasing and their salaries were not enough at times. She decided to fix this and start a business that would give her a greater income. She now sells cosmetics, luxury items and clothing in general. She offers her products in homes and in the school that her children attend, since she knows many people there and never passes up the chance to sell. Sales are very good and December is the month in which they increase a little more. She always tries to have variety and good prices to keep her customers. She stocks up every eight days and benefits from the fact that the merchandise is brought to her home, so she does not have to spend money on transportation. With the requested loan she will purchase merchandise such as: blouses, pants, t-shirts, jackets, etc., in order to increase her earnings. Rosa's plans are to be able to offer a better future to her children, and that they will lack nothing for their proper development. She is grateful for the support of Kiva through Fundación Realidad, and for their support of people so that they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.use: The purchase of clothing, fruits, vegetables, shoes, cosmetics, and groceries

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella se levanta temprano para alistar su bolso en donde prepara todos los productos que le mostrara a sus diferentes clientes, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como pintura de uñas, tratamientos, perfumes, cremas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Dolores Yolanda has been selling cosmetics for over 4 years.  She has been keen to improve her business; this is not the first time that she has received financing for her business.  She gets up early to prepare her bag with all the products to show her different customers, so she is always aware of what they are requesting.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as nail polish, treatments, perfumes, creams and more.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more containers of frozen meat

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es:
La clienta Ángela Rosa R. O.. Vive en departamento de León, Municipio Achuapa. Es una señora Soltera  trabaja actualmente en el Instituto San José desempeñándose en el cargo como Conserje y tiene 12 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuenta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere Acondicionar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de zinc, Cemento y ladrillo, para el mejoramiento de su Vivienda, para mejorar el bienestar de vida de su familia.  Esto le permitirá que el cliente pueda obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
The client Ángela Rosa R. O. lives in the district of León in the Achuapa municipality.  She a single woman who currently works in the San José Institute holding the post of custodian.  She has worked for this institution for 12 years.  

Ángela has her own home, which she wants to renovate.  She will use this loan to buy zinc, cement, and brick to improve her house, and to improve her family's well-being.  This will enable her to obtain a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc, and brick

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Il a 25 ans et est marié. Il est né à Tsévié et vit à Lomé quartier avédji ou il a le siège de son activité principale. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de pièces détachées à deux roues et compte dans cette activité 2 ans déjà.  Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et  revend à avedji  à côté de la limousine. IL espère accroitre son commerce avec le crédit sollicité.
texts.en: He is 25 years old and married. He is born in Tsévié and lives in Lomé, in the Avédji district, which is also where his store is located. He sells spare parts for motorbikes. He has two years of experience in this business. He stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Avedji, by the limousine service. He hopes to be able to expand his business thanks to the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Rhyjil

texts.en:
Rhyjil C., 26, is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 4.  To make a living, she plants and harvests rice.  Rhyjil also grows and fattens pigs and sells them in the market.

Rhyjil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Rhyjil is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to buy farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pig feeds

loans.name: Satelital Group

texts.es:
Verónica es directora de una marca de productos de belleza en este trabajo ha encontrado su independencia y estabilidad económica ahora ella depende de su trabajo fue por medio de  una amiga que aprendió todo sobre belleza y la venta de los productos que ofrece, actualmente  maneja a 62 personas que están a su cargo a las que supervisa,  pero no descuida  a sus propios clientes  quienes siempre le compran sus productos de este modo sus ganancias son mas productivas y así  ayuda a su esposo en la manutención del hogar y el pago del colegio de sus hijos. El mayor sueño para ella es tener su casa propia sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo podrá lograr muy pronto, su préstamo le servirá para comprar productos de belleza esta época es una buena inversión por que muchos buscan regalos para sus familiares y amigos, por otro lado ella es miembro del grupo “SATELITAL” que esta formado por 07 socias en su mayoría vecinas y amigas del mismo lugar.
 
* Veronica es la 1ra de la foto viste jean y polo negro.
texts.en:
Verónica is the director of a brand of beauty products. Through this job she has found independence and economic stability. She now depends on her job. It was through a friend that she learned everything about beauty and selling the products that she offers. She currently manages 62 people and supervises them. However, she always takes care of her own clients who always buy from her—that way she earns more. 

She helps her husband with the household expenses and their children’s’ school fees.  Her greatest dream is to have her own house. She knows that with much hard work, she can achieve this soon. 

She will use her loan to buy beauty products. This season is a good time to invest because many people look for gifts for their family members and friends. She is a member of the “Satelital” group, which is made up of 7 members, the majority f whom are friends from the same neighborhood.

*Verónica is the first one in the photo, wearing jeans and a black shirt.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Gabriel Abelardo

texts.es:
Gabriel Abelardo L. T.  tiene 20 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Gabriel Abelardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa  y un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Gabriel Abelardo L. T. is 20 years old.  He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas, in Ríos province.  He has four children.

The members of the San Jacinto rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Campo Alegre ["Joyful Country"], which is in the parish of Guare and canton of Baba.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Gabriel Abelardo plants corn and rice.  He buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells his produce in López market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice.  With the economic support of this loan, he will be able to better meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate.  His dream is to buy his own house and a plot of land.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Rubie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rubie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services as her husband as the driver to local community members. Rubie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rubie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service vehicle

loans.name: Apolinaria's Group

texts.en:
Apolinaria S. is from the village of Caluya Sapang Dalaga in the Misamis Occidental region. She is 62 years old. 

Apolinaria is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Calaghughi.

Apolinaria is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Apolinaria owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling hut products in the local community. Apolinaria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Apolinaria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory. Apolinaria is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Apolinaria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has his own metalworks shop in Ayacucho. He is also a mechanics professor. He will be using his loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase metal. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 7 years and was one of the original founders of his communal bank, "Solidaridad." He enjoys the weekly meetings, trainings and general support that FINCA provides. Pedro hopes to invest in more tools in the future and expand his business and increase profits.

loans.use: Purchase of metal for metal shop

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en:
Rowena A. is from the village of Rang-Ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 31 years old. Rowena is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rowena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $58 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: John Karanja

texts.en:
John, age 70, has been a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 37 years. He and his wife Hannah Wanjiku have two children.  

John was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He has paid all his previous loans consistently and promptly. He plans to use this new loan to buy seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for his farm.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua L., aged 28 years, is married to Catherine Yiasi, aged 22 years. Together they have three children, Ressy aged eight years, Sempet, aged five years and Lesnah, aged three years. He describes himself as a focused man.

Rangua transports people and goods using his motorbike in a business popularly known as “bodaboda” in the Kajiado area, which is a busy area where most of his clients are male. His business of two years gives him a monthly profit of 5,000 KES.

Rangua was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. He has applied for his first loan with KADET, which he will use to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to purchase another motorbike. Rangua hopes to start a transport company.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Salavmat

texts.en:
S. Salavmat is married and the loving mother of five children. For the past five years, she has been in the clothing business, selling clothes in the market at Ganj. S. is a hardworking businesswoman who earns a good living. She buys her goods from the market at Korvon and has regular customers. Her husband helps her in the business. 

S. is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase new fashionable quality goods which will allow her to attract more customers. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great’s rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, has epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha T. N. is 38 years old with 2 children. She lives in a Mai Hien commune whick has good conditions for farming.  She focuses on growing rice in  paddies of 4,500 square meters, and raising chickens for eggs. Everyday she sells eggs at retail to achieve a daily income. Participating in our program since 2006, she is always a good re-payer and uses loans efficiently and effectively in expanding her farming. Now she needs to have a  loan of 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for chickens


   Thin T. N.  is 43 years old with 2 children. She is running a small business that make tofu and sell in  local market. She need to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy  bean as material
   Can T. N.  is 38 years old with 3 children. She has a  grocery  shop in Centre market. She needs to have a loan of 7,630,000  Vietnamese dong to  buy more new  products  to attract customers
  Xuan T. N. is 37 years olds with 1 children. She is managing a  shop that provide internet service. She needs to have a loan of 7,630,000 Vietnamese dong  use  for upgrade internet system
  Khanh T. N. is  45  years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them

loans.use: to buy food for chickens

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia C. est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 3ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), Kadia décida d’apprendre comment mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle suivi sa mère pour apprendre  les activités d’achat et de vente de draps de lit, de pagnes, de chaussures et d’habits.  Avec une expérience de 8 ans; elle maitrise cette activité d’achat et de vente de pagnes, chaussures etc. 
Elle est à son 4ème prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso et elle envisage acheter, avec ce nouveau prêt, des habits et chaussures au Burkina Faso. Ses articles sont vendus à la maison et au grand marché marché de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en: Mrs Kadia C. is married, 31 years old and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and her children in the neighborhood of Hérémakono Centre in Bougouni. Kadia dropped out of school when she was in third grade of elementary school and decided to learn how to earn her living from an income generating activity. This is why she spent her time with her mother and learnt how to buy and sell bed sheets, pagnes (colorful West African cloths), shoes and clothes. Today she has 8 years of experience and fully masters her activity. This is her fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All her previous loans have been repaid on schedule. In her strive to expand her business, she joined Soro Yiriwaso. She intends to use her new loan to buy clothes and shoes in Burkina Faso. She will sell her articles at home and at the great market in Bougouni. Thanks to this loan, she expects to make a profit of 70,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Viviana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Viviana del Pilar tiene 29 años es soltera, vive con los padres tiene una hija de 3 años. Vive en el Parroquia la Magdalena perteneciente al Canton Chimbo.

Viviana se dedica a la comercializacion de pollos los comprar de mes y medio los cria y los engorda para luego venderlos. Los comprar en la ciudad de Guaranda y los vende en la casa de ella o en la feria de los Sabados en Chimbo.

El credito lo solicita para la comprar de pollo y alimentos. Con el apoyo del credito ha podido crecer el negocio y tener mas ingresos, ha enfrentado desafios familiares como la salud de la madre y la competencia del medio ya que mucha gente se apuesto el mismo negocio con precios iguales. El sueño de Viviana es tener tener ingresos mas altos para ayudar a su hija pequeña en lo que se refiere al estudio.

Le gusta mucho dedicar tiempo a su hija haciendole jugar por el parque y que ella aprenda el oficio de la madre que es criar pollos.
texts.en:
29-year old Viviana del Pilar is single and lives with her parents in La Magdalena parish in the canton of Chimbo. She has a 3-year old daughter. 

Viviana earns her living by raising chickens. She buys them in the town of Guaranda when they are six weeks old, fattens them up, and then sells them from her house or at the Saturday market in Chimbo.

The loan she is seeking is to buy chickens and feed. The money has helped her expand her business and earn more money. She is facing some family problems such as the ill-health of her mother. Also local competition means that there are many people selling chickens for the same price as Viviana. Her dream is to have a greater income so she can help her young daughter get an education.

She really enjoys spending time playing in the park with her daughter and plans to teach her all about raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Manya

texts.en:
Manya lives in Vanadzor with her husband. She has two children, a son and a daughter, who are already married and live separately from their parents. 

For almost 15 years Manya has managed a shop, where she sells toys, tableware, souvenirs, perfumery and household goods. Her husband helps her in the business and her son brings merchandise from Yerevan to Vanadzor and helps in the shop when needed as well.

With the profit from her business, Manya and her son support their families. Manya needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a large lot of toys and household goods, which will allow her to increase her business income in the near future. Manya has received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and she has never delayed in her loans repayments.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of toys and household goods for her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She has been a farmer for 5 years, and sell coconuts to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase more coconuts for her business. 

Milagros has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to support her immediate family members financially.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Hingri De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Hingri es una mujer luchadora.
Ella es madre de soltera y necesita una computadora e impresora para que sus hijos puedan realizar sus tareas y trabajos de la mejor manera, es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo de  ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, lo cuales son todo para ella.
Ella pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bansuperafe S.A
texts.en:
Hingri is a hard-working woman.  She is a single mother and needs a computer and printer so that her children can do their homework and projects better.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 400,000 colones so that she can provide her children with a better future as they mean the world to her.
