Hingri belongs to the Bansuperafe Community Loan Company.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Rosette has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for six years and she works seven days out of every week.  Rosette sells her products in a shop. Rosette has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves. The main business challenges for Rosette include seasonality and transport.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon. Rosette lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and the single mother of a 17-year-old child. She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. For the past seven years, Evelyn has been operating a salon. She started with 30,000 UGX, but currently has working capital worth 2,000,000 UGX. Her major business challenge is customers not paying their debts on time.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics of different designs and colors, elastic, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Mosafar

texts.ru: Мосафар проживает в районе Яван. Ей 52 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Мосафар занимается животноводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mosafar lives in the Yavan district.  She is 52 years old, married and has three children.  Mosafar is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Salvador De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece la abuela de don Salvador.

Don Salvador tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive con sus abuelos.

Don Salvador tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la albañilería. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus tíos ya que el antes de trabajar estudiaba.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo es para mejorar la casa de sus abuelos, ya que esta construida de adobe. El sueño de don Salvador es que la casa de sus abuelos sea de bloque de cemento puesto que el quiere darles lo mejor a ellos. Sus abuelos le dieron el estudio y la alimentación durante su adolescencia y él quiere agradecerles brindándoles un mejor techo para que tengan mas espacio y ellos se sientan felices.

Don Salvador espera seguir perfeccionándose en la albañilería y formar su propia familia ya teniendo un hogar que ofrecerles.
texts.en:
Salvador’s grandmother appears in the photo.  Salvador is 22 years old, single and lives with his grandparents.  He’s been a bricklayer for three years.  He learned this occupation from his uncles because prior to working he was going to school.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to improve his grandparents’ house because it’s made of adobe.  Salvador’s dream is that his grandparents’ house be made of concrete blocks because he wants to give them the best.  His grandparents gave his schooling and food during his adolescence and he wants to show his gratitude providing them with a better roof over their heads so that they’ll have more space and feel happy.

Salvador expects to continue to hone his bricklaying skills and to form his own family once he has his own home to offer them.

loans.use: to improve his grandparents' house.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Flordelisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

Flordelisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Flordelisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to sell.

loans.name: Enhmurun

texts.en: Enhmurun is 25 years old and lives in a small house with his mother in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He graduated from technology college in 2005 as a computer operator.  He worked in a local bank as a security guard during 2007-2010. He has operated a taxi service since 2010.   Enhmurun is attending a one year Chamber of Commerce foreign affairs training. He is a hardworking, diligent and friendly man who says "After I finish my training, I am thinking of starting my own business".   He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay for his training fee.

loans.use: To pay his training fee

loans.name: Queens Group

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Gweru in the Midlands province of Zimbabwe. She is 32 years old, married and has four children aged 11, 9, 7 and 3. Three are attending school. Her husband is a builder.

Mariam has a flea market stall where she sells clothes. She has been in this business for one year. Her main challenge is the lack of capital to buy a wider variety of clothes for sale.

The US$400 loan she is applying for will go towards the purchase of more stock for her business. With additional income realised from her business, Miriam intends to buy two cattle.

In the future, Miriam plans to have a shop at the Chachacha Business Centre.

loans.use: To buy jeans, tackies (informal tennis shoes), skirts, blankets, and tops for sale

loans.name: Jumakul's Group

texts.en:
Jumakul is the leader of this group. She is 63 and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised three sons and three daughters. All the children, except the youngest son, live separately with their families. Jumakul keeps some livestock, and she is applying for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing sheep. In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock to leave a good inheritance to her children. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Limy

texts.en:
Limy is from Ozamiz City outside of Manabay, Philippines. She is a 35-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. She is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community, and she has been in business for over three years, earning about 5,000 PHP a month.

Limy joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her fourth loan, for 17,500 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She hopes to earn additional revenue so she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in Cabulihan, Larena, Siquijor. She is a widow with four children.

Jocelyn has a pig-raising business. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her pig business.

Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 6 months. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Luchema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Luchema Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Luchema group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose  takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Luchema group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Rose and her group with their field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a responsible housewife who helps her husband generate income for their family. She is 53 years old and has three adult children. She was employed as a day care teacher in their barangay, and also raises goats and ducks to sell. She aims to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs, support the education of their grandchildren and save for their future.

Due to financial constraints, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional goats and ducks to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and hopes that someday her business will become successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional goats and ducks to raise

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.es:
El comité san francisco de Asís se formo gracias a la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Ybycui. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras que se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Mirtha, quien se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos, ella nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales y velar por que no les falta nada, pero a pesar de eso le gusta lo que hace por que es un trabajo digno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones para la cría y posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The San Francisco de Asis Group was formed by several neighbors in the city of Ybycui that decided to unite. They are hardworking and very enterprising women who joined together in order to help one another to support their families.

One of the women in the group is Mirtha, who works raising animals such as pigs. She tells us that her work requires a great deal of sacrifice, as she always has to look out for her animals and make sure they have everything they need. Despite this, she enjoys what she does because it is a decent job.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of piglets to raise and later sell. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: David M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school, located Kenema City, in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 219 pupils and employs eight teachers. In operation since 1985, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries. This group of teachers has thus applied for a loan of 4,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones from SMT/Kiva lenders.

David is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 47 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 14 years now. He is married, and together they have four children – one in primary school and three in secondary schools. David plans to use his portion of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old and married to Moses. They have four children. She has been operating a pharmacy for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase a stock of medicines and introduce new variety. She plans to open another shop with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a wholesale dealership.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicine.

loans.name: Zully Gioconda

texts.es: Zully de 39 años vive ( isla Guayaquil ). Ella empezó con la venta de colas y snack en el norte por que un familiar se lo recomendó. Le va bien y a incrementado su mercadería . trabaja todos los días sola . es soltera pero tiene tres hijos su esposo la abandono . Con el prestamo ella desea hacer su casa de dos plantas para mejorar su forma de vida.
texts.en:
Zully, 39, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  She started this business in the north because a family member recommended it to her.  It is going well for her and she has increased her merchandise.  She works alone every day.  She is single but has three children.  Her husband abandoned her.  In the future she wants to make her house a two story.

With the loan she will buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 50 year old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy new furniture for her home. In the future she hopes to build another floor to her house.

loans.use: to pay for new furniture in her home

loans.name: Kangpa Group

texts.en: Khanthong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khanthong and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khanthong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khanthong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela owns a shoe store in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has owned her business for about 9 years. She started the business with her late husband who passed away several years ago. It was very difficult for her to continue on without her business and life partner, but she has endured through the hard times. She feels very proud to know that she has been able to succeed with the help of her daughter. She is requesting this loan because she wants to set up a new point of sale managed by her daughter. She will use the money to rent some space and invest in products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Open a new point of sale run by her daughter

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
María Elena is characterized by being an enterprising and enthusiastic person. She is 41 years old, she is married and has two children who are studying. Her family does not have a steady income because her husband works as a mason and work is scarce. María Elena began her business ten years ago in order to be able to contribute with something to improve the economic conditions of her family and to be able to give her children an education.

The income María Elena makes from her job is extremely important for her family and she asks for your generosity, through a loan of $250, so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to continue making the snacks she sells. You can help this family, please decide to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Elena se caracteriza por ser una persona emprendedora y entusiasta. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. Su familia no cuenta con un ingreso fijo porque su esposo trabaja por su cuenta de albañil y el trabajo es escaso. María Elena comenzó este negocio hace diez años, para poder contribuir con algo a mejorar las condiciones de su familia y poder darles educación a sus hijos.

Para Maria Elena y su familia es fundamental el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo y pide de tu apoyo y generosidad para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para seguir elaborando los antojitos, mediante un préstamo de $250 dólares. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, decídete a hacerlo.

loans.use: To buy stock of food ingredients

loans.name: Josephine Murunga

texts.en: Josephine is a mother of three children who are all in primary school. She started her business in 2004 as a retail shop, and later changed to selling new clothes when she realized that there were many competitors in retail shops. She has not undertaken any formal training for the type of business she is doing. She gets her stock of clothes from Nairobi and Kampala. Her husband is not employed, and through her business she has been able to support her family and also buy some cattle to keep. She has also been able to develop her farm. She has also brought services closer to the community. With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock and buy it in bulk, which will reduce time and costs given that she has to travel distances of over 500 kilometers once every week.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. wants to open a popsicle stand in Bayaguana. She will use this loan to buy materials such as juice and popsicle sticks to make the popsicles, other small commodities to sell such as gum, and also a ledger and pens with which to keep her accounts. Juana's entrepreneurship will enable her to help her husband Danilo support their son Vladimir (11), who is in eighth grade at a local public school. Juana hopes to become a good professional whose business can benefit the surrounding community.

Note: Juana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To open a popsicle stand

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Mrs. Dora O. is 46 years old, is married to Mr. Angel Espinoza (also 46 years old), and has three children: a 26-year-old who works in a communications company, and a 17-year-old and a 14-year-old who are both in high school. Dora´s husband drives a bus for a public transit company to help support the family.

Dora has had her sewing workshop since 1986, wherein she has tailored wearable garments such as shirts, skirts, pants, and blouses. She learned her profession working in a Korean-owned sewing shop in ¨”Market 4,” Asuncion´s largest and most bustling public market.

Dora wishes to invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of a new variety of fabrics and sewing materials such as threads and buttons, all for the production of clothing garments. In doing so, she will be able to meet the growing demands of her clients who are eager to purchase her high-quality products.

loans.use: Purchase linens and materials such as thread and buttons

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
Abdurashit V. is 33 years old. He has a college education, is married and has 4 children. He has extensive experience in the field of cattle raising because he was helping his parents raise cattle since early childhood. He has his own house with all the necessary conditions needed to raise cattle. He became a client of MicroInvest back in 2006. Back then his assets amounted to $400 and he had only two calves in his possession. Thanks to MicroInvest he was able to increase the amount of cattle he owns and stock up on cattle feed for the winter. In the future he is planing to acquire more milk cows and better the conditions the animals are held in.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Вохидов Абдурашит- 33 года .Образование высшее. Женат отец 4-х детей. Имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства так как с детства помогал своим родителям в откармливании крупно рогатого скота. У него свой личный дом с хорошими условиями откорма. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвесте с 2006-го года с активами на 400 долларов. В хлеву в то время у него имелось только пару телят .Хорошие условия кредитования программы МЗФ для животноводов позволило ему увеличить наличие скота и запасаться кормом на зиму. В будущем планирует увеличить численность дойных коров и улучшить условия содержания.

loans.use: to increase a number of livestock

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia and her enchanting husband Florencio have dedicated themselves for the past 4 years to making and selling slips and skirts, a business that through their diligence and perseverance has allowed them to cover the basic needs of their home and offer their three dear children well being and an education. This hard working couple begins laboring daily at 7:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night, making elegant and a wide variety of slips and skirts to later rent or sell them to the townspeople, mainly during the festival days of their hometown, Juliaca, and in some neighboring towns. They wish to obtain a loan to buy a wider selection of lace and continue making their beautiful slips. Let’s help this noble effort so Delia and her enchanting husband can continue making and displaying their elegant and fine articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia y su encantador esposo, Florencio, desde hace cuatro años están dedicados a la confección y venta de enaguas y polleras, negocio que por su diligencia y perseverancia les ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, y sobre todo ofrecerles bienestar y educación a sus tres queridos hijos.Esta laboriosa pareja empieza su labor cotidiana desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, confeccionando elegantes y gran variedad de enaguas y polleras para luego alquilarlas o venderlas a los pobladores, principalmente en los días festivos de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, y en algunos pueblos aledaños.En esta oportunidad desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor variedad de encajes para seguir confeccionado sus bellas enaguas.Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Delia y su encantador esposo sigan confeccionando y luciendo sus elegantes y finas vestimentas.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of basic materials (lace) for the production of fine slips.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an experienced entrepreneur who has been selling at the market for over ten years. She currently has a business selling sports clothing which she enjoys because it helps encourage healthy lifestyles. Valentina has a small kiosk at the center of the large Central Market in Melitopol. It is in a prestigious row of businesses with a great location and lots of passing potential customers. Valentina is married and has one grown daughter. Her granddaughter is also an entrepreneur and Valentina hopes to use some of her profits to help her granddaughter develop her business.

Valentina has requested a loan of $600 to purchase new inventory for her kiosk. She hopes to continue earning a good income and be able to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little sports clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a professional cutting machine and more fabrics

loans.name: Donatilda's Group

texts.es:
Donatilda, Digna and Danitza have belonged to Communal Bank Mirachisun, which means "We Grow" in Quechua, for one year. As members of the bank they learn how to better administer their money, to save, and to be punctual and responsible.

Donatilda is married, 60 years old and has nine children, two of whom live with her. She has sold fruit at a local outdoor market for the past four years.

Digna is 40 years old with eight children and lives with her partner. She travels to the city once a week to sell tuna, regional breads and aromatic herbs, and depending on the season, brings back grapes to sell.

Danitza is single and 22 years old. Along with her parents, she has a restaurant "El Zunagro" where she sells cebiche, a popular regional dish maD. with fish and lime. She's also studying nursing at the local university.

Donatilda, Digna and Danitza need loans of $75, $150 and $75 to purchase mangos, grapes, bread, tuna, limes and fish.

Donatilda, Digna and Danitza all dream to have bigger businesses, to increase their profits and that they're children will grow up and be successful and independent.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Donatilda, Digna y Danitza pertenecen al Banco Comunal Mirachisun que significa “Hagamos Crecer” en quechua, hace 1 año. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a administrar bien el dinero, a ahorrar, ser puntuales y responsables.

Donatilda es casada tiene 60 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 2 viven con ella, Donatilda venD. frutas D. manera ambulante en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza hace 4 años.

Por otro lado Digna es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 8 hijos, Digna viaja al departamento D. Ica una vez por semana, donD. venD. tuna, panes típicos D. Ayacucho como “chapla”, hierbas aromáticas y D. Ica dependiendo D. las temporadas trae uva.

Mientras que Danitza es soltera y tiene 22 años, Danitza junto a sus padres tienen una cebichería llamado “El Zungaro”, Danitza se encarga D. las ventas. Además Danitza estudia enfermeria en la universidad.

Donatilda, Digna y Danitza necesitan prestamos D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mango, uva, pan chapla, tuna, limón y pescado.

Los sueños D. Donatilda, Digna y Danitza son tener un negocio más granD., incrementar capital, que sus hijos sean profesionales y independizarse.

loans.use: Donatilda, Digna and Danitza need loans of $75, $150 and $75 to purchase mangos, grapes, bread, tuna, limes and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in seafood, coal, and the meals his wife makes for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is an example of great responsibility and limitless courage. She is the mother in a family that doesn’t let itself get knocked down by the painful moments that they must live through. María does diverse activities that allow her to support her home by means of manual jobs. Using quality wool whose beauty is incomparable, and as a final ingredient in her work, awards a nice finish. Her products are constantly improved to the point where she now has buyers who pay a reasonable price for them. María covers wholesale orders for her clients and she would like to produce her products in greater quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Un ejemplo de gran responsabilidad y valor sin límites es María, una madre de familia que no se deja abatir a pesar de los dolorosos momentos que le tocaron vivir. Realiza diversas actividades que le permiten sostener su hogar mediante trabajos manuales utilizando lanas de calidad, la belleza incomparable y como ingrediente final de su labor otorgándole un buen acabado, sus productos han mejorado constantemente al punto que ahora tiene compradores que pagan un precio razonable por ellos, Maria cubre pedidos al por mayor de sus clientes y su deseo es producirlos en mayor cantidad.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: For the past three years, Justina A. has made a living selling frozen foods like chicken and fish and other items to her customers. She has been active with LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Justina is 38 years old and married with five children. She needs a loan of $350 to expand her business by buying more frozen food and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
Encarna belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and has six children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income is not enough to meet their monthly expenses. It’s for this reason that Encarna, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small general store.

She currently has her grocery store, for which she rises at 7 am to fix breakfast for her children and husband, after which she tends to her store until 8 pm.

With this loan of S/. 2,000, to be repaid in six months, Encarna bought two sacks of rice, one sack of sugar, to boxes of milk, noodles, eggs, vegetables, oil, etc.

Encarna is very proud of herself because she has learned to manage her finances and conduct her business well given her desire and effort continue with the sole wish of supporting her children in their educations and to provide them with a better standard of living. She is very glad for the support provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Encarna pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz A2 Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos que posee no son suficientes para los gastos mensuales, es así que Encarna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta una bodega de abarrotes al por menor, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes hasta la 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, fideos, huevos, verduras, aceite, etc. Encarna esta muy orgullosa de si misma por que aprendió a manejar sus ingresos y a conducir su negocio por buen camino a base de esmero y lucha continua con el único deseo de apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida, se siente muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of general products at wholesale.

loans.name: Nury Arazeli

texts.es:
Nury is 27 years of age and is married. One of her children is attending school and there's another little one one the way. She lives with her husband Juan who always gives her a hand with the business.

Three years ago she has been selling fresh water. She distributes her product in her neighbourhood. Nury is very active and hardworking which is why she wants so much to keep going with this business, especially because it is so successful. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in his mechanic's shop. She does all of this for the wellbeing of her familly. Nury provides her fresh water services 24-hours a day, 7 days a week and she feels happy just to be able to keep growing. She works to cover the daily expenses and the education of their small son.

The reason why she is requesting this loan is that she wants to provide water to a larger sector. And to make this happen she needs working capital. She also wants to have a chicken coop built.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nury tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y es madre de un niño que está estudiando y otro que viene en camino, vive con su esposo Juan, quien siempre le da la mano en su negocio. Hace 03 años se dedica a la venta de agua, distribuye a las personas que colindan por su alrededor, Nury es muy activa y trabajadora, por eso que tiene muchas ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio, ya que le parece muy rentable, paralelamente a esto apoya a su esposo en su taller de mecánica, todo esto hace por el bienestar de su familia.Nury brinda sus servicios de agua las 24 horas del día y se siente a gusto de seguir creciendo. Ella trabaja para apoyar con los gastos diarios y la educación de su pequeño hijo. El motivo de solicitar un préstamo es porque quiere brindar agua a un gran sector, para ello requiere del capital que ayudará a cumplir su propósito, también quiere mandar a construir un galpón para la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: Capital funds for the investment in her fresh water service and to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, actividad con la cual apoya en los gastos del hogar. Debe salir de su casa a horas muy tempranas, luego de preparar los alimentos para su familia, para ir rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo donde se ocupa todo un día.Sin embargo, en su trabajo disfruta mucho de la compañía de sus hijos, quienes después de estudiar van a la chacra para ayudar a su mamá y retornar pronto al hogar. Lo que es preocupante, es la baja de los costos de los productos agrícolas, esto amenaza a que su inversión sea un fracaso.
Sin embargo, tiene en sus tres hijos el motivo más importante para seguir trabajando y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación que les sirva en el futuro.
Nilda está esperando la temporada de la siembra de maíz y de gladiolos (flores) para invertir en ello y tener sus ganancias dentro de 6 meses y con ello la posibilidad de crecer como agricultora.
texts.en:
Nilda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children.

For the last five years she has been working in farming, an activity with which she helps with the expenses of her home. She has to leave her house very early, after preparing the meals for her family, to go towards her farm fields where she works all day. Nonetheless, she enjoys very much the company of her children in her work, who go to the small farm after school to help their mother and quickly return to their home. What does worry her is the drop in the prices of agricultural goods, this threatens that her investment could fail.

However, her three children give her the reason to continue working and be able to give them the education that will provide for them in the future.

Nilda is waiting for the planting season for corn and gladiolas (flowers) to invest in this and see her profits in 6 months and with them the chance to grow as a farmer.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the planting of corn and gladiolas.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is 30 years old and married with three children. He is a market vendor and for eight years he has worked selling men's clothing in the local market. His wife keeps house, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Sadiq wants his children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile.

In order to expand his business, Sadiq is requesting a loan of $1200. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise in order to offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. The wellbeing of Sadiq's family and his business are in your hands. Sadiq and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to offer a wider selection to his customers.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. Toem S. was born in 1970 and now lives in Deom Pour village in Takeo Province. She is the mother of four children: three of whom attend the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She faces some difficulties recently, however, as her field is infertile, and this is badly affecting her crops.  Her husband, Mr. Ang Nhor (pictured on the right), is a pig breeder. 

Thus Mrs. Toem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field and four piglets to increase her husband’s breeding business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field and four piglets to increase her husband’s breeding business.

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei H. was born in 1965 and she lives in Preak Kasao Village in Kandal Province. She is a Khmer noodle seller. In addition, she has a small plot of land where she cultivates rice. The soil is poor, so Mrs. Srei H. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Veng Sarin, is a car driver who makes a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Dung Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 55 tuổi Ms 020201050027 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua máy sản xuất đậu đi chợ bán và mua 5 con lợn giống về chăn. Chồng chị làm ở phòng thương binh xã hội của huyện Yên phong- Bắc N.. Hiện tại vợ chồng chị có 1 con đang đi học phổ thông, vì vậy gia đình chị thu nhập mỗi ngày được khoảng 150.000VNđ/ ngày. Sau 2 chu kỳ vay vốn chị trả vốn rất tốt, đồng thời giúp chị tiết kiệm trả dần và không phải trả một gánh nặng dồn vào một lúc. Chính vì vậy, chị cùng nhóm tiếp tục tham gia vay vốn ở chu kỳ tiếp theo.
 Các thành viên trong nhóm chị gồm có. 
 Chị Trần Thị T. năm nay 43 tuổi Ms 020201050028 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 40 tuổi Ms 020201050030 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn, T.t bò.
 Chị Lê Thị H. năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 020201050029 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỳ năm nay 57 tuổi  Ms 020201050031 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua lợn giống.
 Chị Đặng Thị C. năm nay 41 tuổi Ms 020201050033 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để buôn bán T.t lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 020201050031 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị D. is 55 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (275 USD) to buy a machine which she will use to produce tofu. She will sell the tofu in the local market. She will also buy five breeder pigs to raise. Her husband works in the office for veterans and social affairs for the district Yên Phong - Bắc N.. They have one child who is currently in high school. The family has a daily income of about 150,000 VND (9 USD). In two previous lending cycles, she was able to repay her loan very well. It helps her very much that she repays the loan in installments, rather than a single lump sum which would impose a heavy burden. Thus she and her group hope to continue their participation in the next lending cycle. The members of the group are: Mrs. Trần Thị T. is 43 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N. is 40 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork and beef. Mrs. Lê Thị H. is 48 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to buy breeder pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Mỳ is 57 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to buy breeder pigs. Mrs. Đặng Thị C. is 41 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in selling pork. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 48 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (250 USD) to invest in raising pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals and selling meat in the market.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad, hace 12 años viene conviviendo con el padre de sus tres hijos, en la casa que han construido con la finalidad de hacer negocio. Hace seis años viene trabajando en su restaurante, donde ella es la cocinera, asimismo en horas de la tarde se dedica a preparar y seleccionar frutas para encajonarlas y una vez listas envía su carga a un mercado de la capital, donde le cotizan a un buen precio sus producto. Para ello realiza una inversión de 300 a 400 soles, sus ganancias siempre son más del 50%, ya sean de 200 o 300 soles por cada viaje. En estas temporadas María y su esposo trabajan con su carro haciendo transporte de las chacras a la ciudad, cobran por cada viaje entre 60 u 80 soles, y aprovechan en sacar su carga; de ese modo vienen trabajando cerca de 4 años, tiempo lo suficiente para conocer los lugares más lejanos donde cotizan un precio mayor, inclusive llegando a ganar el 100% de su inversión. Mientras tanto su restaurante lo deja a cargo de su hija para que no pierdan clientela y cuando es tiempo de espera de la cosecha, vuelve a dedicarse de lleno a la cocina y atención de sus comensales. María es una clienta responsable, aunque no dispone de mucho tiempo para estar presente en las reuniones programadas, está al día en todos sus pagos. El dinero solicitado, en su totalidad lo va derivará a la compra de plantas de cítricos; como naranjas, tanyelos, y demás frutas que encuentren a un buen precio, y que le permitan ganar, mientras el mercado le favorece.
texts.en:
Maria, 41, has lived with her partner, the father of her three children, for 12 years. They live in the house they built with the idea that they would eventually operate a business there. Six years ago, Maria began operating a restaurant where she is the cook. During afternoons, she works selecting and preparing fruit that she boxes up and gets ready to send to the capital where it will fetch a good price. She spends between 300 and 400 soles for each delivery and she always earns a profit of at least 50% or around 200 or 300 soles per trip. This time of year, Maria and her partner work carting fruit from farms to the city, collecting between 60 and 80 soles for each trip and getting the most they can for their labor. They've been working this way for 4 years, enough time to learn where they can get the best prices, even earning a profit equal to 100% of their investment. They leave the restaurant in the hands of their daughter so that they don't lose customers and return to their kitchen and their food as soon as the harvest is over. Maria is a resposible client even though she doesn't have a lot of time to attend scheduled meetings. She is current with her loan payments. This loan will be used to buy citrus plants, oranges, tangelos and other fruits that will fetch a good price and a good return in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of fruits for fruit business.

loans.name: Chamreun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreun N. is a leader of a group of five who all live in the Batheay village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 53-year-old housewife and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Soun Sary, is a worker. Mrs. Chamreun N. is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living status.

One member in this group holds an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Ниезова Гулчехра проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 38 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей.Имеет небольшую точку , где продает пирожки и кофе. Эта точка находится на рынке. Кроме этого она уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulchehra N. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. She is 38 years old and is married with four children. She has a food stand at the market where she sells pies and coffee. In addition, Gulchehra is involved in livestock breeding. She plans to get a loan for the purchase of livestock. She would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don. Juan Carlos Varga, vive en la zona de Quebrada León, a 300 mts. Pasando la escuela cuenta con parcela propia, a la corta edad que tiene ya ha demostrado tener prioridad en acomodar su patrimonio, actualmente cuenta con 5 hras. De tierra y ahora con este crédito quiere comprar una motocicleta para trabajar los fines de semana de mototaxista. 
Su objetivo es seguir creciendo económicamente, quiere seguir trabajando con créditos para aumentar aun más su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos Varga, lives in the zone of Quebrada León, at 300 meters. Having finished school, he has his own plot of land. At his young age, he has demonstrated that his priority is taking care of his property, he currently has 5 hectacres. With this loan he would like to purchase a motorcycle so that he can work weekends as a motor taxi. He wants to continue to progress economically and wants to use loans so that he can increase his net worth.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a Motorcycle

loans.name: Berlie

texts.en:
Berlie B. is a 50-year-old mother of seven. Her husband Lolito is a carpenter.  She worked very hard to raise her big family. She sells fish and makes food for snacks to support the needs of her children. She applied for this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle to be used in fish vending for her husband to sell even in far-off villages. 

She hopes to save money to increase her capital for fish vending. She dreams of sending her children to college and landing a better job.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for fish vending

loans.name: Herma Fe

texts.en:
Herma Fe P., 19, presently resides in Pag-asa village, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She's engaged in a retail business she learned from her mother. Her business is located in the public market of Dumalinao, which is very accessible for customers.

She needs more capital in order to meet the demand of her customers, most of whom are teenagers. She has stock but still she needs additional capital to purchase the latest and different styles of hair clips, earrings, wallets for men and women, combs, beauty products and other items. So she applied for a loan with Paglaum Co-op worth PHP 5,000.00 to purchase the said stock. She plans to have a stable business with enough capital and to have a family and a concrete house.

loans.use: Additional capital for retail business

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: four sons and two daughters. She says all are currently in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase which is a farming/trading community near Dorma, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a maize farmer.

Akosua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells banku, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells the food on the street in the mornings. Akosua procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns.

Akosua has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize to make banku

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina H. A. vive en Apopa municipio de San Salvador, Rosalina tiene 48 años de edad actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo quien es ya mayor de edad. Rosalina cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo ya que el aporta económicamente al hogar, pero Rosalina buscando una manera para subsistir por si sola ha logrado  montar un pequeño negocio en su casa, donde tiene en venta productos de belleza y uso personal, como perfumes, cremas corporales, maquillaje, etc. Rosalina solicita este crédito  por que quiere surtir su inventario de mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosalina H. A. lives in the Apopa municipality of San Salvador. Rosalina is 48 years old and currently lives with her life partner and her son who is now older. Rosalina counts on the financial support of her son as he contributes financially to the household, but Rosalina is searching for a way to subsist. Therefore, by herself, she has managed to start a small business in her home where she sells beauty and personal products such as perfumes, body creams, makeup, etc. Rosalina asks for a loan because she wants to stock up her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Komla

texts.en:
Komla B. sells electrical gadgets and spare parts at Hohoe. He also owns a taxi which he uses to generate additional income. He has received a junior high school education. He is married and has four dependents and is responsible for paying school fees for his children and other domestic expenses. His wife is a trader.

Komla has been selling electrical gadgets and spare parts since 2004, but he started running his taxi not very long ago. His loan will be used to buy more spare parts and electrical gadgets to sell. He also wants to service his taxi but lacks enough money to buy spare parts to replace the worn out parts. He hopes to use the new profits from his business for saving and to reinvest to increase his capital and profits.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and electrical gadgets to sell and to service his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken food

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Esther is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2008, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luciel

texts.en: Luciel B. is from the village of Poblacion 1,Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Luciel owns and operates a clothing business. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Luciel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luciel is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Tumsifu

texts.en:
Tumsifu is a member of the Lami B in ilala,Iringa,she is 29 yeras old woman,she is single.

Tumsifu started her own business selling fire wood and charcoal 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tumsifu`s first loans from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal and fire wood for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tumsifu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fire wood

loans.name: Ayodele

texts.en:
Ayodele is 49 years old and married with three children. She sells clothes and shoes which she purchases from Lagos.

Ayodele is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs, bags and shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Vilma Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo, vive en Cuturapi  y estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta ropa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa al por mayor, por otro lado también comprara ají, toda su mercadería lo adquiere en Tacna, y lo comercializa en Desaguadero, Yunguyo y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse un carro.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones.

loans.use: para la compra de ropa al por mayor, y aji.

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es:
Anabell tiene 26 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanas en la casa de sus padres. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a comercialización de cosméticos y prendas de vestir, pero desde hace 6 meses decidió que la mejor opción para generarse más ingresos es abriendo su propio salón de belleza. Por tal motivo, se asoció a su hermana para comprar todos los implementos necesarios y en la actualidad su hermana es la que  brinda la atención en lo que se refiere a tratamientos de belleza y cortes de cabello, mientras Anabell es quien administra los ingresos y egresos. Además, en su salón de belleza también venden prendas de vestir y cosméticos, de esta forma le da un valor agregado a su negocio. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, está muy comprometida en el bienestar de su banco comunal y lo demuestra siendo parte de la junta directiva. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de espejos y más mercadería en productos de belleza y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Anabell is 26 years old. She lives with her mother and her sisters in her parents' house. Since she was very young, she has worked selling clothing and cosmetics. However, six months ago, she decided that the best way to increase her income would be to open her own beauty salon. Accordingly, she and her sister became partners and purchased all of the necessary equipment. Her sister is currently the one who provides services such as beauty treatments and haircuts, while Anabell manages the salon's income and expenses. The sisters also sell clothing and cosmetics in their beauty salon, thus adding value to their business. This Anabell's fifth loan with MFP. She is strongly committed to the well-being of her communal bank, a fact which she has demonstrated by serving on its Board. The funds she is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of mirrors as well as additional merchandise such as beauty products and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mirrors and additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa Ysabel es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 56 años, es madre D. seis  hijos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y además es costurera, su esposo es profesor jubilado. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza” desD. hace ocho años, ella empezó en el Banco con un crédito D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en abarrotes para su bodega.
Con este crédito D. 2000 soles, comprará abarrotes, también invertirá en la compra D. telas y repuestos para su máquina D. coser. La meta D. Rosa es ampliar su negocio y surtirlo.
texts.en:
Rosa Ysabel, 56, has been a persevering, active member of the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” communal bank for the past 8 years. She is the mother of six adult children. She sells groceries but is also a seamstress. Her husband is a retired teacher. She began her association with the bank with a 300 sol loan which allowed her to purchase inventory for her grocery store. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy groceries but will also invest in the purchase of fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine. Her goal is to expand and stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo state. She has a van that she uses to supply her customers. She is 43 years old and blessed with 7 children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is also involved in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She hopes to become a major drink distributor in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.en:
Mayra began selling cosmetics, but after two years, she decided to sell used clothing instead. She buys the clothing in packets when she goes to Managua. Mayra says that this business has been of great help to her and her family. But a challenge of this business is that the price of the clothing packets has risen every month that she has bought them. 

Mayra is married and has two children. Her 26-year-old daughter is working and her 15-year-old son is in middle school. Mayra says that her loans have greatly supported her business and now she has a good inventory. Mayra’s goal is to further her business and help it to grow.

loans.use: Working capital for her used clothing sales business

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar S. sells home furniture in his shop in the centre of Imishli city. He started his business in 1996 and since that time has earned enough to build his own store. Iskandar's dream is to save enough money to pay for his wedding party. He has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to do repairs and make his shop more attractive to customers.

loans.use: To make repairs to his shop

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a small business in “Osipenkovskyi,” a local market, where she sells items such as purses, wallets and gloves. Tatyana is an experienced market vendor. She started her business 5 years ago. Currently, she has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Tatyana is a high-achiever. She is seeking stability in life and wants to achieve success in her business. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and and increase her income as a result of better sales.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita G. is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de oro City. She is 47 years old. Purita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Purita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Purita has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Purita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Purita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Purita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to further invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Purita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda A. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Habitat 4, Barangay Bajumpandan, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store and by buying and selling charcoal and fruit. Erlinda’s husband, Jaime, is 56 years old and drives a motorcycle that earns him Php 4,500 per month.They have three children who are between 22 and 34 years old, two of whom already have families while the other child is currently going to school. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by operating a general store and by buying and selling charcoal and fruit. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,400 from her business activities. Erlinda is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and her charcoal and fruit business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 19,000 for her 12th loan which she again intends to use for her businesses. Erlinda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Olukehinde

texts.en: Olukehinde is married to a teacher and they are blessed with 2 children. Their children are doing great in school. He is a businessman. To make a living in Ibadan, he sells phone accessories. He has been in this business for a long time. His greatest challenge in his business is funds and he hopes to overcome this challenge. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es una señora que cuenta con 34 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años, actualmente se cambio de vivienda a una familiar, su entorno familiar es muy unido ya que tanto la madre como los hijos realizan la venta a diario juntos. Marcelina tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, se dedica a la venta de bijouteria (joyería de fantasía), tiene dos puestos uno por el correo de la ciudad y otro cerca de una facultad (por la universidad) En su primer puesto tiene muy poca  competencia ya que son solo tres a cuatro puestos que se dedican a la bijouteria, en el puesto de la facultad simplemente NO tiene competencia ya que es la  única vendedora. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería es decir para comprar bijouteria variada. Sobre su historial en Agrocapital tuvo algunos retrasos pero justificados por la misma Marcelina, ahora en otras entidades financieras al igual que en la nuestra demuestra puntualidad en sus pagos, esto lo demostró con sus boletas de pago.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 34-year-old woman with 2 children, aged 9 and 5. She has recently moved in with another family member. Her family is very united, since both the mother and the children work together every day to sell their merchandise. Marcelina sells costume jewelry, and she has quite a lot of experience in this business. She has two sales locations, one by the city's post office and the other near a department of the university. Her first sales stand has very little competition, since there are only three or four stands selling jewelry. At her stand near the university, she simply has NO competition at all, since she is the only vendor. The aim of this loan is to purchase merchandise -- that is, to buy a variety of costume jewelry. Regarding her history with Agrocapital, she has had a few delays, but these have been justifiably explained by Marcelina, and now she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments with other financial entities as well as ours, as she has shown with her payment receipts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: buying merchandise

loans.name: Palangan's Group

texts.en:
Ivy P. is from the village of Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Ivy is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Ivy is married and has three children which is now in kindergarten . To make a living, Ivy owns and operates a hog-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Ivy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ivy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ivy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina s 53 years old, single and has a 23-year-old child. To make a living, she bakes cupcakes, polvoron (a type of shortbread), and other delicacies that she sells in her community. She hopes to prosper in what she does and wants to improve her family’s living conditions. She joined CEVI and asked for a loan of Php13, 000 that she will use to buy flour, sugar and other baking needs.

loans.use: Flour, sugar and other baking needs

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Na S. is 58 years old and lives in Krasang village in Takeo province. She was selected by the thirteen members of her loan group to be the village bank president. The group members will each use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Na S. and her husband, Mr. Yory L., are farmers. They have two children. The eldest works as a laborer and the youngest is a student in the local school. To make a living, Mrs. Na S. and Mr. Yory L. own a plot of land and rent a piece of land which they use to cultivate rice. Mrs. Na S. decided to ask for a loan in order to hire farm laborers to help with her farming crop.

loans.use: To to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis C. was born in Tete, Mozambique 56 years ago. He studied up to the sixth grade and then stopped to start military service. It was in the military where he met his wife. Being a former soldier, he gets a pension from the state. He has five children who range in age from 13 to 37.

He left his hometown to move to Maputo during the transition government, which came into power in 1974 after independence. He and her wife's pensions combined come to about 9,400 Meticais a month.

Luis is applying for a loan to buy cement, bars, sand and other construction materials to improve his house. He is concerned because prices for such materials are rising, and he may not be able to afford them if he does not make the purchase now. With help from Kiva lenders, he expects to finish construction in the near future and then begin applying for new loans to buy furniture for it.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars and sand he needs to finish building his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more guinea-pigs and chickens

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She owns a hectare of land where she plants and harvests rice for sale. She also has a portion of land where she plants vegetables that she sells at the market and is raising a pig for breeding. She has been doing these activities for more than 10 years.

Marietta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Marietta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Describing herself as hardworking, focused, and self-driven, Catherine is a 50 year-old green grocer who sells fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, pineapples, bananas, apples, and beetroots) to local customers near a transportation hub in her town. Shortages of fruits in the market represent her biggest business challenge. In addition to her green grocery business, she generates income by selling sheep and goats.

Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 Shillings, Catherine is requesting a 45,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area. In the future, she hopes to grow her business in order to supply more schools and hotels in her town. In five years, she dreams of having a wholesale business so that she is in a position to supply other green grocers.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area

loans.name: Hamidulo

texts.en:
Hamidulo is married and has 4 children. His wife helps him with his business selling sunflower seeds in the market. He started this business 18 years ago. Previously he worked as a driver and his salary was not enough to cover their expenses, so he decided to start his own business. Hamidulo saw that it would be a good opportunity to be independent and run this business. Hamidulo is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to purchase merchandise and supply a greater assortment of products. He and his family thank you for the support that you give him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase addition foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bendiya  5 Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA 5 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3  enfants et vivent  dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous-préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les cinq prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués.
La spéculation majoritairement cultivée est : le pois sucré à  l’image de MARATOU O..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et  recruter de la main d'œuvre   pour  exploiter  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue après la récolte, au marché de du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000 FCFA par campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans certaines dépenses de la famille.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
BENDIYA 5 is a group of 10 married with an average age of 33. They each have 3 children on average and live in polygamous families in Mossibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the Microfinance insitution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their seventh loan with the institution, with the past five being duly repaid. The main crop they cultivate is the pois sucre nut. This is the crop cultivated by Maratou O.. With her loan, Maratou O. intends to purchase the agricultural products, tools and labour requried to cultivate 1,5 hectares. The produce is sold after the harvest at the markets in Dallen and Louloni to a mixed clientele of men and women. She hopes to make an average profit of 75 000 FCFA each season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with various household expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate and even bigger plot of land and make bigger profits.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frais de labour, semences, engrais, herbicides, sarclage et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
