Mrs. S. K. is a village bank president who was born in 1962. She has been selected president by the 16 people who make up a village bank loan located in Damnak village, TaK. province. All the members will use their portion of their loan for different purposes to improve their lives. 

Mrs. S. K. and her husband, Mr. Rort Thorn, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her problem is that her crop field has infertile soil and she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. S. K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and, with the rest of the loan, she will hire a plowing machine to plow her field and farming laborers to help her to grow rice. She is the mother of a child who is enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio N. Jr. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. He is 51 years old. Emilio is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Emilio runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emilio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Emilio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emilio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clemente de 58 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Teodosia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y arveja, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para aumentar su productividad.
texts.en:
Teodosia, age 48, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Clement, age 58, and their 5 young children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. With a lot of effort, Teodisa has been able to work her lands and make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes and peas, products which she later brings to sell in Tarma city, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have provided her the necessary income to maintain her family. For this reason she wants to put all of her earnings into getting this business ahead. Her favourite part of her work is caring for her crops. She has been doing this work for 35 years, and she finds her greatest difficulty to be transporting her products to the wholesale market in Tarma, since the bags that she brings are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thus to have more income. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in her previous loans and she hopes to be so again. In her community bank, she is a very participatory member and is always aware of the agreements that the group reaches. With the 700 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer to increase her productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yadira;  La socia tiene  40 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo,  La socia se dedica a la docencia ella es maestra de artes, ella realiza trabajaos manuales como bisutería, desde hace 18 años. La socia tiene bellísimos trabajos realizados por ellas en diferentes motivos, colores y materiales. L asocia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para realizar más trabajos para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para realizar los trabajos de bisutería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the MACHUPICCHU community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Yadira, 40, is the single mother of 1 son.  She is, by profession, a teacher, with a specialty in arts teaching.  She creates art pieces--jewelry, for example--by hand, work that she's been doing for 18 years.  She has created beautiful works of various motifs, colors and materials.  Sra. Yadira is applying for a loan to support her business.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the jewelry pieces that she sells.

Sra. Yadira is grateful that this important means of borrowing is available to her and others and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para realizar los trabajos de bisutería.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Akuwa est une femme  de 35 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de tôles qui sert à couvrir le toit des maisons au  Togo. La plupart de sa clientèle est composée d’entrepreneurs. La demande de sa clientèle est toujours élevée, en ce moment son stock  ne lui permet pas de servir  toute sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour s’approvisionner avec 4 douzaines de tôles. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 2 crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akuwa is a 35 year old woman whose line of business is the retail sale of sheet metal used to cover the roofs of houses in Togo. Most of her customers are entrepreneurs. Her customer demand is always high, but currently she does not have enough stock  to serve all her customers. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up with 4 dozen sheets. She is married and the mother of two children. She has already obtained two  loans from WAGES that she has fully repaid.

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal

loans.name: G.s. Montes De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montes De Los Olivos está compuesto por la señora Sofía y Arelys. Sofía aduce que este negocio le ha ayudado a tener buenos ingresos, lo que le ha permitido seguir manteniendo a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Algo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 es que con este préstamo ella incremento su inventario, aumento sus ventas y por ende logro mejorar las condiciones de vida que ella poseía, y hasta ha realizado algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Ella sueña en el futuro es que desea establecer una pulpería en su domicilio y sobre todo desea que sus hijos se puedan preparar en la universidad. Por lo que ambas solicitan financiamientos para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en: The solidarity group "Montes de Los Olivos" [mountains of olives] is composed of Sofía and Arelys.  Sofía explains that this business has helped her have a good income, which has allowed her to continue supporting her three young children.  She is grateful to the Fundación León 2000 because with this loan she increased her inventory, increased her sales and therefore was able to improve the quality of life that she had, and she has also made a few improvements to her house.  She dreams that in the future she can set up a local grocery store in her home and above all she wants her kids to be able to study in college.  For these reasons both apply for financing to improve their businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Renacer San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Renacer San Francisco, actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 15 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor D. sí mismas para aumentar sus ingresos y por enD. brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Una D. las integrantes es L. señora Andresa quien se dedica a L. venta D. cosmetibles D. diferentes tipos.
Asi elL. todos los dias prepara sus productos para L. venta como empanadas, milanesa, tortillas, todos a precios muy accesibles para L. gente que trabajan por el barrio.
Comenta que tiene buena venta diariamente con L. misma cubre bien su cuota y los gastos diario para L. alimentacion D. su familia L. cual es muy importante para elL.,y asegura que seguira trabajando mucho.
Solicita le préstamo para L. compra D. carne y otros insumos para su cosmetibles.
texts.en:
The committee is named Renacer San Francisco ("Rebirth San Francisco").  They are currently in their first loan cycle with excellent grades.  It is maD. up of 15 entrepreneurial women, who put forth their best efforts to increase their incomes in order to give the best to their respective families..

One of the women is Mrs. Andresa, who sells different types of foods.  Every day she prepares food to sell--empanadas, breaded filets of meat, and tortillas--all at prices accessible for the people who work in her neighborhood.  Mrs. Andresa says she has good daily sales, so she is able to cover her payment installments and daily costs for taking care of her family, which is very important for her and ensures that she will continue working hard.

Mrs. Andresa is asking for a loan to buy meat and other ingredients for her food.

loans.use: Buy meat and other ingredients for food she sells

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es: El señor Mario José C. V., es un joven de 29 años habitante del Barrio de la ciudad Rural de Ticuantepe, con su pareja de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad, su pareja se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar, el mayor de sus hijos estudia la escuela primaria, ellos son agricultores con una experiencia de más de 15 años, atreves de los años se han enfrentado a diferentes situaciones de infección de plagas que carcomen la producción ocasionándoles problemas económicos a la pequeña y joven familia, fue con el apoyo de su papa que lograron iniciarse en esta actividad, la cual hoy en día es el sustento económicos de los suyos, es para una mejoría en la producción que solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos que brinden un mantenimiento Fito-sanitario adecuado y aumente la producción y mejore día a día las condiciones socio-económicas de sus pequeños hijos. Este no es el primer préstamo de la familia C., ha sido para ellos de gran apoyo los antiguos prestamos y el equipo de Afodenic a notado el cambio positivo que la familia ha tenido a traves de esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario José C. V. is a 29 year old young man living in a neighborhood in the rural city of Ticuantepe with his life partner and two minor children.  His spouse is a housewife.   The oldest child is in elementary school.  

They have been farmers for over 15 years.  Through the years they have faces situations involving pest infestations that consume the crops causing economic problems for the young, small family.  

It was with help from his father that they were able to start out in this line of work which today is the source of support for his loved ones.  He is asking for funds to improve production; he needs to buy products to provide crop maintenance so that production will increase daily thus improving his children’s economic situation too.

This isn’t the C.’s family first loan.  Previous loans have been of great use to them and the Afodenic team has noted the positive change the family has had through this help.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood-sales business for the past four years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mjeni faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a farmer. She owns and tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, where she grew up. She says her parents taught her farming. Now that she has her own family, she used her skills to start her business. She plants and harvests rice and then sells it on the market. She has been engaged in rice farming for quite a while now. She hopes to make her business stable so she can help support her family.

Lorna is in need of fertilizers and other inputs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy what she needs for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers like manure.

loans.name: Mrs. Var Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Srae Vong village in Takeo Province live 14 people who comprise a village bank loan. Each will use their portion of the loan in order to improve their family living standards. Mrs. Var T., the village bank president selected by the other members, sells cakes in front of a public school, thereby earning money to support her family. Now she wants to start a cow-breeding business for which she is requesting a loan.

Var's husband, Mr. San Hem, is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school; their youngest is only a one-year-old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya D., 42, is widowed and lives with her three daughters in Darhan, the second biggest city in Mongolia. They have been living in Darhan for three years and she has been taking care of her daughters alone for six years. 

She started her retail trading business in 2000 and her working capital is 1,500,000 MNT. She is a caring mother and hardworking person who says, "My wish is to raise my daughters well-educated and  provide the opportunities that they could take care of their own living without any difficulties in the future. And I am trying hard to make them well-educated people." 

She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more goods that she can sell during the busy time of Tsagaan Sar, the traditional Mongolian New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos es soltero y tiene de 28 años de edad. Reside junto a su familia en el caserío El Verde. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrícola situada en la región Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace años, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de cereales. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Santos cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores. 

Santos desea comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and single. He lives with his family in the village of El Verde, which is located in the District of Pitipo. This farming district lies in Lambayeque region and is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been growing and selling grain for several years. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates this product, which he sells to traders who visit the area. Santos says that he already has an established customer base. The earnings he generates from his business are used to cover his expenses and support his parents and younger siblings.

Santos wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. In order to continue with the production of his crops, he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is a hardworking gentleman who is devoted to his family. He wants to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business and a general store. She lives in EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Judith is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Judith aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Harrison Nguri

texts.en:
Harrison has operated his baker shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 28 years old and married to Margaret Wangui. They have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike to assist him with distribution of his products.

In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his baker shop and be a leading baker in the area.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to assist him with distribution of his products

loans.name: Siba

texts.fr: Madame Siba habite Batomé un quartier périphérique de Lomé. Elle a un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et friperies. Elle a commencé depuis  2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé pour les pagnes et le marché de Hedzranawoé  pour les friperies.  Ensuite elle revend au marché d’Adidogomé et Djidjolé. Son activité rapporte tellement qu’elle a reçu de Wages un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé.  Elle espère satisfaire plus de demande et sollicite un prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie. Avec son activité, elle contribue financièrement aux charges  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Siba lives in Batomé, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She has one child. She has a revenue generating business selling pagnes (colorful printed cloth) and used clothes. She started this business in 2005 and she purchases her pagnes from the large market in Lomé and used clothes from the market in Hedzranawoé.  She then re-sells the goods in the markets of Adidogomé and Djidjolé. 

Her business brings in profits and so her loan from Wages (the microfinance institution) has already been approved. She hopes to satisfy more of her clients demands and is requesting a loan to buy a bale of used clothing (the manner in which used clothing is sold). With this business, she contributes financially to her child's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes (colorful, printed cloth) and used clothes

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili M. is 58 years old and lives in Zestaponi District, in the village of Puti. She has a 25-year-old daughter who works as an operator in a private company and earns 150 Laris per month. Another source of the income for the family comes from agricultural activities led by Lili. She has a milk cow and sells cheese at Zestaponi market. Also she grows maize on her plot of land with an area of 0.5 ha. Along with the above-mentioned, Lili has a vineyard (300 grape vines) and makes wine. Both of these products are sold in Zestaponi. 

The loan will be used to purchase one milk cow. It will result in increased amount of produced cheese and thus more income for the family. Lili and her daughter hope that the increased income will allow them to spend more on the household and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and is a married woman. She has a 10-year-old child.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in the municipality of Santo Niño in South Cotabato Province. She primarily grows rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. Jocelyn works hard to sustain her child's education and to improve her family's living conditions.

Jocelyn is planning to use this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Valens

texts.fr: Valens R. est sentinaire, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 52 ans, il est marié, et il a 8 enfants entre 4 ans et 25 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Valens est né au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son quatrième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une vache pour sa famille.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solder le crédit et demander un autre pour acheter une autre vache, pour vendre de lait.  Il voudrait avoir une ferme, éduquer ses enfants, et mettre sa famille en bon état.
texts.en: Valens R. is a guard and has been a client of ACB since 2010.  He is 52 years old, married, and has 8 children between the ages of 4 and 25.  Three of his children go to school.  Valens was born in Rwanda and has a primary school education.  This loan is his fourth from ACB, and he has a good history of repayment.  He will use his loan to purchase a cow for his family.  No difficulties from non-repayment of the loan are expected.  His growth strategy for his business is to settle the balance of the loan and to request another, in order to buy another cow to sell it's milk.  He would like to have a farm, educate his children and put his family in a good state.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos, todos independientes.  La señora  estudió educación secundaria 
Lily se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como chompas para niños y sabanas.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, con su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará telas para la confección de las sabanas y almohadas para venderlas a sus vecinas y amigos. Trabaja sola ya que su esposo es ingeniero economista (realiza proyectos). 
Su sueño es comprar maquinas remalladoras para su confección y crecer en el negocio.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lily is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 55 years old, has a live in spouse and four independent children.  She went to secondary school.

Lily sells clothing, like children’s sweaters, and sheets.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last four years.  She invested her first, 300 new sol, loan in her business.

She will use the new, 500 new sol, loan to buy fabric to make sheets and pillows to sell to her neighbors and friends.  She works alone because her husband is an Economic Engineer (he works on projects).  Her dream is to buy overlock sewing machines for her work and to grow in business.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pillows and sheets.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is a mother of two children who are ages two and seven. The eldest child is in school while the youngest isn’t. Her husband rides a motorcycle to generate income while Emerithe owns a store in which she sells different kind of items such as sugar, soap, sandals, candles, juices, water and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, soap etc in order to make more profits. She plans to begin her house construction with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar, soap, candles etc for sale.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Raeda has two daughters and two sons. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughters. The four children used to share the same room but, now that they are growing up, the children need their own rooms. Raeda's husband is an employee and can't furnish the room from his salary, though he can pay FATEN back on a monthly basis.

Raeda's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman (as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants).

loans.use: to purchase home furniture for her daughters' room.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en: Engracia is married. She lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer, and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Engracia has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de deux enfants. Il exerce l'activité de mareyage qu'il a démarré il y'a sept ans avec des prêts de riches hommes d'affaires qui interviennent dans le secteur de la pêche artisanale comme bailleurs d fonds.Il n'est jamais arrivé à faire des bénéfices consistants du fait du fort taux d'usure appliqué par ses créanciers.En plus, il subissait une très forte pression car devant rembourser globalement en fin de journée tout le montant reçu le matin.Cette exploitation ne lui permettait pas d'avoir les revenus nécessaires pour prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, d'habillement, de logement et de scolarité de sa famille.Pour se libérer des griffes de ces usuriers, il décide d'ouvrir un compte à l'IMCEC.Il obtient un premier prêt de 250 000FCFA sur 12 mois qu'il parvient à solder en 3 mois seulement et l'institution lui laisse les intérêts des 9 mois. C'est ainsi que sa part de marché s’élargit si bien qu'il approvisionne deux usines de traitement de poisson basées dans la capitale non loin de sa localité. Il ambitionne d'ailleurs de s'engager dans l'exportation du poisson frais en Europe et aux USA.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un deuxième prêt de 350 000FCFA afin de satisfaire la forte demande en achetant 03 caisses de badége noir et 03 caisses de "thiof".Les bénéfices tirés de cet investissement serviront non seulement à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille mais participeront aussi à l'atteinte de son objectif à court terme qui est d'acheter et de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to two children. He has a fish trading business which he started seven years ago with loans from rich businessmen who actively back small fishing businesses. He has never been able to make consistent profits as a result of the exorbitant interest rates applied by his creditors. Furthermore he was under huge pressure because he had to pay all the money he took in the morning by the end of the day. This business did not give him sufficient income to provide for his family's food, health, clothing, lodging and schooling. In order to break free from these loan sharks' claws, he decided to open an account with IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual loan and savings institutions). He had a first loan of 250,000FCFA over 12 months which he managed to repay in just three months, and the institution left him the interest for the remaining nine months. His market share has thus grown so much that he supplies two fish-processing factories in the capital not far from his town. His ambition is moreover to get involved in the export of fresh fish to Europe and the USA. Today he is requesting a second loan of 250,000FCFA in order to satisfy strong demand by buying three crates of black "badèches" (a sea fish) and three crates of "thiof" (another fish, common in Senegal). The profits he makes from this investment will be used not only to provide for his family's needs but will also contribute to him achieving his short-term objective which is to buy and construct his own house.

loans.use: to buy 6 boxes of fresh local fish

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 23 years old and is married with one child who is 4 months and she takes care of 2 relatives. She earns a living by selling cloths such as: African women's cloths. This is her eighth year in this business. Her business is well-organized and she operates her business from 8 am until 7 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more women African cloths for resale. By adding more African women's cloths and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business and she will be able to build her own house for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more African women's cloths for resale.

loans.name: Anood

texts.en:
Anood from Madaba, Jordan is a 21-year-old single woman.

Anood is working at an accessories shop. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase fine quality perfumes and cosmetics so that she can book a stand at the shop to sell these products.

An aspiration of Anood's is to open her own cosmetics store.

loans.use: To purchase fine quality perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia is 49 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Ludia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell
